loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Mrs. Minu S. is a resident of Wolkhu, Lalitpur, and attends the microfinance group meeting in Tangal, which is only five minutes away from Wolkhu.  She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business. Her daughter is in grade 11, and her son is in grade 6.

Both Mr. and Mrs. S. are engaged in their own business. For 8 years they have make papads, colorful chips, snacks, and pickles in their own home, which they sell in grocery shops. Their snacks have become very popular. Mrs. S. is requesting her fifth loan of Rs 30000.00 ($400.00) to purchase more ingredients for their business.

loans.use: Ingredients for snacks

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Chhum S. is married and lives with her husband and young child in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She is a midwife who earns $2 a day, while her husband is a village chief who also earns $2 a day.  She would like a loan of $1000 to reinvest with her sister to open a food shop at Phnom Penh. She believes that a food shop can increase their income and raise the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: To open a food shop.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela K. is a single parent with 4 dependants, and she received schooling through junior high.

Sela has been in the fish-selling busines since 1991. More specifically, she buys fish from fishermen, brings the fish home to be processed and preserved, and then sends the fish to the market at Denu near Elmina to be re-sold for a profit. As a single mother, she is solely responsible for paying utility bills, her children's school fees, and other family living expenses. She is now seeking a loan to purchase more fresh fish for processing and resale purposes. She hopes to generate an increase in profits from her business, which she will reinvest back into the business to increase her capital reserves.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fresh fish

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy L. is a villager in the Roka Kdouch Choerng Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing ten more piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family after she sells her pigs. Her husband, Mr. Young Yen, is a construction worker. Mrs. Thy L. is 33 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ten more piglets to breed and later resell and pig food

loans.name: Regina Nantaba Group

texts.en:
Regina N., 48, is the group leader for 5 members; she is a widow and she does not get any assistance from anyone else. She has children aged between 9 and 23 years old. Regina rents a one-roomed house where she stays with her children; she has access to electricity and piped water. She does not care for additional family members, and she normally has one meal a day.

Regina is a tailor and she mainly tailors "gomeses" (Ugandan traditional wear) and school uniforms. She rents a shop where she tailors her clothes and she works six days a week. She normally sews about 3 "gomeses" a day and her customers are mainly women and children. She normally sews materials that customers bring to her, charging them labour costs. And she has done this particular type of business for over 25 years now.

The problem she faces in her business is that of competition; there are many tailors around the place she tailors from. And also her clients normally come seasonally, for example, when schools are opening for the term.

Regina has been a client of MCDT for over 8 years now and she is servicing her 13th loan. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because of the timely loans; she has worked with her group for 8 years now . With this next loan, she wants to buy materials to sell to her customers. She will also use part of it to pay tuition for her children.

Regina wants one day to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: buy fabrics for sale

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa A. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Couturière de formation, elle exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans. Avec ce crédit Yawa souhaite acheter 2 machines à coudre et aussi des tissus et pagnes pour la revente. Cette deuxième activité lui permettra d’augmenter ses recettes et par là améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Yawa A., age 35, is married and the mother of two. A seamstress by training, she has been in this business for three years. With this loan, Yawa would like to buy two sewing machines and also some pagnes (colorful West African cloth) for resale. This second loan will enable her to increase her receipts and thus to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and some cloth for resale

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 21-year-old young woman living in Al Mghayrieh in Mount Lebanon. She produces plastic bags for a local chocolate factory. She has been in this business since 2001. Today, Samar is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy decorative inventory in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: buy decorative inventory

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel A. is the pastor of a church and the proprietor of a school in the community where he lives. His school has created opportunities for the community and is where most parents send their wards to. He has run the school for the last 15 years now. The school has crèche to junior high school level. Right now, the intake is increasing because of the quality tuition the school offers to the public. Samuel has also employed competent teachers who handle the students with care. His only challenge is to find funds to allow the school to expand to accommodate more students.

Samuel is 52-years old, married and a father with five children. Two of his children have finished senior high school, one is still in senior high school, while the rest are in primary school. Samuel belongs to a village bank called Divine.

Samuel needs a loan to build additional classrooms and employ more teachers to handle the students in the future. With this loan, he believes that his dreams can be achieved. Samuel would appreciate your support.

loans.use: To build additional classrooms and employ more teachers

loans.name: Tserendejid

texts.en:
Tserendejid M. is a 37-year-old widow and lives with her two children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children are both local college students. She lives with her two children on the piece of land owned by her parents. They had to move to Tserendejid's parents' place after her husband's recent death.

Tserendejid has a small retail business dealing in women's and men's clothing. She started the retail business with her husband in early 2005. They used to import new trendy clothes from Irkutsk, Russia, a border town where many Russian products pass through, until her husband's death in 2008.

After the loss of her husband, Tserendejid has been renting a small stall in the local Khantalst shopping mall and selling women's underwear imported from China. She now travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where many Mongolian traders purchase their products from, and buys clothing for her business. Her retail business is the only source of income for the family. She would like to raise her two children without any financial constraints. She requests a loan to purchase more underwear from Ereen for her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's underwear

loans.name: Naseem Zahoor Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji, Kaniz fatima baji and Munawar sultana baji each want a loan to buy materials (colored thread, clothes and beads) for preparing embroidered dresses. Mukhtayar baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires, switch boards and switches) for her electric shop.

Naseem baji is a wife of Z. A. who has lived in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Her husband is a driver by profession. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He is a very hardworking man. He drives the vehicle day and night but he couldn't get the reward for his struggle. Naseem baji is a very soft and caring lady. She encourages her husband to fight against the circumstances and never get demotivated. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) so that her husband gets the whole income of his struggle.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its inception, MLF “MicroInvest” became a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC ‘Frontiers”, founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.

“Arvand”, being an assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out the mission of improving the standard of living of the population and creating new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Khairullo A. lives in the Istaravshan region of Tajikistan and he is married and has 4 children. His wife does not work so she brings up their children and she makes traditional dresses that she sells through trading agents. Khairullo makes windows and wood doors, and he also works on a building repair team. Khairullo is a good builder and has repeat customers. Khairullo has applied to KIVA with the request of 3000 STJ to purchase building materials that will permit him to increase the work volume and income. He thanks KIVA for its support of small business development.

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union Fait La Force) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de 7 femmes du quartier  Moussabougou de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso) qui se sont connu depuis des années. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans,  sont mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants.
Elles mènent différentes activités  génératrices de revenus telles la  vente d’habits  et de tasses. Très expérimentées dans leur domaine respectif, les activités de ces femmes marchent bien et elles  sont réellement sollicitées et enviées.  
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres  du groupe Benkadi ont décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents prêts, elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter  un important stock de tasses (thermos, aluminium etc.) et des habits pour  enfants, femmes et adolescents. Elles effectuent leurs ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes.
Elles comptent réaliser en moyenne au cours du cycle 110 000 FCFA. de bénéfice. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille
texts.en:
This "Benkadi" (union makes us strong) group brings together 7 women from the Moussabougou neighborhood of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region) who have known each other for years. They have an average age of 43, are married, and the mothers of at least 6 children.

They have various businesses such as selling clothing and dishes. Very experienced in their respective areas, these women have businesses that are doing well, and they are really in demand and highly thought of.

Wishing to increase the size of their businesses, the members of this Benkadi group decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly reimbursed their two previous loans, they are on their third solidarity loan (group loan).

This loan will be used to buy a big quantity of containers (thermos, aluminum etc.) and clothing for children, women and adolescents. They sell their merchandise retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele essentially made up of women. They expect to make an average profit of 110,000 F CFA over the course of this loan cycle. This profit will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover current expenses for their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and dishes for resale

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a seasoned entrepreneur from Tursunzade, Tajikistan. Married and the mother of three children, she started her business about 13 years ago when she needed to find a job right away and business ownership was her best opportunity. She currently sells a range of men’s shirts at the large central market in Tursunzde. Fotima has a reputation for treating customers with care and kindness, qualities that set her apart from many other businesses that often lack good customer service. Fotima has also proven to be a great client with IMON International, having successfully repaid 6 loans. She has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase new inventory and continue developing her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new mens' clothing to sell

loans.name: Otila

texts.en:
Otila T. is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Lotofaga, Aleipata. She is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Otila cultivates fruit trees and harvests their fruit for sale. Otila earns approximately 450 WST a month. Otila joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This will be Otila's 5th loan from SPBD. She repaid a previous loan of 1750 WST that she used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Her new loan of 2450 WST will also be used to purchase fertilizer. Otila plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. About SPBD
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Na We Yone Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata S., Osman B., Magret K. and Kadiatu S.. They named their group Na We Yone. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small-town which is about twenty-two miles away from Freetown. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT, a partner of Shine On Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. In this way, they will make better profit to look after themselves, children and extended family members. 

Aminata S. (right and attached below) is the leader of the group. She is thirty years of age. She was born in Waterloo. Her husband is a businessman and the two of them have one child who is attending school. Aminata sells ground-nuts, bulgur wheat and beans. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. With this loan, she will buy two bags of beans. A bag costs her Le 250,000.00.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando vive en la calle “5” de la zona  Plan autopista de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive en casa de sus padres,  su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su pequeña hijas como ama de casa. 

El trabaja como chofer propietario de servicio publico en su automóvil en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará para la reparación del motor y otros accesorios de su vehiculo,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Rolando lives on #5 Street in the Plan Autopista district of the city of La Paz. He lives in the house of his parents. His wife is a homemaker who cares for their young daughters.

Rolando works as a private driver. He provides public transport services in his automobile on one of the central routes in the city.

This loan will be used to pay for motor repairs and other accessories for his vehicle. Constant mechanical failures prevent him from working full days.

This is Rolando’s second loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for motor repairs & purchase accessories for his vehicle

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame est mariée à un transitaire et le couple a 03 enfants ; l’année dernière grâce à l’aide de son mari elle s’est lancée dans la vente de charbons de bois au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle arrive à trouver sa part dans ce nouveau commerce où elle parvient à s’imposer. Elle s’approvisionne à Atakpamé, une ville située à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. Elle est fière de pratiquer cette activité qu’elle juge intéressante ; elle dispose déjà une clientèle qui lui est fidèle. Actuellement elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 30 sacs de charbon de bois. Le reste  du prêt servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers Atakpamé.
texts.en:
This young lady is married to a freight broker, and the couple has three children. Last year, thanks to her husband’s help, she got started in selling charcoal at the Grand Market of Lomé. She manages to make a place for herself in this new business, where she is succeeding in becoming established. She stocks up in Atakpamé, a city located dozens of kilometers from Lomé. She is proud of operating in this business, which she finds interesting. She already has a customer base loyal to her. Currently, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to order 30 sacks of charcoal. The rest of the loan will be used to cover the costs of transport to Atakpamé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is widow and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school.  Victoria sells smoked fish and ginger at Elmina near Atabadze, which she has been doing since 1999. Victoria uses her income to in payment of school fees and utility bills.  Victoria will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell to expend her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Victoria plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: Victoria will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell to expend her business.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: In 2005, Walid decided to work as a plumber, installing toilets, faucets etc. as his own business. He is a 31-year-old single man. Having good experience in this field, Walid is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy merchandise and more tools to expand and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and more tools

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: The path that a family takes, whether for good or not, always depends on decisions that the husband and wife jointly make. This has been the experience of Elvira A. of Canonoy, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Elvira is 49 years old and is married with four children who are between 18 and 25 years old. Elvira's husband earns a living by fishing. Years ago, they owned a small unmotorized fishing boat that he had to paddle to go to sea. This was truly hard work, especially during stormy weather when the waves are a lot rougher than usual. But, because he had no other way to earn money to feed and support his family, he determinedly rowed his boat to sea everyday to catch fish, so that Elvira would have something to sell to people in their community and neighboring villages. In 2000, Elvira, with the consent of her husband, decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon so that they could borrow money to improve their income. With the new capital, Elvira opened a small general store so that she could earn a little more. As she made good on her loan repayments and established a good credit record, she was able to borrow larger amounts to improve her income potential. One of their first investments from her loans was a joint decision to buy a motor for their fishing boat so that her husband could reach deeper waters and catch more fish - which he did. The motorized fishing boat and the income from the general store made a big impact on improving their family's quality of life. They currently earn a net monthly income of PHP 8,000 from their two business activities. The fishing business is doing quite well, so that Elvira and her husband are now saving up to buy another motorized fishing boat to increase their income even further. As previously mentioned here, Elvira has kept a good credit record with NWTF-Project Dungganon. In her previous loan she borrowed Php 10,000 as additional capital for their businesses and, as is her usual practice, she was able to pay it off within the loan term and without any delays in the weekly installments. Now she is borrowing Php 15,000 so that they can finally purchase their second motorized boat. The income from it will be used to buy more productive assets so that they can continue improving their family's quality of life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase an additional motorized fishing boat

loans.name: Mariama Siré

texts.fr: Mariama Siré C. est une femme de 24 ans et mère de trois enfants dont une fille. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis trois ans et demi. Elle détient une boutique et son crédit lui servira à la renforcer en marchandises afin de générer des bénéfices assez consistants pour pouvoir aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Siré C., aged 24, is the mother of three children, of whom one is a girl. She has been a member of a village bank for three and a half years. She owns a convenience store. Mariama will use her loan to increase her inventory. She expects to generate enough profit to help her husband to provide for their family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
La señora SARA MARIA A. S. tiene 42años, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú y pertenece al Banco Comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA. 
La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 dependen económicamente de ella. 
María se dedica a la venta de arroz, gaseosa, leche, golosinas, fideos, menestras, fideos, leche, etc. en la tienda que funciona desde su casa y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò productos para abastecerla como: arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, aceite, fideos, menestras, etc. 
En la actualidad solicitarà un crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà un mototaxi para darlo en alquiler y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
Ella sueña con tener una flota de mototaxis.
texts.en:
Sara María A. Sanches is 42 and lives in the Esperanza District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the "Nueva Esperanza" Village Bank. She has a secondary school education, and has a common law husband and five children, four of whom are dependent on her. María earns her living selling rice, soft drinks, milk, candies, noodles, vegetables for stew, etc., from a store she runs in her house. She used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy products to stock her store, including rice, sugar, milk, candies, oil, noodles, vegetables, etc. She is currently seeking a loan for 1500 soles so she can buy a moto-taxi to rent out and earn more income for her family. Her dream is to have a fleet of moto-taxis.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto-taxi

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en: Rochelle raises hogs and grows rice. She is 40 years old and has 2 children. Her business is located in South Cotabato. Because she has limited capital, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000. This will be enough to purchase fertilizer and raise more pigs. She manages 1-3/4-hectare (~4.4-acre) rice field. She wants to improve her standard of living and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Fertilizer and pigs

loans.name: Rosa Luisa

texts.es:
la señora Rosa Luisa B. M. tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene su propio negocio, una pulperia en donde vende ropa, calzado shampoo, perfumenes, productos de limpieza, frescos, y granos
basicos.
tiene varios años de tener su negocio con el cual a podido sacar adelante a su familia, vive muy bien y su casa es muy acogedora.
Rosa es una persona muy alegre y amable. vive con su nuera y su nieto que a caba de nacer.
 
esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio.
se siente muy feliz por el nacimiento de su nieto.
texts.en:
Rosa Luisa B. M. ia 48, single, and has her own business. She has a mini market, where she sells clothes, footwear, shampoo, perfume, cleaning products, soft drinks, and basic grains. She has had her business for several years, and it has enabled her to get her family ahead. She lives very well, and her house is very cozy. Rosa is a happy and friendly person. She lives with her daughter-in-law and her newborn grandson. She is asking for a loan to stock her business. She is very happy about the birth of her grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, rice, sugar, coffee, beans, tortillas, corn and wheat flour, pastas, salsas, and soups

loans.name: Mario Alfonso

texts.es: Mario , es un joven de 28 años, que como él dice, aprendió a ser electricista a en la escuela de la vida y logró perfeccionar este oficio cuando realizó su carrera en el SENA a los 22 años como técnico; por largo tiempo y desde muy temprana edad, trabajó como ayudante de electricidad en talleres informales donde ganó una importante experiencia cuando se arriesgó a hacer trabajos personales y fue así como se dio a conocer; por cosas del destino, salió de su pueblo ubicado en el departamento del Magdalena con su esposa hace 4 años a vivir en Soledad, buscando una vida tranquila y productiva; inicialmente recibió del Gobierno Nacional un primer crédito de $1.000.000, con ese dinero compró repuestos y gradualmente fue agregando, una vitrina que poco a poco fue llenando de mercancías y en este momento cuenta con vitrinas, estantería, un escritorio de trabajo y gran variedad de herramientas para el trabajo diversificado que realiza; pues además de ofrecer sus servicios como electricista, también realiza mantenimiento, reparaciones y adecuaciones domiciliarias, es decir se le mide a todo. Mario está casado y tiene 3 hijos menores entre los 8 y 11 años, su esposa lo acompaña y también trabaja en su pequeña miscelánea que atiende desde su casa y que le da la oportunidad de estar al cuidado personal de sus pequeños hijos, porque eso es lo que proporciona el tener un negocio en el mismo lugar donde se habita. Se inició en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a través de una amiga, que conoce muy bien a esta organización y se ha convertido en promotora de sus beneficios; ella lo recomendó ante el asesor Milgen Sánchez, porque ella sabe que él y su esposa son muy responsables. Esta pareja siempre está en la búsqueda de su crecimiento personal, por eso cuando el Sena trae capacitaciones a su barrio, participan teniendo en cuenta que sea funcional para administrar mejor su negocio. Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación por valor de $ 1.600.000 con el planea comprar una vitrina y surtir el negocio; a Mario le ha gustado estar en la Fundación por la sensibilidad social de sus asesores con ellos pueden ser sinceros para que la ayuda sea más efectiva. Sus sueño es especializarse en electrónica cuando el negocio tome un mayor auge, aumente su mercado y por consiguiente las ventas. Su mayor desafío es obtener una vivienda porque en la actualidad vive en arriendo y tiene la esperanza de acogerse a los programas del estado para adquirirla y no tener que pagar más arriendo. Considera que vive en un barrio muy bueno, porque sus vecinos se quieren y se ayudan mutuamente, además existen muchas organizaciones de base que apoyan a las familias y especialmente está la escuela de sus hijos donde tienen una beca y él es muy agradecido con la escuela, pues la ayuda con lo que el sabe la pinta, le arregla las paredes, hace reparaciones eléctricas, lo que le ha ganado el buen nombre de su directora y del profesorado que apoyan la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario, is 28 years old, and as he says, he learned to be an electrician in the school of life. He managed to improve his skills when he received a technical degree from SENA when he was 22. For a long time, and since he was very young, he worked as an electrician's assistant in informal shops. There he gained valuable experience for when he risked jobs on his own and this was how he learned. For reasons of destiny, he left his hometown located in the department of Magdalena with his wife of four years, to live in Soledad, looking for a calm and productive life. Initially Mario received his first credit of $1,000,000 COP from the National Government. With this money he bought spare parts, which he gradually accumulated, he bought a display case, and little by little he filled it with merchandise. Now he has display cases, shelves, a work bench and a great variety of tools for the various jobs that he does. In addition to the services he offers as an electrician, he also does maintenance work, repairs and remodeling, which he to say he does everything. Mario and his wife have 3 young children between the ages of 8-11 years old. His wife accompanies him and also does her own miscellaneous jobs that she can attend to from their home and which allows her the opportunity to care for their small children, this is the benefit of having a business in the home. They began with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because of a friend that knew the organization well and had become a promoter of its benefits. This friend recommended them to the loan officer, Milgen Sánchez, because she knew that Mario and his wife were very responsible and that the couple is always seeking ways to improve themselves. When SENA brought trainings to their neighborhood, Mario and his wife participated knowing that it would help them to better manage their business. This will be the second credit with the Fundación for the amount of $ 1.600.000 COP. Mario plans to buy a display case and to support the business. Mario has liked working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the social sensitivity of the loan officers because Mario can be sincere with them so that they can help him most effectively. His dream is to specialize in electronics once the business takes off, increasing his inventory and as a result his sales. His greatest challenge is to obtain a home because his family is leasing. He hopes to qualify for the state programs to obtain homes so that he will no longer have to lease. Mario lives in a good neighborhood because his neighbors like his family and they all help each other, what's more there are many organizations that are based there to support families and especially his childrens' school where they receive a scholarship and Mario is very grateful for the school and he helps with the things that he knows how to do like paint, repair the walls and do electrical repairs. He has earned a good reputation with the director of the school and the faculty that educates his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display case and improve the business with various merchandise

loans.name: Tossivi

texts.fr: A. Tossivi est née en 1953 et vit depuis 25 ans à Hlacomey, à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ODO Christian, un transporteur, Tossivi est mère de sept enfants dont seulement deux sont encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Tossivi et son mari se partagent les dépenses familiales.  Tossivi mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois en détail et en gros, elle vend également de l’huile végétale et de l’huile de palme. Tossivi vend ses produits à son domicile mais s’approvisionne à Bassila et à Pahou, tous deux des grands marchés du Bénin. N’ayant jamais fréquenté l’école, Tossivi exerce néanmoins son activité depuis environs 13 ans. Tossivi est une très bonne cliente de ALIDé car ayant reçu déjà sept prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés.  Tossivi souhaite faire un approvisionnement en quantité suffisante pour pouvoir dégager une marge de bénéfice plus importante mais est limitée par les moyens financiers. C’est la raison pour laquelle Tossivi désire obtenir un huitième près auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Tossivi A. was born in 1953, and has been living in the Hlacomey district of Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital, for 25 years. Married to Christian Odo, a transport driver, Tossivi is the mother of seven children, only two of which she still supports. All of her children attend school. The couple lives together with their children. Tossivi and her husband share the family expenses. Tossivi’s business is selling wood charcoal, both retail and wholesale. She also sells vegetable and palm oil. Tossivi sells her products out of her own home, but she does her buying at Bassila and Pahou, two large markets in Benin. Though she never attended school, Tossivi has been managing her business for about 13 years. Tossivi is a great client of ALIDé, because she has received seven loans which have all been paid back. Tossivi would like to buy a quantity of stock large enough to increase her profit margin, but she is limited for financial reasons. This is why Tossivi would like to take out an eighth loan with ALIDé.

Translated from French by Chelsea Rosendale, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 100-kg bags of wood charcoal and bottles of peanut and palm oil

loans.name: Bunnarith

texts.en:
Mr. Bunnarith H. is a motor remoque driver and has been married to Mrs. Sokmoeun Yoy since 1994. A remoque is a motorbike with a trailer at the back. They have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school and the other one is still young. They are living in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bunnarith has already asked for a Kiva loan twice. He now is applying for another loan in the amount of $700 to make a handrail for his house and build a restroom for his family to use.

loans.use: To make a handrail for his house and build a restroom for the family to use.

loans.name: Benilda's Group

texts.en: Benilda Q.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for breeding. She is 50 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Jurisdiccion, Amulung, Cagayan. Benilda has been in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In ____, Benilda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Benilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of ____PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Benilda is the leader of a seven member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Las Picaflores Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Las Picaflores” y está conformado por 15 socias, pertenecientes a la comuna de Padre las Casas en la ciudad de Temuco. Ellas se dedican principalmente a la confección de ropa y accesorios para el hogar, pastelería, paquetería; venta de leña, empanadas y sopaipillas.
La socia entrevistada fue Débora, quien es la presidenta de este banco comunal. En la foto se encuentra en 2º fila, a la derecha y viste chaleco gris y camiseta café. Su negocio consiste en la confección de buzos, los cuales vende para algunos colegios. También confecciona disfraces, vestidos, ropa a pedido en general y accesorios para el hogar entre otros. Quiere invertir este préstamo en comprar géneros, cintas, encajes, blondas e hilos. 
La gran motivación de Débora fue ayudar económicamente a su mamá que estaba muy enferma. Cuando falleció, Débora continuó con su negocio, lo cual le ha ayudado mucho, junto con los talleres y reuniones semanales que tiene con su grupo de Fondo Esperanza, en su desarrollo personal, logrando así superar esta importante pérdida. 
Una de sus metas más cercanas es comprar una máquina bordadora y su sueño es tener un taller de confección establecido en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This village bank is called “Las Picaflores”. It is made up of 15 members from the Padre las Casas county in the city of Temuco. They mainly work making clothes and accessories for the home, baked goods, small business; selling firewood, small pies and fried dough. Débora was the member interviewed. She is the president of this village bank. In the picture she is in the second row to the right and she is wearing a gray jacket and a coffee colored shirt. Her business consists of making sweat suits, some of which she sells to schools. She also makes costumes, dresses and clothes to order in general and home accessories among other things. She wants to invest this loan in purchasing material, ribbon, lace and thread. Débora’s big motivation was to economically help her mother who was very sick. Débora continued with her business when she passed away. This helped her a lot in her personal development, together with the workshops and weekly meetings she has with her group at Fondo Esperanza. She was able to overcome this important loss this way. One of her more immediate goals is to purchase an embroidery machine and her dream is to have an established sewing shop in a central part of the city. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile). It has a series of marshy spas and very colorful vegetation and wildlife. It is worth stating that 50% of the mapuches, indigenous people, that exist in our country are living in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Material, ribbon, lace and thread.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old single man living with his family in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. He has been working as a car mechanic in his village since 2008, having learned this occupation from his previous work. 

Since he opened his garage, Ahmad’s business operation has grown. Thus, he wants to take a loan to buy additional new and sophisticated tools for his garage. These will allow him to improve his work efficiency. With his business income, he provides, along with his father and brothers, for the living expenses of the family.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: La Sra. Leticia es una persona joven, alegre y muy trabajadora. Esta casada, ella tiene una tienda donde vende accesorios, repuestos y celulares, pero además realiza mantenimiento y reparación de celulares. Ella tomo algunos cursos donde aprendió esta actividad. Su esposo, Freddy, trabaja como empleado en una fabrica de textiles desde hace tres años. Ellos viven en una casa de alquiler en la zona de Pampahasi, zona que se encuentra a 25 minutos del centro de la ciudad. Tienen dos pequeños hijos a quienes quieren mucho, el mayor tiene cuatro años y el siguiente año estará en kínder. Uno de los mayores anhelos de Leticia y Freddy es ahorrar lo suficiente para poder comprar una casita. Leticia trabajó con nuestra institución un préstamo anterior en el cuál demostró ser muy puntual y responsable con sus pagos. En una ocasión sufrió un robo en su tienda, pero ella no se rindió y siguió trabajando. Actualmente, ella continúa trabajando y espera poder ver a sus hijos como profesionales. En este momento solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su tienda.  Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Leticia is young, cheerful, and hardworking. She's married and has a shop where she sells cell phones, cell phone accessories, and spare phone parts; her shop also offers cell phone maintenance and repair. She took courses to learn these activities. Her husband, Freddy, has worked in a textile factory for three years. They live in a rented house in the neighborhood of Pampahsi, 25 minutes from the center of the city. They have two small children whom they love very much. The oldest is 4 years old and next year he will begin kindergarten. One of Leticia and Freddy's dreams is to save enough money to be able to buy a small house. Leticia worked with our institution for a previous loan and proved herself to be very punctual and responsible with the repayment. On one occasion she suffered a robbery in her shop, but she didn't give up and kept working. Currently she continues to work and hopes that her children will be able to work as professionals when they grow up. At this moment she is asking for a loan to add more things to her store. She's very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they extend by granting loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chargers and batteries

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Vilma, ella tiene 35 años la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella compra y vende productos secos en Urubamba en el mercado central; el esposo de nuestra socia trabaja en la agricultura y la socia también se dedica a criar animales menores (cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral, gallinas y pollos). Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos para llevar a abastecer su stand en el mercado en Urubamba.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Colquecancha communal bank; she lives in the community of Raqchi, Urubamba province, Cusco. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. She does housework and works in the retail trade. She buys and sells dry goods in Urubamba at the central market. Her husband works in agriculture and she also takes care of small animals (guinea pigs, pigs and fowl: hens and chickens). Vilma is requesting this loan to invest in dry goods to stock her stand in the Urubamba market. She thanks all of the investors who are making this dream possible, and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry goods for the market

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime, de 31 años, es soltero y  vive en la casa de sus padres.Desde hace algunos años es profesor de un colegio secundario, pero también  es agricultor y lo dice orgulloso, pues lleva 15 años dedicado al cultivo de papa, de diferentes variedades. Los fines de semana  en su tiempo libre siembra con la ayuda de su padre. En la actualidad, lo que más le gusta de su chacra es mantenerla limpia, sin embargo, le disgusta cuando las inclemencias del tiempo o las plagas atacan sus sembríos de papa. Como es una persona de retos, que desea salir adelante, ha pensado en iniciar un proyecto – sembrar yuca – producto que crece en la selva, y también para  más adelante, quiere comprarse  una hacienda ganadera.Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le agrada laborar en su banco comunal, porque esta integrado por personas muy responsables y honestas como él.Jaime tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes que necesita para la próxima siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Jaime is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents. For a few years he has been a high school teacher, but he is proud to say he is also a farmer. For fifteen years, he has grown a many varieties of potatoes. In his free time on the weekends, he tends his crops with the help of his father. Right now, what he likes most about his work is keeping his field tidy. He really dislikes it when bad weather and insects affect his crops. As he is a person with goals and is determined to get ahead, he is thinking about beginning a new project, planting the native crop yuca. In the future he would like to buy a cattle farm. This is Jaime’s fourth loan from MFP, and he enjoys working with his communal bank because it is comprised of responsible and hard-working people like him. Jaime plans to invest this loan in the purchase of bags of fertilizer that he needs the for next time he plants potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeun S. is 26 years old married woman and is a villager who lives in Daeum Rumdael village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Thoun Houn, are farmers who own a 2.30-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice who able to earn for their family's standard of living. For this farm, Mrs. Yoeun S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming crop. This couple has two children, who all are attending in the local school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Surenhuu

texts.en:
Surenhuu D. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and seven children in Hovd province, western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house. Her husband works as a driver for a local private company. 

Surenhuu operates a flour retailing business in her town. She started her business in 1998 and over the years, Surenhuu has worked hard to build a stable business operation and has gained much experience. Her business is very important to her and her family, because she pays for three children's tuition fees with the earnings of her business. 

Surenhuu is an open-minded, easy-going and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Maria Guidella

texts.en:
Maria Guidella A. is a 51-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a general store.  She lives in Prk.Uga, Brgy. Maaslob, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 16,000.00. 

Maria Guidella is now borrowing PHP Php 22,000.00 to increase her working capital. This will be her 22nd cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 22,000.00, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria Guidella aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José tiene 31 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi, hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar sus ingresos para su familia. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, por lo que todos los días recorre muchos lugares para dejar a sus clientes en la puerta de su hogar. El está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de comprar llantas, lonas, asientos para remodelar su bicicleta. Algo que mantiene a sus clientes es el buen servicio que ofrece.
texts.en:
Francisco José is 31-years-old. His economic activity is providing the service of his trike taxi. He's had this business for more than 8 years, and he's always thinking of how to improve his family's income. He has two young children. Everyday he travels to many places to drop his customers off at the doors of their homes. He's requesting this loan with the objective of buying tires, canvas, and a new seat to renovate his bike so that he can continue to offer good service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat G. lives with his wife and two daughters in Hovd province, western Mongolia. His wife is a construction dealer in a company and his two daughters both attend a university.
Munhbat operates a firewood and charcoal selling business at a local market in his town. He has many years of firewood and charcoal trading business experience. Because he started his business in 2006. During the summer season, his business sales are low so he helps his wife with her work. If he receive an order for charcoal, he sells it. 
Now Munhbat received an order for charcoal from Shim Us Co. Ltd. and therefore he needs to have enough funds to supply his orders. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more coal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more coal to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline N. is a 27-year-old single lady. She sells shoes in Timboni in Malindi. Her business has been in operation for the past year.

Jackline is taking her first loan of 40,000 KES from KADET to which she was introduced by another client who is a member of KADET. The lady wishes to expand her business by adding more stock in order to satisfy her ever-increasing number of clients.

Jackline hopes to grow her business so that one day she will own a well-established boutique that will serve her clients in Timboni and elsewhere.

loans.use: To add more inventory to her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a widowed woman with two children, aged 24 and 36. One of her children graduated from school and the other attends university. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food and electricity.
For over 24 years, Evelyn has operated a food stall and also sold fresh water to neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the dry summer season, the supply of food is low and demand rises. During the rainy winter season, the supply of food is high and demand decreases. She also faces the challenge of water rationing by the water supply companies. She hopes to improve her business and own a retail shop in the future.
Evelyn decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business. With this 40,000 KES loan, she wants to start a retail kiosk where she will be selling sugar, maize, wheat flour and washing soap.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour, sacks of sugar and washing soap

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim B. has dedicated himself to the raising of livestock. He is married and a father with the necessity of supporting his three children. His children help him with the business. Ibrahim is faced with the need to purchase calves. In order to then commercialize the derivative products, the raised animals are sold to farmers who resupply the small farmers with calves. To acquire the animals, Ibrahim got a 1000 AZN loan to purchase them and in this way continue to maintain his dear household.

loans.use: purchase 3 heads of cattle

loans.name: Narmandah

texts.en: Narmandah L. is 44 years old and a single mother who lives with two adult children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her youngest daughter attends university, while she operates a construction material trade business in a stall at Narantuul, the largest and main market in the city. She has been engaged in this business since 1990, right after the opening of Narantuull market, and has since gained many years of experience. She is planning to expand her business and have her own shop where she can sell her products in the future. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Messi

texts.en:
Messi N., age 18, has operated a poultry business for the past several months. She lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children.      
 
To help expand her business, Messi has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Messi hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Messi hopes to become a tailor.

Messi is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Josilyn Y.

texts.en:
Josilyn Y. S. is from the village of Malintubuan in Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 36 years old. Josilyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josilyn owns & operates a fishing business where she harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Josilyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Josilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Josilyn is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Josilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Flormira

texts.es:
Flormira es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el sector La Pradera, una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Pimentel. Se encuentra situada a quince minutos de la ciudad de  Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 18 años a la venta de avena y soja preparada en el mercado Moshoqueque. Ella prepara todos los días estas bebidas y las ofrece en venta por litros a sus clientes. Usualmente la venta empieza diariamente durante las primeras horas de la mañana ya que estas bebidas son consumidas principalmente durante el desayuno. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia.

Flormira desea adquirir más soja para ampliar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Flormira is a 37 year-old mother who lives with her husband and young child in La Pradera, a marginal urban area of Pimentel district, fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 18 years, Flormira has been selling 'avena y soya preparada' (oat- and soy-based drinks) in Moshoqueque market.  She prepares these drinks every day and offers them for sale by the liter to her customers.  She sells her drinks every day and usually starts very early in the morning since they are mainly consumed with breakfast.  Her business is an important source of income for her family.

Flormira would like to acquire more soya to expand her business and fulfil the demand which she has.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more soya to expand her business

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush V. has been trading in clothing since 1995. Siranush is a widow. After the husband’s death, she gave her property to her son.  Her son lives with his wife abroad and left his mother without a home. Siranush does not own her place and is renting a small place on the city’s outskirts. This hardworking woman with perfect credit history has applied to SEF for a loan to order her pre-Holiday inventory stock.

loans.use: To order inventory stock

loans.name: Nche

texts.en:
G. was born in 1970. She is married to Nche Michael Nji and they are blessed with five children. She and her family share five rooms in Ndamukong, a quarter of Bamenda in the North West Region of Cameroon. G. has had great difficulties in her life, such as ill-health, failure to attain quality education and the sudden death of her sister-in-law which led to the adoption of a 5-day-old child. Amongst other challenges, she needs more capital to be able to continue with her projects and personal life.

With this loan, G. plans to cultivate maize, beans, yams, cassavas, and huckleberries. She also intends to buy improved maize seeds and yams for her farm plot and stock petrol and firewood to sell. The loan will help her community because they will be able to buy petrol and firewood at affordable quantities and prices. G. will reinvest her profit into her business and use a fraction of it to pay for her children's education and upgrade her standard of living. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow-up and the moderate interest rate. ABOUT GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings, firewood and petrol

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is 31 years old. She has three children. The youngest is two years old and the eldest is seven years old. Dativa has a shop where she sells different things like beans, potatoes, tomatoes and many more. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more beans and complete her house repayments. She plans to buy food for her family and renovate her house from the profits she hopes to obtain from this business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and complete her house repayment.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Maria Gloria C.: D. 31 años tiene 4 hijos trabaja todos los dias vendiendo cortes tipicos, joyas, para asi ayudar con sus ganancias a su familia, ya que sus hijos estan en epoca escolar, ella dice que los quiere ver que sean personas D. bien para satisfaccion D. su familia,solicita el credito para compra D. ropa tipica por mayor y asi obtener mejores ganancias, su sueño es poder tener un lugar o local donD. vender su mercaderia y ya no vender ambulantemente ella D. da Gracias a dios porque tiene mucha clientela y espera ir creciendo mas cada dia.
texts.en: Maria Gloria C., 31 years old, has 4 children.  She works every day selling typical clothing and jewelry in order to help with her family's income now that her children are school-age.  She says that she wants to see them be good people.  For the satisfaction of her family, she asks for a loan to buy traditional clothing in bulk and thereby increase her income.  Her dream is to have a store or other place to sell her merchandise and not have to sell door-to-door anymore.  She gives thanks to God because she has a lot of customers and expects to continue growing more every day.

loans.use: Buy traditional clothing in bulk

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria D. is from the village of Estrella, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 41 years old and the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl, es natural del distrito de San Francisco, tiene 30 años de edad, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, esta casado con Teofila de 30 años y fruto del inmenso amor que se tienen concibieron 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa, ubicada en el sector Colegio del distrito de San Francisco. Raúl, empezó su aventura como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro lo llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 11 años de manera independiente; en el cual viene cultivando  plantas de cacao y hojas de coca. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido; cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias,  impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando los frutos. El crédito solicitado es para que pueda comprar más plantaciones de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará plantaciones de cacao para luego injertarlos.
texts.en:
Raúl, a native of San Francisco district, is 30 years old. He is a very happy and hard-working young man. He is married to 30 year-old Teofilia and they have three children, the fruit of their immense love. They all live together in their own house, located in the Colegio sector of San Francisco district.

Raúl got his start as a farmer in his parents' fields when he was very young. His passion for agriculture led him to acquire his own land, where he has been working independently for 11 years. He cultivates cocoa plants and coca leaves in his fields. At harvest time, he counts on the help of laborers to pick both crops with greater speed, so that he can complete the work more quickly. He feels very committed to his work, and thanks to his daily efforts, today he is able to see the fruits of his labor. He earns a good profit for each kilogram of product sold.

He explains that the winter season is not to his liking because in those months there is an abundance of insects and rain, which keep him from doing his work and can damage his crops.

The requested loan will be used to buy more cocoa plants, which he will then graft in order have good results in little time. For now he is prioritizing the purchase of new lands to expand his planting and increase his production. This is his second loan through MFP and he is prepared to make all of his repayments punctually, as he would like to be able to access more credit in the future. He is a very beloved member of his communal bank. He will use the 2,000 nuevos soles he is requesting to buy cocoa plants that he will then graft in.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Salim has operated a business for over ten years recording VCDs for resale from door to door in his community. Salim faces a major challenge with delayed payments by those who purchase on credit. He dreams of owning a studio recording shop in the future. 

With the requested 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase more empty VCDs for recording and reselling at a profit. Salim decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance, because it has no legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase empty VCDs for recording and reselling at a profit

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 64 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Por la mayoría de su vida, trabajó para la marina de Perú. En su jubilación, Ricardo comenzó un negocio alquilando cuartos en las casas de las cuales el es dueño. Alquila a los estudiantes, los viajantes y los empresarios que pasan por su comunidad por un breve período de tiempo. Desea hacer unos arreglos en algunos de sus cuatros para poder brindar un mejor servicio a los pensionistas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar 500 nuevos soles. Con los ingresos de su negocio, puede continuar a sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 64, lives with his wife and children in his own house in Olmos District, an agricultural zone with quite a bit of commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For most of his life he worked for Peru’s Navy.  Once retired, Ricardo started a business renting out rooms in houses he owns.  He rents to students, travelers and businessmen who pass through his community for short periods of time.

He’d like to do some repairs to some of his rooms to provide better service to his tenants.  Because of this he thought it convenient to request a 500 new sol loan.  He can continue to support his family with income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his rental units.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S., 50, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia. She sells cow ties, earning an income of about 8.3 USD per day. She has 2 children; one is a laborer and the other a grocer, earning an income of about 2.3 USD each per day. Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food, 5 USD on utility expenses and 90 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to produce rice wine and raise pigs. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to produce rice wine and raise pigs

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felipa; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de venta de artesanía y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas y el negocio de las artesanías trabaja desde las 8:30 hasta las 6:00 p.m, ella vende en la plaza de armas de chinchero, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía y venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Mateo Pumacahua". It is located in the district of Chinchero, belonging to the province of Urubamba and to the department of Cusco.

Her name is Felipa. She is 38 years old, married, and she has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her crafts store and she also raises livestock, such as guinea pigs, pigs, and poultry. She opens her crafts store business from 8:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She makes her sales at the Armas Plaza in Chinchero. She wants to expand her crafts sale business and her livestock sales business. She requests a loan to purchase crafts in wholesale and feed for the livestock.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase crafts in wholesale and to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is 34 years old and has given birth to four sons.  Her eldest son is a motor mechanic while the 2nd one is a tailor. The other two stay at home. Shamim could not educate them because of meager financial resources. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to passengers and earns income for the family. 

Shamim is very supportive lady by nature. She knows that alone her husband is unable to meet the financial requirements of his family that’s why she helps him by selling clothes. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. She makes the utmost effort for providing comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk and of different varieties which helps her to fulfill the orders of her clients and earn good profits.   She is expecting that after the loan investment her business will improve and her family’s income will increase, and that will help them have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Esther

texts.es:
Sonia Esther tiene 42 años, es soltera, vive con los hijos  vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Sonia Esther se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz y soya. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener mas ingresos para educar a los hijos.

Dsifruta mucho saliento a caminar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia Esther is 42 years old, single and lives with her children.  She lives in the precinct of Agua Clara in the Chillanes canton.  

The communal bank Santa Rosa de Agua Clara is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It is made up of 20 members who work in agriculture growing cocoa and yuca as well as working in business.  

Sonia Esther works in agriculture and grows cocoa, corn and soy.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and sells at the Sunday markets in Chillanes.  

The loan will help her to buy agricultural supplies and thereby, help her to increase her production.  She has faced challenges such as illness among the workers, insects and crop diseases.  Her dream is to increase her income in order to educate her children.   

She really enjoys taking walks with her children.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es parte de la junta directiva de la empresa de Crédito Comunal El Encanto de Pital.
Ella está solicitando en este momento un préstamo de ₡ 400 000 
(cuatrocientos mil colones)  para la compra de una computadora portátil  y de una impresora multifuncional para facilitar las operaciones de crédito de la empresita. 
Ella asegura que la demanda de crédito a aumentado muchísimo y que por eso es necesario invertir en tecnología para que la empresita crezca.
Doña Elvira asegura que la empresa ha traído muchísimas oportunidades para los habitantes de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the board of directors of the El Encanto de Pital community loan company.  She is requesting a loan for 400,000 colones to buy a laptop and a multifunction printer to facilitate the company's loan operations.

Elvira assures us that demand for loans has increased a lot and, for that reason, it is necessary to invest in technology so that the small company can grow.  She assures us that the company has brought many opportunities to the residents of her community.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Estelle Rajy

texts.fr:
