Femme de 33ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant âgée d'une année, ayant arrête ses études en terminale et n'ayant plus de soutien financier elle se lance dans le commerce en 2009. Son revenu journalier a augmenté  de 50000frs à 100000frs par jour. 

A l'octroi de son troisième prêt, elle compte approvisionner son stock en ajoutant des cartons de viande et de cuisse de poulet, poissons frais, volailles, condiments, cartons de tomate, bidon d'huile... 

Elle s'approvisionne dans les chambres froides et marches de la place, toujours prêt a réserver un bon accueil a ses clients, offrir ses meilleurs services, faire des prix abordables, et respecter les heures d'ouverture de son resto son ses priorité.

Nous avons constaté que son activité s’est élargie ainsi que ses prestations car elle à maintenant plusieurs plats qu’elle offre à ses clients et ceux grâce au second prêt qu’elle avait obtenu. Pour  l'avenir elle pense ouvrir un grand restaurant et épargner plus, pour soutenir son enfant et acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
This is a 33-year-old unmarried woman who is the mother of a 1-year-old child. Having dropped out of her senior year of high school and having no more financial support, she started working in commerce in 2009. Her daily income has increased from 50,000 to 100,000 francs per day. 

Upon being granted her third loan, she intends on stocking up by including boxes of meat and chicken thighs, fresh fish, poultry, condiments, boxes of tomatoes, containers of oil… 

She gets her supplies from cold rooms and local markets. Always ready to accommodate her customers, her priorities are to offer her best service and affordable prices and to keep to her hours of operation at her restaurant.

We have noticed that her business has expanded, as well as her range of offerings, because she now has several dishes she offers customers, thanks to the second loans she had obtained. For the future, she is thinking of opening a big restaurant and saving more money, so as to support her children and to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy chicken thighs, fresh fish, and poultry

loans.name: Julio Ricardo

texts.es:
Julio es un cliente de 61 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador que vive en el distrito de Chepén en La Libertad. El lugar donde vive Julio se encuentra en la ciudad y es una zona tranquila.

Julio se dedica a la producción y venta de pan. Esta actividad la realiza desde su propio domicilio y lleva más de 15 años de experiencia en ella, lo que lo ha llevado a tener una clientela establecida. 

Julio desea invertir en su negocio y por eso solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la reparación de su horno artesanal, en la compra de manteca para sus panes y en el acondicionamiento de su puesto.

Con este préstamo Julio desea aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. Él aspira a tener la mejor panadería de la zona y no se encuentra muy lejos de esa realidad.

Julio es un cliente con más de 9 créditos cancelados con puntualidad, que nuestra entidad le ha brindado y que le han servido para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio is a 61 year old client.  He is a hard-working man, and he lives in the Chepén district in La Libertad.  The place where Julio lives is in the city, and it is a peaceful area.

Julio makes and sells bread.  He does this from his own home.  He has over 15 years of experience, and this has led him to have regular customers.

Julio wishes to invest in his business.  That is why he is requesting a loan for 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the loan to repair his oven, to buy shortening for his bread, and to refurbish his place.

With this loan Julio wishes to increase his income in order to improve his quality of life.  He aspires to have the best bakery in the area, and it will not be very long before this is true.

He is a client with over nine loans from Edpyme Alternativa, which he has punctually paid back.  The loans have served him in the development of his business.

loans.use: to repair his oven and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 58 years old. She is married and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Magdalena runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running this business for 8 years. She also earns an income from raising livestock and vending food.  

Magdalena has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory for her customers and to use as working capital. She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan.  

Magdalena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 57 years old, and lives in Plaridel. She is married with four children. 
Delia has a cloth-selling business, and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. 
Delia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Delia hopes to have a concrete house.

loans.use: To purchase cloths to sell

loans.name: Berna

texts.es: Berna es socia del Banco comunal Llapanchik, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 13 años, Berna es feriante compra reces para vender, ahora invertirá el préstamo en la compra de reces en cantidad. Se inició en el negocio con poco capital, ahora gracias al apoyo que ha recibido con los préstamos tiene una chacra, tambien  tiene toros, vacas y un terreno por construir, le encanta las reuniones del Banco Comunal, ha invitado a participar a sus hijas, gracias a las reuniones ha aprendido a ser mas responsable y a ahorrar.
texts.en: Sonia is a member of the Llapanchik Communal Bank. She has 3 children and is a trader. She buys and sells small animals as well as grains. She will use the requested loan to purchase more animals for resale. Sonia has been with FINCA for 11 years. She is very grateful for the training because she learned to save money and to be more responsible. It also helped her to be a better person and a better mother.

loans.use: to purchase animals.

loans.name: Faustino Manuel

texts.es: Faustino tiene 45 años y 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. El es una persona que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica como es una farmacia. Además como padre responsable por lo que sus 2 hijos tenían que comer y estudiar, el realizo muchos sacrificios. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pastillas, gotas, vitaminas, inyecciones y algodones.
texts.en: Faustino is 45 years old and has 2 children who work and are independent.  He is a person who has always liked to get ahead.  He has had a pharmacy for more than 10 years.  In addition, as a responsible father, he has made many sacrifices to feed and educate his children.  He is requesting this loan so that he can buy pills, drops, vitamins, injections and cotton wool.

loans.use: to buy pills, drops, vitamins, injections and cotton wool

loans.name: Los Claveles 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana enjoys working both at home and in her business. She is a member of a group named Los Claveles, or The Carnations. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

Ana is excited to be participating in her first group loan with Esperanza. Her group is dedicated to doing business around its community and other villages selling such things as food, clothes, shoes, cosmetics, underwear and many other products.

Ana started selling boiled beans three months ago. She now sells boiled beans (like the ones that are canned) and fried rounds maD. of flour, a very popular item especially in fried food stalls. She will use her portion of this loan to buy beans, flour, cooking oil, butter, eggs, ham, cheese, charcoal, etc.

Ana plans to reinvest her profits in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy beans, flour, cooking oil, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Yieng

texts.en:
Yieng (in the photo with her loom) and her husband, Pao, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children - one son and four daughters. 

Yieng is a weaver, and her husband is a fisherman who raises cows at home. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Nestor Ivan

texts.es:
Nestor Ivan tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Nestor  se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realiza  en san Juan.  

Solicita el crédito para poder dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao para que el producto salga de mejor calidad.

 El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar los cultivos y obtener utilidades al momento de vender los productos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente es la competencia y la plaga. El sueño es poder estar siempre junto con la familia y por ello salir a delante.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear por el campo con los padres.
texts.en:
Nestor Iván is 19, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province.

He’s a member of the “Cevallos” communal bank that’s located in Recinto San Francisco that is part of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish in Ventanas. They make their living growing cacao. Nestor grows cacao, and does his buying and selling in San Juan.

He is applying for the loan to maintain his cacao crop, so that the product will be of better quality. The loan will be a big help to him in improving his crops, and in making a profit at the time he sells his products. The challenges that often arise are competition, and pests.

His dream is to be with the family always, and in this way get ahead in life. In his free time, he likes to go for walks in the countryside with his parents.

loans.use: To maintain his cacao crop.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. In order to help his parents pay the life expenses, Hasan has worked in a small supermarket since 2005. At the same time, he is pursuing his education studying Business Administration, and this is his last year. Today, he is asking to borrow 1,000 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his courses at the university. Hasan is very ambitious and looks forward to begin working in a large company in order to gain income and be able to better support his family financially.

loans.use: to pay for his courses at the university

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard wants another loan facility to buy radios, hair extensions, and watches for resale in his retail shop. He feels this will enable him to accumulate capital to start up his dream wholesale shop. His goal is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy radios, hair extensions, and watches for resale.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, 32, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. Chanthorn is a housewife, and her husband operates his motorbike with a trailer attached to provide transportation services. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Chanthorn is requesting a loan of USD 850 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate the business more efficiently. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently

loans.name: Tafao

texts.en:
Tafao, 63, is married with three children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Tafao needs a loan of $1,500 Samoan Talas (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST or $167 US per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Tafao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tafao's third loan with SPBD.

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Bérétchissou

texts.fr:
Bérétchissou est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 1 enfant de 32 ans.
Bérétchissou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1986. Elle vend des tissus pour tous clients. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Bérétchissou a requis son crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Bérétchissou voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Bérétchissou is a 47 year old woman. She is married to a driver. She has one child who is 32 years old. Bérétchissou has worked as a retailer since 1986. She sells fabrics to all clients. She purchases the products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties. Bérétchissou has requested a WAGES loan in order to buy fabrics. She wants to reinvest in the business. In the next years, Bérétchissou would like to increase her business. She says that with her profits, she plans to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Isabel; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de chompas de alpaca, la socia también teje ella compra al por mayor lanas y las teje y sigue llevando a sus diferentes clientes. La socia desea a futuro tener una empresa formada y ampliar sus ventas, contratar personal para que le ayude  en los tejidos o maquinas para hacerlo de forma industrial. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de lanas de alpaca para realizar las chompas.
texts.en: Isabel continues her business of buying and selling alpaca wool sweaters.  She also buys yarn in quantity, knits, and delivers to her different customers.  In the future she would like to have a factory, expand her sales, hire people to help her knit or buy machines to automate the process.  She’s asking for this loan to invest in alpaca yarn to knit sweaters.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 57-year-old single woman with two children. She has been running a greengrocery for the past five years and makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.
Lucia is applying for her first loan with Kiva partner KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET client. Lucia will use the loan to buy a stock of green vegetables and fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to university level and open a retail shop, which will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy a stock of green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: La Ponderosa (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Ponderosa está formado por 8 socias y un socio quienes viven por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, su arquitectura es una mezclada entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestras socias son personas amables, gentiles y carismáticas, se caracterizan por ser personas luchadoras, emprendedoras y siempre ven en cada día una nueva oportunidad para salir en adelante conjuntamente con sus familias. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Miriam, tiene 34 años, está separada de su esposo y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Miriam es de profesión estilista y labora en un salón de belleza que es propio, se encuentra en el negocio hace 6 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como son tintes, shampoo, gel, y otros productos de belleza para su local. 

Su meta es tener un Spa.
texts.en:
“La Ponderosa” (The Pine Tree) communal bank is composed of 1 male and 8 female members who live in the Monay sector of Cuenca city. This city is also known as Santa Ana de los 4 Rios (Santa Ana of the 4 Rivers). Its architecture is mixed colonial and modern and its people maintain their culture and the traditions of their villages. The members are kind, gentle, and charismatic people, known for being determined, entrepreneurial, and they always see in each day a new opportunity to get ahead together with their families.

One member of this group is Miriam, 34 years old, who is separated from her husband. While married, she gave birth to a son, now 8 years old, who studies in a small school in the city. She owns the house in which they live.

Miriam is a hair stylist by profession and works in her own beauty salon. She has been in the business 6 years and works Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 am until 8:00 at night.

This is Miram's 3rd loan through her communal bank and she will invest it in purchasing products such as hair coloring, shampoo, gel, and other beauty products for her salon. Miriam's goal is to have her own spa.

loans.use: buy hair coloring, shampoo, gel, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en: Mwanahamisi is 20 years old. She is not married, and she lives in Bagamoyo district. Mwanahamisi is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers in her nearby secondary school, helping students to improve their performance. Mwanahamisi has no business, and she has requested a Kiva loan to start a business selling women's clothes in her community. She plans to use profits obtained from the loan to expand her business and pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to start a business selling women's clothes in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Faaasu

texts.en: The most common source of income in Samoa is growing produce. The majority of families rely heavily on their land and selling their produce to earn a living. Faaasu grew up on a plantation and now grows and sells bananas. Her business is successful because she supplies several markets. She sells once a week at the local market. Her price varies according to the number of banana sellers at the market. When there are many banana sellers, she reduces her price. But when there are few sellers and high demand, she can charge more. She also sells to local businesses that produce snacks made from bananas, like banana chips. Selling bananas is a most successful business in Samoa because of the numerous buyers, some of them producing for overseas markets. Samoans overseas love snacks made from Samoan bananas. Faaasu is requesting a capital loan for $875.00 to increase her banana yield organically.

loans.use: To purchase banana planting materials, organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Sandra is a widow and has four kids. Her husband died five years ago, and to keeper her family moving forward and educate her children, one of her uncles loaned her a business site, where she now makes clothing. One of her daughters helps her, and together they have been able to make the business grown. The family bond and quality of service has played a fundamental role in developing the success of this sowing shop.

Sandra is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase supplies and sowing equipment. She plans to repay the loan within five months. You can contribute to the growth of this business and the well being of Sandra and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Sandra es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos. Hace cinco años falleció su esposo y para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles estudio, unos tíos de Sandra le prestaron un local en el que ahora tiene su negocio, donde confecciona y elabora ropa, en este negocio recibe la ayuda de una de sus hijas y juntas han logrado hacerlo crecer. La unión familiar y la calidad del servicio que ofrecen ha sido una pieza fundamental en el desarrollo exitoso de este taller de costura.

En estos momentos requiere de un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que utiliza en la elaboración de la ropa, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Con tu ayuda contribuyes al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de Sandra y su familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and equipment

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawa S. is a very active fifty-year-old woman. She is a married mother of eight (8) children who also takes care of three (3) other people. Her husband is often absent and leaves the responsibility for the household up to her. Her main business activity is market gardening, and she sells her produce herself at the market in order to meet her childrens' needs. In order to increase the size of her business, she is requesting a loan of $800 to buy fertilizer and improve her land.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 50 ans, Madame S. Yawa est très active. C’est une femme mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants et a à sa charge trois (3) autres personnes. Le mari est toujours absent et laisse toutes les charges sur la femme. Elle a pour activité principale le maraîchage et c’est la vente de ces produits qu’elle vent elle-même au marché afin d’assumer les besoins de ses enfants. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter des engrais et améliorer ses terres.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is 50 years old. She has a big family. She has 4 children. Three of them live in Argentina with relatives. The fourth one works along with his dad in Zofraco. Cristina takes care of one of her grandchildren.

Cristina sells 'chicha' from her house. She also sells marinated and fried pork meat on the weekends. She raises pigs which she then sells the meat at the local market. She has a lot of experience since this is a family traD. that has been passed from generation to generation.

She has been very successful in her business since not many people in her area do this kind of thing compared to selling chicha and homemaD. food. She will use the loan to purchase some pigs between 176-198 lbs. valued at $600 bolivares. She would like to make her business grow by purchasing more pigs and by selling more pork meat.

This is her second loan with our institution. She has a great credit history which makes her a great candidate for a loan. She was not at home at the time the pictures were taken.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina es una persona D. 50 años D. edad, tiene una familia muy numerosa, su familia esta conformada por 4 hijos D. los cuales tres se encuentran en la Argentina con familias, el cuarto hijo trabaja junto al padre en ZOFRACO. Cristina esta a cargo D. uno D. sus nietos. Cristina se dedica al comercio D. chicha en su domicilio, también venD. los fines D. semana chicharron y escabeche, paralelamente a este negocio se dedica a la crianza D. chanchos para su posterior venta en el mercado, tiene mucha experiencia ya que son negocios heredados D. familia. La cliente tiene mucho éxito con su negocio ya que en la zona la compra y venta D. chanchos son pocas personas las que tienen este negocio, pero si vale recalcar que la venta D. chicha y comida tiene mucha competencia debido a que existen gran cantidad D. personas que realizan esta actividad. Con la presente solicitud comprara varios chanchos entre 80 a 90 kgr los cuales como ganado porcino parado tienen un costo D. Bs. 600 cada uno, la compra la realiza para incremenar su negocio tanto para reproducir como para comercializar su carne. Esta es su segunda secuencia crediticia dentro D. nuestra insititucion su porcentaje D. morosidad es menos del 1% es una buena cliente. Se hace notar que la cliente no se encontraba en su domicilio cuando se fué a sacar las fotos.

loans.use: Compra de Chanchos (to purchase pigs)

loans.name: Ni Komang Kantri

texts.id:
Buy & sell cocoa beans is an occupation since one year. Ni Komang Kantri works by travelling to people's houses to buy dried cocoa beans. In one day Ni Komang Kantri buys around 200 kg (about 440 lbs) of cocoa beans, with a profit of Rp 50,000 (about US$5.25)/day. With enthusiasm, and untiringly Ni Komang Kantri runs this business. Her husband I Ketut Denia, is not sitting still to see his wife persistance. I Ketut Denia also works for family household needs. Loan for capital very much help Ni Komang Kantri to add the amount of cocoa beans she could buy, so that profit would increase. After cocoa beans are bought from farmers, Ni Komang Kantri re-sells it to the distributor, who is her permanent customer. This business very much help her household income. For the future Ni Komang Kantri likes to be a distributor of cocoa beans. Ni Komang Kantri plans to expand the area to obtain the cocoa beans, so that she could get more profit, and her business would increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Jual beli biji coklat ( Kakao ) adalah pekerjaan yang sudah digeluti selama setahun. Ni Komang Kantri melakukan pekerjaannya dengan cara berkeliling kerumah warga untuk membeli biji kakao yang sudah kering. Kadang dalam satu hari Ni Komang Kantri mendapat biji kakao 200 kilogram. Dengan keuntungan Rp.50.000/hari. Dengan semangat dan tidak mengenal lelah Ni Komang Kantri menjalani usaha ini. Suaminya, I Ketut Denia, juga tidak tinggal diam melihat istri yang begitu ulet bekerja. I Ketut Denia ikut membantu mencari nafkah demi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Modal pinjaman ini sangat menunjang usaha Ni Komang Kantri untuk menambah jumlah biji kako yang bisa dibelinya agar keuntungan yang di dapat pun bertambah besar . Setelah biji kako di beli dari rumah petani, oleh Ni Komang Kantri akan dijual kembali kepada pengepul yang sudah menjadi langanan tetapnya.Usaha ini sangat membantu penghasilan rumah tangganya. Untuk kedepannya Ni Komang Kantri ingin menjadi pengepul biji kakao. Ni Komang Kantri berencana bisa memperlebar area tempat untuk mendapatkan biji kako, agar lebih banyak mendapat keuntungan dan usahanya lebih maju.

loans.use:
To add capital to buy more cocoa beans

Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli biji kakao lebih banyak lagi

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo C. D., 26, is married with two little children who are still too young to attend school. They live in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She runs a stand selling ice to the people in her area and typically earns around US$ 4 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a veterinarian and also at carpentry, making on average US$ 10/day in revenue.

Mrs. Keo C. D. has humbly requested a loan to invest in her business and to purchase more veterinary medicines and wood to expand her husband's two businesses. (Her husband is pictured in his carpentry workshop.)

loans.use: To invest in her business and to buy more veterinary medicines and wood for her husband's businesses

loans.name: Hadisamoh

texts.en: Hadisamoh K. is 42 years old, and the mother of 3 children. Her eldest son helps her by assisting in their bread business. Together they begin the day from 5:00 AM to buy bread from workshops, and sell it in the food market of “Safariyion”, in Dushanbe, Tajkistan. Hadisamoh has been doing this for three years. Before, she worked at a school as a geography teacher, but changes within her living conditions forced her to abandon education and seek another means of supporting her family. She would like to request a loan in order for her to continue running her business.

loans.use: Buying bread for sale.

loans.name: Kaksija I Group

texts.en:
Seated on plastic chairs, wooden boards, or the ground, the women of the community bank Kaksija gather in the home of one of the members, talking in their native language K´iche´, treating each other like family after almost eight years of being together as a group.

Waiting for the meeting to begin, some women nurse their babies, others work on craft projects, and others catch up on the weekly news. The fourteen women of the group dedicate themselves to artisan crafts, primarily to ‘huipiles’, a traditional Mayan blouse woven with intricate patterns. They also specialize in other typical clothing, such as the skirts you see in the photo.

The women of Kaksija are strong and wise. Most have been practicing their trade since their childhood, and have perfected the art. They sell their clothing in nearby markets, but are now looking for ways to expand their business. They would like to break into the tourist market surrounding Lake Atitlan, about an hour and a half away.

Eight of the women are asking for a group loan of 17,500 quetzales ($2300), ranging from $150 to $400 per person, with which they will purchase thread for weaving, and two of these women are hoping to also invest in a sewing machine, in hopes to increase production as well as quality of their sewing.

All eight of the women have children, with some of the older women having as many as ten. They dream of expanding their business in order to better provide for their kids, so that they can receive an education and have more opportunity in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and a sewing machine

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca does the work typical in forest areas, cultivating citrus fruits and coffee on her two acres of land. She just began with the coffee and hopes to see good results from her harvest in half a year.

Francisca lives with her beloved husband and works to cover her basic necessities, but also has set herself goals for the future. One project is to increase her coffee harvest and sell it to foreign markets. She needs more capital to buy more coffee plants and go through with her plan; a loan will give her the necessary support to start.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca, desarrolla la actividad típica de la zona de la selva, el cultivo de cítricos y café, posee dos hectáreas de cultivo de cítricos y ha iniciado el procesamiento de café y espera que a mitad de año obtener resultados positivos en sus cosechas.Ahora que vive sólo en compañía de su querido esposo trabaja para su sostén diario, sin embargo no han dejado de trazarse metas a futuro como el de acrecentar su siembra de café para comercializarlo en el extranjero. Pero este proyecto tiene un costo fuera del alcance de francisca y por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de plantas de café. Con su apoyo francisca podrá adquirir lo necesario para iniciar su proyecto.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly learned the techniques of embroidery from her loved mother, who conveyed them with great love and care. Now, thanks to this she can satisfactorily alleviate the needs of her only son. She is very content and satisfied with her labor and has decided to increase her working capital to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly, aprendió de su amada madre las técnicas de bordado que ella le trasmitió con sumo amor y cuidado. Ahora gracias a esto ella puede aliviar satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su único hijo.Está muy contenta y satisfecha con su labor que ha decidido incrementar su capital de trabajo para elevar su producción.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase production

loans.name: Merey

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Merey N.. She is married, and has three children aged 8 months, 3, and 6. In 2007, Merey established her genge (grocery) business. Merey requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, flour, fruits and vegetables. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, flour, fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Path

texts.en: Path H., age 41, is a true entrepreneur working in the Prey Veng province. She sells firewood, typically making $3 each day, and she is supported by her husband who works as a policeman. She has seven children, three of whom are married and don't live at home; the other four children are not married and do different work to help support the family. To expand Mrs. Path’s business, she would like to take out a loan of $500 to purchase more firewood for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood for resale

loans.name: Mkorofi Si Mwenzitu Group

texts.en:
Mariam sells charcoal and firewood in Zanzibar, and she has been in this business since 2006. Her business enables her to generate a monthly profit of approximately $30. She is currently hoping to expand her business and to thereby increase her profits by buying more materials (i.e., charcoal and firewood) to then sell to her customers. She is a single mother of seven children who are between the ages of 9 and 19.

Mariam will share the proceeds of this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling goods.

loans.use: To expand and improve their respective businesses by purchasing additional materials to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Veronica Antonieta

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 21 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos”de Catac, espera tener una cadena de restaurantes en la ciudad de Lima y especializarse en la preparación de comida regional y chifa.  En la actualidad vive junto a su conviviente, lo mas difícil para ella le ha sido, iniciar su vida de adulta a los 16 años, cuando se embarazó de su primer hijo, tuvo que empezar a trabajar.  En un inicio vendía comida en la ciudad de Catac, ahora brinda pensión a 30 clientes, todos ellos obreros de la mina “Alpaquita ”, en Aija, donde también labora su conviviente. Tener que llevar los víveres en volquete desde la ciudad  de Huaraz ya se le ha hecho costumbre, donde una vez por mes  baja de la mina y compra al por mayor los víveres.
 Lo que le atormenta es pensar cuando sus 2 hijos tengan que entrar al colegio y no saber como poder ver por ellos. 
Con el préstamo de S/ 500 soles, que pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará un saco de arroz, azúcar, una caja de aceite y algunos otros insumos para que pueda cocinar.

loans.use: Compra de insumos al por mayor.

loans.name: Betty Yolanda

texts.es:
Betty es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.

Betty es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Betty junto a su esposo tiene un carro con el cual realizan transporte al distrito de Paras, su hermano es el chofer y una vez por semana Betty viaja a la feria del distrito de donde compra quesos, animales menores, cereales, productos que vende a los comerciantes del mercado 12 de abril, Además Betty tiene otro carro que realiza servicio turístico, que es conducido por su esposo, mayormente viaja a la ciudad de Cuzco con las promociones de colegios.

Betty necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carnero, gallina y queso. Betty sueña con construir su casa en el centro de la ciudad, su hija estudie medicina y tener una tienda mayorista de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank (a group loan)

Betty is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She and her husband own a car which they use to provide people with transportation to Paras District. Her brother is the driver, and once per week Betty travels to the district fair, where she buys cheeses, young animals, and grains, which she then sells to the vendors in the 12 de Abril Market in the town where she lives. She also has another car, which she uses for tourism-related transport. Her husband drives this car, and mostly uses it to take school children to the city of Cuzco.

Betty needs a loan of 1500 soles (about $525) to purchase a cow, hens and cheese. Her dreams are to build a house in the city center, for her daughter to go to medical school, and to own a large dry goods store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow, hens and cheese

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Chab S., 41, is married and lives with three of her children and her husband in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been working selling rice cakes and boiled duck eggs from her home. In the morning, she sells rice cakes and in the evening, she sells duck eggs, and on average she makes around US$3 per day.

Her husband works in a recycling business and with a motor-taxi. He said that earlier, he just ran a motor-taxi, but since the price of gas keeps increasing, he has started to increase his other business in purchasing recycling items to add to the family's income.

Chab S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a trailer to transport recycling products, and the rest will be used to increase the amount of stuff they have to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny P. lives in Phnom Lontas Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small rice field to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Nop Vanna, is a teacher who earns a small salary to support the family.

Although Mrs. Vanny P. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support the family well. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding, and she hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow. 

Mrs. Vanny P. is 50 years old and the mother of two children, who are both enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and increasing her income.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Lon S., 48, is a wedding chef who lives with her husband (pictured) in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She makes around $1.5 a day, while her husband is a construction supervisor who makes $6 a day. The couple has three children -- one is a student and two are employed as workers.  She is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase construction tools for her husband. This will allow him access to bigger construction projects.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana K. is a widow with four children, and she has received primary education.

Since 1998, Juliana has been in the fish-selling business. More specifically, she buys fresh fish from fishermen, brings the fish home to be processed and preserved, and then sends the fish to the market at Denu near Elmina to be re-sold for a profit. (Beside her in the photograph are the smoking shelves on which she arranges the fish, which is part of the preservation process.) As a widow, she is solely responsible for paying the family's living expenses. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for processing and re-sale purposes. With the expected profits from her expanded business, she hopes to add to her savings to someday build a house for her family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional fresh fish

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs.Ry S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a chicken middleman. Her business is going well and she would like to expand by purchasing more chickens to resell. She is requesting a loan to  purchase more chickens to sell. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Mrs. Ry S. is a widow with two children, one of whom helps her mother's business while the other is attending the local school. She was born in 1967 and she now lives in Pech Entrea village in Takeo province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to resell.

loans.name: Cenita

texts.en: Tending a small food vending stall at school and selling of grilled chicken parts at noontime are the primary sources of income of Cenita J.. This is her way of helping her husband, an on-call carpenter, in providing their daily needs. With their four children, two of whom are in school, she feels that she needs to strive harder to be able to cope up with their daily expenses and their children's studies. She needs an amount of Php 11,000 to expand her business to cater to the increasing demand of the local market.

loans.use: To purchase chicken parts and  supplies for her small stall at school

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Government Technical Institute Group

texts.en:
These gentle men are staff members of the Government Technical Institute Magburaka, Tonkolili District, Northern Sierra Leone. Government Technical Institute, Magburaka, was founded in 1962 by the government for the promotion of technical and vocational education. They teach mechanical engineering, carpentry and joinery, block laying and concreting, automobile engineering, plumbing and sheet metal work, painting and decoration and many more. Presently, the institute has a total of fourteen staff and twenty-five students. 

The ten years old civil war tremendously disrupted the smooth running of the institute. Before the war, the institute used to have an enrollment of about 200 – 300 students. In 1997 – 2002, rebels vandalized the whole institute – buildings were unroofed, labs and libraries destroyed. However Sababu Education, a World Bank sponsored project is currently rehabilating the institute. But the project does not call for reequipping the laboratories and libraries.

Government Technical Institute Magburaka is the only government technical institute in Magburaka town. Over the years, the institute has been able to train so many technicians serving both within and without Sierra Leone. It makes good grades at the external examinations organized by City and Guilds of London Institute. The institute also serves as a consultancy and guard to the people of Magburaka. 

This is the first loan Government Technical Institute is requesting from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, some of these teachers will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their businesses. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

David E.A. K. is the principal at the Institute. He has been a teacher for forty-three years now.  Mr. K. (right) was born in Makurgbo, nine miles from Magburaka. He is sixty-one years of age, married to a teacher and the two of them have five children. Four of their children are in secondary schools and the eldest is already a grown-up. Mr. K. will use his loan to pay his children’s school fees and solve many of his domestic problems.

loans.use: To pay school fees for children

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elis is a 28 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his parents. Elie has owned a computer shop for three years. He also installs Internet connections. Elie has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majomoua in order to purchase a new computer. This is the first time that Elie has requested a loan. 
Elie is special in his work because he is the only one in his region. His clients are people from his region. In the future, Elie plans on expanding his business by opening a coffee Internet shop.

loans.use: Elie will use the loan to purchase a new computer.

loans.name: Jackelline Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Jackelline V., trabajo desde muy joven en diferentes instituciones con ingresos de asalariada, y a pesar de su corta edad logra comprar un terreno en la calle 47 de Chasquipampa. Ella deja de trabajar y forma una familia y se dedica integramente a su hogar, atendiendo además a un hijo con un problema de salud desde su nacimiento y con el fin de lograr ingresos para levantar una construcción sobre el terreno ya adquirido decide aportar a la familia con otro tipo de ingresos y empieza a elaborar masas tales como empanadas, berlines, queques y tortas sin pensar en el agradable sabor que ella tenia en la repostería que elaboraba.
Es así como empieza a vender en pequeñas cantidades en la zona sur dejando inicialmente en pocas cantidades, hoy ella ya vende su repostería en dos de los colegios con mas alumnado de la zona sur y además preparando este tipo de manjares por contratos de clientes que ya la conocen y conocen de su repostería, ella hace este trabajo en el hogar y así puede atender a su familia de manera normal como ella lo desea.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jackelline V. has been working since she was very young in different institutions with salaried income. Despite her young age, she has bought a piece of land on street 47 of Chasquipampa. She stopped working and formed a family and is totally devoted to her household, attending to her son who has had a health problem since birth. To receive revenue in order to get contruction going on her already acquired land, she has decided to supplement her income by starting to mass produce empanadas, berlins, cakes and pastries, without even thinking of the agreable flavor that she makes in the production of the pastries. Thus she began selling small amounts in the south, beginning only with small quantities. Today she sells pastries in two of the schools with the most students in the south, and further prepares these types of dishes in contracts for customers who already know her or know of her pastries. She does this work at home so she can attend to her family in a normal way as she wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build capital.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo E. makes a living growing rice. He is 30 years old and has two children. One of his most important goals is to expand his business and the size of his farm. "Someday I will be able to buy another farm to support more of the needs of my children," he said. Leo told CEVI, Kiva's partner in the Philippines, that a good portion of what he earns from selling rice goes to pay for tuition and school fees.

Leo has applied for this loan to buy herbicides, pesticides and seeds. He likes working with CEVI because he gets training and insurance as well as loans.

loans.use: To buy seeds, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanisha has been a clothing seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to the Subira Ina Mpaka group  (Group code 2062).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately  $40. Every day she works at her business for 3 hours.  

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can  buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Mwanaisha is 29  and is married. She takes care of one dependent.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, beans and rice.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora y preocupada por su desarrollo, vive en la casa que le cedieron sus padres y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Cuando instaló su propio consultorio dental, hace 5 años, tenía mucha fe en que le iría bien, por eso decidió trabajar duro y sin descanso para alcanzar sus metas, ella mantiene su consultorio siempre muy limpio y brinda una atención muy cordial a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y saber que de esa manera ayuda a las personas a tener una mejor salud. Lleva 15 años ejerciendo esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar las largas jornadas laborales, puesto que por lo general su consultorio está repleto de personas. Adelaida espera que su negocio crezca, para poder atender a más clientes, ella es conciente de que el camino a sus metas es largo y sacrificado, pero está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de lograrlo. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, promete ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a sus compañeras de su banco comunal donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más implementos dentales para renovar y cambiar los que actualmente usa.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 38-years old and is a very hard working woman who is very focused on her development. She lives in a house that was willed to her by her parents and she’s very eager to move forward with her life. It’s been 5-years since she started her dental practice; she had little faith that it would do well, but she worked hard and without rest she set out to achieve these goals. She maintains her practice always keeping it clean and ensures the highest level of courtesy for her clients. She very much enjoys her work as she attends to her clients and knows what are the best ways to help people to achieve better health.

It took 15-years to learn these skills and she believes the biggest challenge is working these long hours as the office is generally filled with people. Adelaida desires to grow the business to be able to attend to more clients. She is aware of the path to her goals is long and requires sacrifice, but she is determined to work hard to achieve them.

This is the 5th loan request with MFP and she promises to be punctual with her debt as she does not want to jeopardize things for her community bank members whom she cares for and respects. With this 1,500 soles Adelaida will purchase more dental equipment to repair and change the ones she currently uses.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dental equipment

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.ru: Иброгим Каландаров проживает в Хуросонском районе. Возраст 30 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. По специальности Иброгим "врач". Врачом проработал более 10 лет. В данный момент он занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом бизнеса занялся 2 года назад. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Ibrogim K. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 30 years old, married and has 4 children. Ibrogim is a doctor by profession. He had worked as a doctor for over 10 years. Currently, he is involved in animal husbandry, i.e. feeding and selling livestock. He started this business 2 years ago. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Likeni

texts.en:
Likeni S. makes a living selling general hand-woven products to tourists and community members. She is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Saletele. She is married and has four school-age children. Likeni has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 550 WST a month.

In 2005, Likeni joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Likeni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Likeni is now requesting a new loan of 1700 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from SPBD. Likeni plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.(0)

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a weaving business

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El Grupo FORTALEZA, está integrado por 10 personas entusiastas y emprendedoras de la zona de Carabayllo, quienes adquieren sus préstamos para el crecimiento de sus negocios.

La Sra. Isabel S. Aranda (que la apreciamos al lado izquierdo del grupo), de 45 años de edad, madre soltera ha logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales gracias a su sacrificio y mucho trabajo. 
Ella inició vendiendo en la puerta de su casa menú y con tan solo apenas 12 clientes al día y teniendo muy poco ingreso. Un día la invitaron a participar de un Grupo de EDAPROSPO que le ofrecían obtener un crédito para poder invertirlo, con mucho temor de no poder mantener una deuda aceptó; con su primer préstamo compró mesas y sillas para poder atender a más clientes, y ofrecer la venta de ceviches los sábados y domingos.
Hoy en día es una comerciante exitosa atiende a mas de 50 clientes al día, gracias a sus ingresos pudo construir su casa y ubicar su negocio en todo el primer piso y su vivienda en el segundo piso. Ella manifiesta que su mayor logro fue poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos y lograr que tengan una profesión.
El préstamo solicitado lo destinará la mitad a gastos de publicidad y la otra mitad lo invertirá en la venta de licor; pues así podrá tener mas ingresos y poder adquirir una congeladora.
texts.en:
The FORTALEZA Group is working on behalf of 10 enthusiastic and enterprising people from the Carabayllo area who are requesting loans in order to grow their businesses. Mrs. Isabel S. Aranda (on the left in the photo) is a 45 year old single mother. Thanks to her effort and hard work, her children have all grown up to become professionals. She began her business of selling food from her home to 12 customers with little investment. EDAPROSPO (A Kiva Field Partner) offered to help her obtain credit so that she could invest in her business. She was reluctant at first because she was concerned about going into debt, but she accepted. With her first loan, she bought some tables and chairs so that she could serve more customers and was able to add "ceviches" (citrus marinated seafood dishes) to her menu on the weekends. Today she is a successful businesswoman who serves more than 50 customers a day. Thanks to her income, she has been able to build a home with her business located on the first floor and her residence on the second. She feels that her greatest accomplishment has been to allow her children to obtain good educations and help them become professionals in their fields. She plans to use half of the money from this loan to buy advertising for her business and the rest to buy alcoholic beverages for resale so that she could increase her revenue and be able to buy a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest toward the growth of her restaurant

loans.name: Joyitas Group

texts.es:
Lucia L. de 30 años cuenta que desde hace 4 años se dedica a tejer prendas, como chompas y mantas, ella prefiere producir mantas porque existe mayor demanda y necesita el préstamo para comprar lana.
Lucia es casada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños a quienes los cuida con mucho amor, por esta situación tiene su negocio es en casa. Lucia aprendió a tejer en un instituto, sabe tejer a mano y a máquina, aunque ella prefiere tejer a mano. 
Al igual que Lucia las demás integrantes tambien tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de medias, comida, canaletas, yuca, atención de un salon de belleza y funeraría. Todas necesitan del préstamo para comprar mercadería, insumos y materia prima
texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Lucia L. tells us that she started knitting clothes, like sweaters and blankets, four years ago. She prefers to knit blankets because there's a higher demand for them; she needs the loan to buy wool. Lucia is married and has three small kids, for whom she cares with lots of love. They are the reason she has her business at home. Lucia learned to knit at an institute and she knits by hand and on a machine, although she prefers to knit by hand. Just like Lucia, the rest of the members have their own businesses selling socks, food, gutters, and yucca; running a beauty salon; and running a funeral parlor. All the members need the loan to buy supplies, ingredients, and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies, ingredients and raw materials

loans.name: Jowena

texts.en: Jowena C., 31, lives with her husband of five years. She has a hectare of rice field to cultivate. Like other farmers, she needs financing to help grow her farm. That’s why she stayed with CEVI and is now on her second year with the MFI. Now she is requesting for a loan of 15,000 PHP. She will use the loan for farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Nora Celeni

texts.es:
La señora Nora es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03  hijos, vive en el Sector Challacollo, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años, es una de las socias fundadoras, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de cuyes.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar alimento balanceado para cuyes, la señora también de apoya con el tejido.

Su mayor deseo es poner una granja grande de crianza de cuyes.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los encuentros.

loans.use: Para la compra de alimento balanceado para cuyes.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo D. es casado con la señora Marlen  quien se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de la familia,tienen un sobrino que los apoya económicamente ya que el trabaja y contribuye con sus ingresos porque vive con ellos y es parte de la familia. El señor Arturo labora para una empresa desde hace 7 años en el área de producción. Como una familia unida están tramitando este crédito para resanar la barda y levantar muros en el frente de su vivienda, para brindarle a su hogar una mejor apariencia y seguridad.
texts.en:
Arturo D. is married to Marlen, who is a homemaker and takes care of the family. They have a nephew that helps support them financially because he lives with them and is part of the family. For the last seven years, Arturo has worked in the production department of a local company.

As a family, they are requesting a loan to repair the plaster on their fence and to build walls in front of their house to improve their home's appearance and to increase its security.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair plaster on their fence and to build walls in front of their home

loans.name: Apostol Santiago Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Empredimiento APOSTOL SANTIAGO viene trabajando en nuestra Institución hace ocho ciclos, desD. el año 1997, este banco tiene como caracteristica que la mayoria D. las socias se dedica al comercio D. productos D. belleza,viveres y ropa, este banco a logrado cohesionarse y convertirse en un grupo  emprendedor. JULIA, es una participante antigua y ocupa el cargo D. presidenta, se dedica a la venta D. viveres en las paradas D. Minibuses en la zona D. Chijini, con el prestamo a podido comprar por cantidad productos como: aceite,azúcar,harina, fideo y poder cubrir la demanda D. sus pedidos.La Sra, Julia tiene una familia númeR. y con los pedidos a logrado mejorar sus ingresos. JAQUELINE es una D. la socias fundadoras, actualmente ocupa el cargo D. secretaria, tiene una familia conformada por 3 miembros, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa en la ciudad D. La Paz y realiza viajes hasta Yacuiba (frontera con la republica Argentina) D. donD. tambien trae productos como vajillas y productos D. belleza, con el prestamo otorgado por la institución, ella a logrado aumentar su capital y sus ingresos logrando D. esta forma mejorar la calidad D. vida D. ella y su familia. ROSMERY,  es una participante antigua y tiene la función D. Tesorera, es artesana y trabaja en la elaboración D. mantas, chompas realizando macramé, el prestamo a servido para poder comprar material en cantidad y poder acumular D. productos para ser vendidos en Navidad y D. esta manera  mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The APOSTOL SANTIAGO enterprising bank has been cooperating with our institution for 8 cycles, since 1997. This group is characterized by the fact that most of its members are merchants of beauty products, food supplies, and clothing. The group has grown cohesively and has become enterprising. JULIA has been with the group for a very long time and acts as its president; she sells food items at the minibus stops in the Chijini area. With the financing she was able to buy such things as oil, sugar, flour and pasta at wholesale to meet her demand. Julia has a large family and her orders have helped her improve her income. JAQUELINE is one of the founding members and currently acts as group secretary. She has a family of 3 members and she sells clothes in the city of La Paz. She travels as far as Yacuiba (on the border with Argentina) where she gets items like crockery and beauty items. With financing from the institution she was able to increase her working capital and her earnings thereby improving her family's quality of life. ROSMERY has been with the group for a long time and acts as its treasurer. She is a craftsperson and makes macrame blankets and sweaters. The financing has served to buy materials in large quantities in order to accumulate items to be sold during the Christmas season thus improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital and inventory.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Consuelo A. S., Casada  de  cuarenta años de edad con tres hijos  su actividad principal es  comercio , que dicho negocio día a días crese pero la dificultad que se tiene actualmente que su capital es pequeño con ello no puede satisfacer la necesidad de sus cliente  por eso visita las oficina de asidr para solicitar un crédito que le servirá para surtir su mercadería con ello poder cubrir la demanda además se aproxima la fiesta de fin de año y con los ingresos que obtiene le permite mejorar su nivel de Vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo A. S., 40, is married and has three children. She is a merchant. Her business grows daily but she lacks sufficient funds to properly stock merchandise to meet the demand of her customers. This is the reason she has called upon Asdir to request financing to buy stock inventory so that she can meet customer demand during the approaching end-of-year holiday season and therby earn profits with which to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Mujeres Obreras Group

texts.es:
Después de haberse capacitado  durante tres días las integrantes del grupo Mujeres Obreras, están preparando su solicitud para acceder al préstamo, liderizadas por su mesa directiva tienen como presidenta a Catalina A., Tesorera es Francisca P. y Secretaria de Actas es Sandra A.,  todas elaboran su reglamento interno de la Asociación quienes se reunirán cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Los Andes. 
Todas las integrantes tienen sus propios negocios como la costura de prendas de vestir, tejido de aguayo (mantel nativo y colorido), bordado de mantas, venta de lana, velas, ropa, herrería, carpintería, atención de tienda de barrio y venta de comida. Necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería en el caso de negocios de comercialización, compra de materia prima para las que se dedican a la producción.
texts.en:
After having prepared themselves for three days, the members of the “Working Women” group are readying their request to access a loan. They are led by their board of directors: Catalina A., president; Francisca P., treasurer; and secretary Sandra A.. They all work together to make up the internal rules of the Association, which meets every two weeks in Los Andes. All the members have their own businesses, such as seamstresses, knitting of aguayos (a regional, colorful cloth), embroidery, selling yarn, candles, clothes, hardware items, carpentry supplies, neighborhood stores, and food sales. Those that are merchants need the loan funds to buy more product. Those that dedicate themselves to production, need the funds to buy raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen L. is from the village of Butuay. She is 58 years old. Helen is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell & for house renovation. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell & for house renovation

loans.name: Benita Emilia

texts.es: Benita Emilia tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil salir adelante porque no ha tenido el capital suficiente para comprar todos los productos necesarios. Los propósitos de Doña ella son de invertir en suficientes productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para aplicarlo al capital de trabajo y así efectuar la compra materia prima. Los sueños de ella son de establecer una pulpería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Benita Emilia, 34, is single and has one child to support. She has sold cosmetics for the last 5 years. It has been very difficult for her to make progress because she's never had enough capital to buy all the product she needs. Her goal is to invest in enough product to be able to meet her demand. The funding she is requesting will be used to buy stock for her inventory. Her dream is to set up a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: Mariétou D. est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle vend des fruits de saison telles que des oranges et mandarines. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à a prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariétou D. is a 39-year old woman who is married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank in TOULY for the past three and a half years. She sells seasonal fruits such as oranges and mandarins. Her aim is to boost her savings and to help to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her income-generating activity

loans.name: Felix Ignacio

texts.es: Don Feliz Ignacio es pequeño productor que habita en la comarca La Tigra, El Almendro, junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Deysi, su hija mayor Anielka que es casada, Josué y Mariana que son menores de edad y estudian la primaria en la comarca La tiegra, esta familia trabaja en la unidad de producción de la finca en coordicion con don Feliz, el realiza su actividad ganadera desde muy pequeño, de esta forma a luchado por obtener su propio inventario de ganadero y su finca la cual presenta buenas condiciones técnica, su mayor sueño es tener un buen inventario ganadero, esta solicitando su 3er credito y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para comprar terneros de desarrollo  los cuales engordaria para comercializarlos a un mejor precio y obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida del núcleo familiar, Feliz Ignacio se caracteriza por ser un hombre responsable, honesto, con alto liderazgo en la comarca.
texts.en:
Feliz Ignacio is a small producer that lives in the La Tigra, El Almendro region. He lives with his family: his wife Deysi; his oldest daughter Anielka, who is married; and Josué and Mariana who are minors and attend grammar school in the La Tiegra region. The family works together with Feliz on the land. Feliz has been raising livestock since he was young. He has fought to obtain his own inventory of livestock and his land which has good technical conditions. His biggest dream is to have a good inventory of livestock. He is requesting his third loan and hopes to be a beneficiary of KIVA. He will use the loan to buy calves which he will raise for commercialization. The profits will allow him to improve his family's quality of life. Feliz Ignacio is known for being responsible, honest and a leader in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves.

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Samoeun I., 60 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Onn Pich, 52 years old (pictured together), live about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of them is a construction worker, another one is a blacksmith, and the other two attend school.

Samoeun has been a physician for 30 years. His wife stays at home and does housework. By the way, under his wooden house is an open-air space, which makes it difficult for him to protect his home from the elements. Hence, he is asking for a loan of $600 to build a brick room under his wooden house.

loans.use: To build a brick room under his wooden house

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Рахимов Абдулло проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдулло более 18 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает фрукты на рынке. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdullo R. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 39 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker. Abdullo has been in the sales business for more than eighteen years. He mainly sells fruits on the market. He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Tereza De Jesús

texts.es:
En el barrio las Colinas  Municipio de Somotillo 
La señora A. C.    realiza su trabajo como vendedora de ropa ambulante dando cobertura alos clientes de las comarcas y alos del casco urbano.
 Ella quiere el crédito para comprar de  10 bolsas de cemento  para la construcción de una cocina en su casa de habitación y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de sus familiares
texts.en:
In the Colinas neighborhood of the Municipality of Somotillo A. C. works as a traveling clothing vendor, serving clients in the towns and in the city. She wants the loan to buy 10 bags of cement to build a kitchen in her house so she can improve living conditions for her and her family members.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of cement to build a kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y. is married and has seven dependents. She has been through senior high school.  Aba sells plastic bowls, moving from one house to the other in and around Abura, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a farmer. 

Aba uses her income to help her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for her family.  Aba will use the loan to purchase more and a greater variety of plastic bowls and foodstuffs like plantains which will serve as an additional trade to enter into and sell in her locality. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more and a greater variety of plastic bowls etc. for resale

loans.name: San Martin De Cangallo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Martín de Cangallo inicia su primer ciclo  con 11 socias. Las socias son de la Distrito de Cangallo, Provincia de  Cangallo, se ubica a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Las actividades principales de la comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, cereales, animales menores, restaurante, peluquería, tienda de abarrotes.
Como es el caso de la Señora Sonia que es socia hace año y medio, Sonia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Sonia vende ropa variada, inicio su negocio vendiendo lencería, pequeñas joyas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y lo vende en su Distrito y también en ferias. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de ropa. Los sueños de Sonia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios secundarios y luego estudien la universidad en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 500soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total de 5,900 soles.
texts.en:
The San Martin de Cangallo community bank is starting its first cycle with 11 members. The members are from Cangallo, a Peruvian district about 3 hours from the city of Ayacucho. The most common lines of work in the area are farming, raising livestock and commerce. The members operate various businesses: clothing sales, cereal farming, animal rearing, restaurants, hairdressers, groceries. A case in point is Sra. Sonia who has been a member for a year and a half. Sonia is married and has 3 children. She sells a variety of clothing, having started with lingerie and small jewelry pieces. She buys her products in Lima and sells them in Cangallo and area markets. She will use her loan to buy stocks of clothing. Sonia hopes that her children will finish high school and then go on to college in Ayacucho. The members need a range of sums: 500 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, for a total of 5,900 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina N. is from the village of San Jose. She is 38 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Merlina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 32,000 PHP per harvest.
In 2006, Merlina joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Anita nos manifiesta que con mucho esfuerzo logro aperturar una bodega en su casa, Ella  es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos dependientes y es por eso que tiene que trabajar dia a dia. El prestamo solicitado lo invertira en la compra D. mercaderia para su negocio. 

Todas son muy entusiastas y trabajadoras gracias a ello siguen adelante incrementando sus ingresos ya que tienen como objetivo la mejora económica para sus familias. Saben que tienen mucha competencia pero ellas se esfuerzan por tener productos D. primera calidad. Todas las socias aprenden a administrar sus fondos ya que es D. beneficio para ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
Our member, Anita, says that with much effort she opened a grocery store in her house. She is a single mother with three dependent children. That is why she has to work every day.
