The requested loan will be used to buy merchandise for her business. All of the members are very enthusiastic and hard-working. Because of that they continue getting ahead and increasing their earnings. Their objective is to improve their families’ economies. They know that they have a lot of competition, but they work hard to have high quality products. All of the members learn to manage their funds because it is beneficial to them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Ngaol's Group

texts.en: This is a group loan, which consists of four people located in Cheav Bdei Kaeut village, Takeo province. Mrs. Nyaol K. is 51 years old and is the leader of the group loan, having been selected by its members. The members of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mrs. Nyaol K. and her husband are farmers who own a 2.50-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Nyaol K. is now requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer, and to pay to rent a water machine to support her farming crop. Her husband is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family's costs of living. This couple has three children: one is a farmer, while the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is to use the loan funds to buy saucepans, plates and flasks for her restaurant business.

Roselyne is a 40-year-old mother of five children, all of school-going age, who is married to a businessman. Together, they live in a simple home in Hoima, Uganda. She says she wants to educate her children so that they can have a good life in the future.

Roselyne operates a restaurant, a business she has been in for the last six years, her major hardship being the lack of a reliable labor force. She started selling pancakes, then bread and textiles until she opened her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy saucepans, plates and flasks for her restaurant business

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: O. Victoire est née le 23 Décembre 1967 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNLIHO Charles, un électricien, Victoire est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Victoire vit avec sa famille à Hêvié, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, depuis une dizaine d'année. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Victoire n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Victoire vend divers produits (conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, sucre, pâtes alimentaires, savons, allumettes, riz, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Victoire vend des poteries. Victoire s'approvisionne à Tori et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Victoire exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans et a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Victoire désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et agrandir son activité ; raison pour laquelle Victoire sollicite un deuxième prêt en vue de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Plus tard, Victoire désire ouvrir un autre point de vente au marché de Cococodji, en vue de se faire d'autres revenus.
texts.en:
Victoire Odountain was born 23 December 1967 in Ouidah, a historic city of Benin. Married to Charles Houliho, an electrician, Victoire is the mother of three children, all attending (or having attended) school. For the past ten years, she has been living with her family in Hêvié, in the Abomey Calvi municipality. The couple shares responsibility for family expenses. Victoire has not attended school. To make ends meet, she sells various products from her home (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, sugar, pasta, soap, matches, rice, etc.). As a side business, she also sells crockery. She gets her supplies from Tori and Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Victoire has been running her business for four years, and has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which she reimbursed in full. She wishes to increase her stock supply and expand her activity, which is why she requesting a second loan so that she can better respond to customer demand. In the future, Victoire would like to open another point of sales at the Cococodji market, to become an additional source of income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 cartons of sugar, 2 dozen boxes of milk, pasta, and crockery.

loans.name: Zenobio

texts.es:
Zenobio nació en la ciudad de Paruro y tiene 23 años. Actualmente, Zenobio vive en la comunidad de Cajamarca del distrito de Cachimayo provincia de Anta departamento del Cusco junto con su esposa y su hija (Britt Alexandra de un año). La ciudad de Cachinayo se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Zenobio se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Hace dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Le pueden encontrar en su chacra, desde las 5 de la mañanas hasta 5 de la tarde, haciendo sus labores como pastear a las 20 vacas lecheras y otras labores que tiene.   

Con su próximo préstamo, Zenobio que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para compra un ganado. El sueño de la socia es comprarse un terreno donde puede cultivar papa, maíz, trigo y muchas cosas más.  

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Zenobio pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Zenobio, 23, was born in the city of Paruro. Currently, Zenobio lives in the community of Cajamarca, Cachimayo district, Anta province, Cusco department with his wife and daughter, Britt Alexandra, 1. Cachinayo is located 25 minutes from the city of Cusco. Zenobio has been a farmer and cattleman for the last two years and does well. One can find him tending to his fields from 5am until 5pm performing his pasturage chores with his 20 dairy cows and other chores he has. Zenobio expects to get 1000 new soles in his next loan that he’d like to use to buy a head of cattle. His dream is to buy a field where he can farm potatoes, corn, wheat and many other things. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) communal bank has been in operation for three and a half years and Zenobio has been a member for three years and does well. The members of this communal bank are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and this is the reason they named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Nuria Grisel

texts.es:
Nuria tiene  36 años de edad, vive con sus compañero de vida y tres hijos entre las edades de 13-6 años de edad, el trabaja como albañil y ella se dedica ha elaborar y venta de tortillas de maiz.
Nuria se dedica al negocio de la tortilla desde hace dos años lo cual lo inicio para solventar las necesidades economicas de su familia, el negocio esta ubicado en la casa de habitaciones, inicia la elaboracion de tortillas en horario de 6:00am - 2:00pm los clientes son los vecions y perosnas que transitan por la zona. Ellas solicita un prestamo el cual lo invertira en la compra de una cocina con plancha y sistema de gas, este le permitira salir ha vender al frente de su casa, para atraer mas clientes y mejorar las ventas, esto contribuira mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia.
Los sueños son poder darles el estudio a sus hijos para que estos en el futuro tengan un trabajo que les permita tener mejor vida.
texts.en:
Nuria is 36 years old and lives with her life partner and three children, ranging from age 6 to 13. Her partner works as a mason, and she works preparing and selling corn tortillas. Nuria has operated her tortilla business for two years. She began in order to cover her family's economic needs. The business is located in her home, and she begins making tortillas at 6:00 a.m. and continues until 2:00 p.m. Her customers are her neighbors and people passing through the area. She is requesting a loan in order to invest the funds in buying cooking equipment, including a tortilla grill and gas system. This will allow her to go out and sell her tortillas in front of her home, to attract more customers and improve her sales, thus contributing to improving the living conditions of her family. Her dreams are to be able to send her children to the university, so that in the future they will find work that will allow them to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cooking equipment, with a tortilla grill and gas system

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina A. is from the village of Seaside, Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Catalina is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Catalina buys and sells dried fish in the local community. Catalina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Catalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Catalina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Niyonkuru Group

texts.fr:
Joséphine G. est une femme commerçante âgée de 53 ans qui habite la localité de Gatumba  dans la Province de Bujumbura Rural. Elle fait le commerce des produits alimentaires de boutique dans la cite de Gatumba, un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 23ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Son mari, Pascal Minani est un cultivateur. Elle arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 8enfants qui sont adultes âgés de plus de 20 ans. Aucun de ses enfants n’est plus à sa charge.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires de boutique à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle a préféré demander le crédit à Turame car elle a beaucoup de facilites a rembourser. Son rêve est de pouvoir arriver au stade ou elle a son propre capital sans pouvoir demander le crédit pour travailler. 

Elle  est une des membres du groupe  Communautaire« Niyonkuru»
texts.en:
Joséphine G. is a woman merchant, aged 53, who lives in the town of Gatumba, in the province of Bujumbura Rural.  She does commerce in grocery items in the Gatumba district.  It is a trade in which she has been excelling for 23 years, whereas she used to be a farmer.  She has attended primary school. Her husband, Pascal Minani, is a farmer. She is the mother of eight children who are adults over 20 years of age.  None of her children is in her care any longer.  

Joséphine has reached her fourth community loan cycle with Turame.  She is asking for a Kiva loan in order to increase her capital by buying large quantities of grocery items to resell to customers and thus to save more money.  She has preferred to ask Turname for the loan because it would be easy for her to repay. 

Her dream is to be able to reach the stage where she has her own capital, without asking for loans in order to work.  

She is a member of the community group "Niyonkuru".

loans.use: Increasing her capital by buying large amounts of grocery items to resell to customers and thus increasing her savings

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa T. is from the village of Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Eloisa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eloisa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Eloisa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eloisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eloisa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eloisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira is married with 5 children. She sells kid’s clothing in the central marketplace. She has been working with this type of inventory for 11 years. Nazira is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to increase her stock. She is hoping to broaden her seasonal merchandise and boost her autumn sales as a result. Nazira has always had a serious and responsible business approach. It has helped her build a sustainable venture bringing her stable income. She is hoping to continue expanding her trade in the future. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new goods for selling in order to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, age 26 and unmarried, operates a business called Rehoboth Butchery, a business he has been running for two years. He is requesting a loan in the amount of Kes. 20,000 in order to add stocks of meat to his butchery. Being a hardworking man, Francis hopes to become a meat supplier in future and  eventually to open more outlets. His business environment is good and there is a constant flow of customers.

loans.use: To add stocks of meat to his butcher business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Elizabeth is married and has three adult children. Elizabeth owns and operates a fish-selling business. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns an average of approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. On April 11, 2001, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for fish selling. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish selling

location.town: Plaridel-Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es:
Verónica de 30 años,  debido a los pocos ingresos que tenía para su familia hace años atrás vendió un solar que tenía en el suburbio para ubicar una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y en una ecología en disolución ha podido incrementa la mercadería de la papelería por su buena administración. En la actualidad ya tiene 7 años con su papelería la misma queda junto a un colegio por eso ha tenido buenas ganancias.   Vende cuadernos a $ 1.50, plumas $ 0.30, marcadores, juguetes por la época de navidad.  Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta el anochecer. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo vitrinas, juguetes, papelería. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa de cemento ya que algunas partes son de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Verónica, 30, because of the little income she had for her family, sold a piece of property years ago that she had in Suburbio to set up a small stationery shop in the front part of her house.

Living in a periurban zone characterized by its unpaved streets and deteriorating environment, she has managed to increase her stock in stationery items thanks to her good administration.  She has been in business for 7 years now.  Her shop is next to a school and because of this her profits have been good.  She sells notebooks for $1.50, pens for $0.30, markers and toys for the Christmas season.  She is open for business from 6am until nightfall.

To stay in business she wants to use the loan to buy display cases, stationery supplies.  In the future she’d like to finish building her house with cement because parts of it is still brick.

loans.use: For display cases, notebooks, beverages.

loans.name: Luís Manuel

texts.es:
Luís Manuel G. R. tiene 67 años. Es soltero, vive con un hermano, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Luís se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y pago a los jornaleros. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que no se pierda la tierra que le dejaron en herencia sus padres.

Le gusta dar de comer al ganado.
texts.en:
Luís Manuel G. R. is 67 years old.  He is single and lives with one of his brothers in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in farming and this is the source of income for their families.  They grow corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.

Luis is a farmer.  He grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers.  The support of this loan will help him to cover his needs financially.  He faces challenges such as plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is not to lose the land that his parents left him as his inheritance.  He likes to feed his livestock.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary C. became a Solio agent in November; enabling her to lease solar chargers to 10 members of her community. Mary has received good appraisals of the Solio from her family members and the Solio clients in the area. Mary invests the weekly reactivation fees in her business, which is increasing her profits so that she can repay her loan back to Kadet. She is enjoying her Solio and the benefits of charging her own phone herself, which gave her a lot of problems before. Mary’s reputation within the community has increased as she is now known as ‘Mama Stima’. Her children enjoy using Solio to read and socialize, a big change from complaining about the dark and going to bed early. Solio is Mary’s second loan from Kadet.

loans.use: To buy solar powered products for leasing to other customers

loans.name: Guillermo Jose

texts.es: Guillermo casado, hombre trabajador de oficio técnico en cocina, sus hijos le ayudan enviándole mensualmente una mesada, la infraestructura de su vivienda es unos de los principales planes a corto plazo que realizara gracias al apoyo que tiene de Afodenic, recibe pensión mensual. El prestamos era invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como. Cemento, hierro, arena, piedra, piedrín entre otros materiales para la construcción de una pared la cual se obtendrá seguridad y protección.
texts.en:
Guillermo is married.  He’s a hard working man employed as a kitchen helper.  His children help out sending him a monthly allowance.

His dwelling’s infrastructure is one of his main short term plans that he will accomplish thanks to the help he gets from Afodenic.  He receives a monthly pension.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of building materials like: cement, iron rods, sand, stone and gravel among other materials to build a wall that will provide security and protection.

loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Graciela Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ” LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 41 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de flores ,ella vende diferentes clases de flores en el mercado de calca también trabaja a pedido cuando le solicitan como arreglos florales para todo tipo de compromisos  como graduaciones, cumpleaños entre otros más la socia realiza esta actividad desde su casa en conjunto con su pareja que a veces le ayuda ,la socia está feliz con este su negocio ya que mediante este ella puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos y su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio de venta de flores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela belongs to the Communal Bank “La Ñusta III”, which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Graciela divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling flowers. She sells different types of flowers at the market in Calca. Graciela also works based on orders whenever her customers request floral arrangements for all types of special occasions such as graduations, birthdays, and other events. She performs her work at home along with her partner who helps out occasionally. Graciela is happy with her business since it enables her to spend more time with her children and family. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business of selling flowers.

Graciela is happy with the loan and promises to complete all of her payments.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her floral business

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz started a restaurant recently in Ramallah city.

loans.use: To expand the business and buy a meat grill

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.en:
Leonilda is 43 and has been with her partner for 19 years. They have two girls, ages 16 and 6. She has a small food stand near a stadium in her town in the Ayacucho region. Leonilda says she loves being a member of FINCA Peru and can’t imagine her life without it. She is fortunate that FINCA Peru supports woman who live in rural areas, such as she does, who wouldn’t otherwise have access to loans. She has learned to be responsible and punctual, two skills which she feels have greatly helped her improve her business and personal life. 

Her dream right now is for her oldest daughter to get accepted to college. Leonilda feels strongly that her children should be able to become professionals, so that they have more opportunities than she ever did.  Leonilda is asking for a loan of 450 PEN to enroll her oldest daughter in a college prep course.

loans.use: to provide a college preparation course for her daughter

loans.name: Santa Rosa Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rosa Buena Vista tiene como representante a Ofelia López A. de 49 años quien vive en unión libre con el señor Enrique O. Soriano. Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos ya están casados. Ofelia solicito el crédito para comprar más productos para su tienda ya que desea que este préstamo le ayude aumentar su negocio y obtener un poco mas de ganancia para así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y tenga para comer todos los días.
Laura Rosario López Román de 27 años de edad, vive en unión libre con el señor Panfilo Mozo Gutiérrez quien trabaja en el campo, tiene 3 hijos de las respectivas edades: 8, 5 y dos años de los cuales 1 estudia el segundo año de primaria. Laura se dedica a la venta de Perfumes y Ropa, sus ventas las realiza de casa en casa con sus familiares, vecinos y amigos. Tiene 2 años realizando esta actividad económica debido a la necesidad que tenia, ya que su hija entraría a la primaria y necesitaría más dinero y con lo que esposo gana no le alcanza y es por ello que decidió vender estos productos. Con el crédito que obtuvo compro más mercancías como son: blusas, faldas y pantalones así como algunos frascos de perfumes; para así obtener más ganancias y ayudar con los gastos de la familia.
La meta de Laura es que sus hijos estudien y tengan una profesión para que así tengan mejores oportunidades el día de mañana y no sufran las necesidades que viven ahora.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Brenda M. V.: De 23 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa para la venta.
Juana V. Pérez: De 35 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Socorro Ramírez L.: De 51 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Martina C. F.: De 33 años de edad se dedica a la compra de perfumes para la venta.
Ofelia López A.: De 49 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes, verduras y ropa para la venta.
Anastacia C. Bacho: De 69 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pescado y marisco para la venta.
Doris Jiménez G.: De 24 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos. 
Laura Rosario López Román: De 27 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa y perfumes para la venta.
Edilia C. Hernández: De 30 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pescado y marisco para la venta.
Flora O. Hernández: De 47 años de edad se dedica a la compra de zapatos y perfumes para la venta.
Iván C. Ramírez: De 21 años de edad se dedica a la compra de herramientas para la construcción.
José Enrique O. López: De 26 años de edad se dedica a la compra de herramientas para el trabajo de hojalatería.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Buena Vista group has Ofelia López A. as a representative. She is 49 and lives in a common law marriage with Mr. Enrique O. Soriano. She has 3 children, who are all married. Ofelia asked for the loan to buy more products for her store. She wants the loan to grow her business and make a little more income in order to have a better quality of life and have food to eat every day.  

Laura Rosario López Román is 27 years old. She is in a common law marriage with Mr.Panfilo Mozo Gutiérrez, who works in the field. She has 3 children, whose ages are 8, 5 and 2 years old. One of them is in second grade. Laura sells perfume and clothing. She makes her sales from house to house with her relatives, neighbors and friends. She has been doing this economic activity for 2 years out of need, since her daughter will start primary school and she will need more money, and what her husband makes is not enough. That is why she decided to sell these products. With the loan that she obtained, she bought more merchandise, such as: blouses, skirts and pants, as well as some bottles of perfume, in order to have more income and help with the family expenses.  

Laura's goal is for her children to study and have a profession so that they will have better opportunities tomorrow and not undergo the need that they are living through now.  

The people who make up this group are the following: 
Brenda M. V.: 23 years old, she buys and sells clothes. 
Juana V. Pérez: 35 years old, she buys ingredients and sells snacks.
Socorro Ramírez L.: 51 years old, she buys ingredients and sells snacks.
Martina C. F.: 33 years old, she buys and sells perfume.  
Ofelia López A.: 49 years old, she buys and sells groceries, produce and clothing.  
Anastacia C. Bacho: 69 years old, she buys and sells fish and seafood.  
Doris Jiménez G.: 24 years old, she buys ingredients and sells snacks.
Laura Rosario López Román: 27 years old, she buys and sells clothing and perfume.  
Edilia C. Hernández: 30 years old, she buys and sells fish and seafood. 
Flora O. Hernández: 47 years old, she buys and sells shoes and perfume. 
Iván C. Ramírez: 21 years old, he buys and sells construction tools.  
José Enrique O. López: 26 years old, he buys and sells bodywork tools.

loans.use: to buy groceries, produce and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Chonn

texts.en:
Chonn P. is a 28-year-old fish vendor who lives with her parents in the Siem Reap province. 

Every day in early morning, Chonn P. always goes to buy fish from the fishermen and then hurries to bring her fish by motorbike to the market for resale. 

Chonn P. is working hard at her business. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. She hopes to be able to find extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase a larger quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell

loans.name: Tuvshinbold

texts.en:
Mr. Tuvshinbold is 28 years old and lives with his wife, mother-in-law and dog (a German shepherd) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a family house which Tuvshinbold built last year. 

His wife Bayannuur, 26, works in a Cashmere factory as a planning officer. Mr. Tuvshinbold is professional welder but currently he runs a taxi business, carrying people around Ulaanbaatar city and bringing extra income to the family. He earns around $290 a month from his taxi business. 

The house he built is not complete yet and the entrance, windows and insulation needs to be done. The Mongolian winter is one of the harshest in the world. The temperature in winter time, especially at night, drops to -40 degrees of Celsius. Therefore, the houses should be well-insulated from the cold. Currently most households in Ulaanbaatar city use coal fired stoves for heating which pollutes the air to dangerous level. The Mongolian government takes some measures to improve the air quality by helping to replace coal fired stoves to gas ones and improve the insulation of the houses. Well-insulated houses require less charcoal to burn, emitting less poisonous smoke into the air and helps to save on heating costs of households. 

The loan he is asking for will be used to pay for insulation materials for the walls, double-glazed windows and other building materials to finish the house and to make the house warm and well-insulated from the cold.

loans.use: to pay for insulation materials for the walls, double-glazed windows and other building materials to finish the entrance and to make the house warm and well-insulated.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Fernando; el tiene 40 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de negocio de artesanía, el vende artesanía como collares, chompas, chalinas y aretes en la casa de taller del distrito de Chinchero y también el socio es profesor del nivel secundario, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía y mejorar el trabajo de profesor.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fernando is a member of the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Fernando is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities with working in his handicraft business.  He sells handicrafts like necklaces, sweaters, scarves, and earrings.  He sells them from the shop at his house in the Chinchero district.  

Also, he is a high school teacher.  He gets his children ahead through these businesses.

He wants to expand his business of selling handicrafts, and he wants to improve his work as a teacher.  He is requesting the loan in order to buy handicrafts wholesale.  He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to makes his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts wholesale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old and is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 19 and the youngest is only 1 year old.

Evelyn is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She helps her husband grow rice and corn crops at their farm. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Evelyn sells their harvest and fattened pigs at her town's market. She said that through their farm and small piggery, her family's needs are met.

This loan will be used by Evelyn to purchase farm fertilizers, piglets and feed. She hopes for her businesses to improve in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Gredin

texts.es: Gredin, tiene la edad de 33 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal y la mano de obra. El pretende con realizarle esta mejora su cafetal produzca mayores cantidades de café esta próxima cosecha. El cuanta con la plantación existente  en buenas condiciones y quiere es mejorarla para que tenga una buena floración y así poder obtener rangos de cosechas más grandes. El pretende generar los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de el y sus padres y seguir saliendo adelante con su proyecto cafetalero.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Gredin is 33 years old, single and lives with his parents. With the loan, he hopes to purchase raw materials for his coffee crops and to hire workers. He hopes this will improve his coffee production for the upcoming harvest. His coffee crops are in good condition and he wants to improve them so they have better flowering and he can secure a larger harvest. Gredin hopes to earn the necessary income to ensure his well-being and that of his parents and so he can continue making headway as a coffee producer. This is his first loan with Kiva partner FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR is providing him with a loan with better credit facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his coffee crops and to hire workers.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena comes from the village of Ikalto, Kakheti Region. She is 39 years old and lives with her 18-year-old daughter who goes to school. Shorena works as a salesperson in a local store. She gets a monthly salary, but the main source of income for her family comes from agricultural activities. Shorena has a milk cow. She produces approximately 25 kg cheese per month and sells it to dairy product retailers. Also she owns one hectare of land where maize is grown. Harvested maize is used for feeding the cow. 

Shorena requested a loan to expand her dairy farm. She will purchase two additional milk cows and produce 75 kg of cheese monthly. It will significantly increase the income of the family. Increase of income is very important for Shorena, as she needs resources for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba Marina tiene 56 años, su actividad es una librería. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación León 2000, por lo que se siente muy bien ya que los créditos han sido de gran ayuda. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos del hogar, ya que no tenía un trabajo estable y con este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia. El crédito es para la compra de  lápices, hojas, cartulinas, lápices de colores, borrador, reglas y cuadernos.
texts.en:
Alba Marina is 56 years old and runs a stationery store.  She has been a client of Fundación León 2000 for a long time and she feels very happy because the loans have been a great help to her.  She started out in this business because she needed to cover her household expenses as she didn't have a stable job.  Through this business, she has been able to support her family.

Alba Marina will use this loan to buy pencils, paper, card, colored pencils, erasers, rulers and composition books.

loans.use: to buy pencils, paper, card, colored pencils, erasers, rulers and composition books

loans.name: Angelica Noemi

texts.es:
Angélica es una mujer trabajadora de 33 años de edad. Ella es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos en la zona rural del distrito de Paijan- La Libertad. Goza de buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos, quienes la consideran una personas trabajadora y responsable.

Angélica se dedica a la venta de frutas, desde hace 3 años, en el mercado de su comunidad. Afortunadamente, cuenta con clientela establecida que diariamente compra sus productos. Ella desea invertir en su negocio para que este crezca y es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitirá comprar frutas y acondicionar su puesto de trabajo.

Angélica tiene muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia y de darles una mejor educación a sus hijos, por eso pone mucho empeño en su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Angélica is a hard-working, 33 year old woman.  She is a single mother and lives with her two children in the rural district of Paijan, La Libertad.  She enjoys good references from her neighbors and acquaintances who regard her as hard-working and responsible. 

Angélica has been selling fruit at her community market for three years.  Fortunately, she has established customers who buy her products daily.   She wants to invest in her business so that it grows and so she is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan will enable her to buy fruit and set up her work space. 

Angélica has a strong desire to help her family get ahead and to provide her children with a better education.  For this reason, she puts a great deal of effort into her business so that she will earn better profits and be able to accomplish her goals.
.

loans.use: to buy fruit and set up her work space.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old and the mother of seven children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Cristina has been engaged in a service-based business and she has sold spare motor parts for the past four years. She generates about 2,000 PHP each month.

Cristina is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan with GDMPC to purchase spare parts and renew services. This is her first loan with GDMPC. In the future, Cristina hopes to expand her business and earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amalia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Amalia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional inventory of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her reach her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es:
Sulma es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de quesos, los compra en la chacra y los vende en los mercados. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para comprase un moto taxi y ayudarse en el traslado de los quesos.
Sulma es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 4 años, esta muy feliz, le gusta la facilidad con la que obtiene los préstamos, no les piden tantos papeles como las otras financieras, valora el apoyo que le dan sumado con las capacitaciones que le ayuda a ser mejor persona, saber invertir bien y tambien a ahorrar.
texts.en: Sulma is a member of the communal bank "Llapanchik". She has 2 children and she has a cheese sales business. She buys cheese in the farms and she resells in the markets. The loan which she requests will be used to purchase a motorcycle transport vehicle to help her transport cheese. Sulma has worked with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 4 years and she is very happy. She appreciates the easy loan process which does not require as much documentation as other financial institutions. She values the support that she has received, as well as the orientation sessions that help her to be a better person. She knows how to invest wisely and she also knows how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle transport vehicle.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Maritza; tiene 37 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia tiene 1 hija;  La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora  y sola saca adelante a su única hija, la socia trabaja en una agencia de viajes y turismo ella está en el área de operaciones la socia en sus ratos libres  trabaja con su familia en la atención de sus tienda de abarrotes,  la socia con este ingreso logra mejorar su economía , la socia  ahora con el nuevo crédito desea invertir en la apertura de su restaurante, ella junto a sus madre pondrá su restaurante y lo seguirá administrando de manera paralela a sus trabaja. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y de los últimos acabados para su restaurante.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “San Rafael” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The member, Martiza, is 37 years old. She is single and has 1 daughter. He is a very hardworking woman and is alone in providing for her daughter. She works in a travel agency in the area of operations. In her free time she works with her family in their grocery store. With this income she is able to improve her economic situation. With this loan she wants to open a restaurant. Along with her mother, she will open her restaurant and will also continue working in her job. She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of basic products and finishing touches for her restaurant. 

Maritza is appreciative of the support that she has been provided and she also promises to make her re-payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase basic products and finishing touches for her restaurant

loans.name: Delgersaihan

texts.en:
Delgersaihan is 42 years old and lives with his children and wife in a 'ger' in Hovd province of Mongolia. Three of his children are college students and one child is a high school student. His wife is selling dairy products, especially milk, for the fifth year. 

Delgersaihan started his business in 2009 by selling wood and coal. Before that, he was a security guard. His business is very profitable during the wintertime and the dairy products trade is also profitable in summertime. He is a diligent man who says "Currently our expenses are quite high due to the college tuition fees of three children and other such costs. Thus, this loan will help me to manage these issues effectively." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase coal and wood and will store them while the demand and price are low.

loans.use: To purchase coal and wood.

loans.name: Malikakhon

texts.ru: Маликахон жительница города Худжанд.  Возраст, 41 год. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Она занимается торговлей женской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа туники, теплых колготок, плащей и нижнего белья.
texts.en: Malikakhon is a resident of the town of Khujand.  She is 41 years old, married and has two children.  She is involved in sales of women's clothing and has been in this business for five years.  Malikakhon is requesting this loan for the purchase of tunics, warm stockings, raincoats and undergarments.

loans.use: to purchase of tunics, warm stockings, raincoats and undergarments

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 22, 18, 14, 8 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la atención de su panadería, la socia tiene una panadería en casa y en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de harina al por mayor para la elaboración de los panes y pasteles que elabora. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina al por mayor para la elaboración de panes y pasteles.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Teresa, 38, is a member of the “Imasumac II” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  She’s married and has five children who are 23, 22, 18, 14 and 8 years old.  She runs a bakery at home and needs to invest the loan on this occasion to buy flour at wholesale for the bread and cakes she makes.  She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of flour at wholesale to make bread and cakes.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make all her installment payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna keeps beehives and cultivates land. Anna would like to increase the number of beehives and enlarge her business. With the requested loan Anna plans to purchase beehives. This loan will help Anna to provide her family with better living conditions, as her salary from the local school and present income are barely enough to meet the ends. Anna lives with her husband and son. Development of beekeeping will also promote agriculture within the community.

loans.use: to purchase beehives

loans.name: Shinning Star Group

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Jane from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, who all attend school. Jane runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for the past four years. She says the main challenge she faces is having capital for restocking. Jane has requested a loan of $400 for grocery stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her stock levels, thereby maximizing on profit. In the future, Jane plans to have a wholesale grocery business.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock

loans.name: Gercita

texts.en:
Gercita is 65 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City.  She is widowed with five children. 

To earn a living, Gercita owns and operates a restaurant.  She earns about PHP 2,000 each month. 

Gercita has a requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

Gercita has been a member of PMPC for a month.  

In the future, Gercita would like to have a food stall in the market.  She is a hardworking mother and takes good care of her five children.  Gercita is honest and God fearing.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Punsalmaa

texts.en: Punsalmaa is a 47-year-old widowed mother of one who lives with her son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bulgan Province, Mongolia. Her son is a school student. She started her small commodity retailing business in 2001 by selling items in the streets. She sells souvenirs, strings, toys, etc. Now that she is the only one with the income in the family, she rented a counter in a market. However, she needs a supply to run a business. She is a strong and hard-working woman who says, "It's been hard since my husband died, however I will never give up and I will do everything I can to support my son." She is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy more supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy more supplies to sell

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es:
La señora Angélica solicita el préstamo para surtir su negocio, ya que comenta que últimamente debido a la inseguridad sólo puede tener abierto su negocio de día. 
Sin embargo no ha tenido suficientes ventas y esto le genera pocas ganancias.
Ellos han decidido poner una solución a su problema, lo que implicará que la señora Angélica abra el negocio durante el día y su esposo se encargará de hacerlo por las noches, ya que es cuando se vende más la comida preparada, como son los tacos de carne asada y los lonches. 
Con esta inversión podrán tener más variedad de guisos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y así tendrán más ganancias para la familia, ya que tiene dos hijos estudiando.
texts.en:
Angelica requests a loan to stock her store. Recently, because of lack of security, she has been able to open her store during the day, but hasn't had enough merchandise to sell door to door so she isn't making as much money. 

Along with her husband, Angelica has found a solution to the problem, which is that she will work at the store during the day, and her husband will help at night, which is when she sells food like beef tacos and snacks.

With this loan they can have a greater variety of stews to offer her customers and will earn more money for her family. They have two children who are in school.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread, legumes to make stews and sell them.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “La Esperanza” empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde este año mediante la promoción y visita de la  asesora se logró formar un nuevo grupo integrado por 13 mujeres de la misma zona. Las señoras son muy  unidas, trabajadoras  y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo e individualmente. Se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y solidaridad , en forma conjunta  dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ursulina, quien se dedica a la venta de chipas (alimento tradicional paraguayo). Comenta que se dedica hace un buen tiempo a esto y que gracias a este trabo ha podido ayudar en su casa y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen. Ella desea algún día poder tener su propio negocio de chipa y de esa forma seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas para poder vender y de esa forma estar más cerca de su sueña.
texts.en:
The "La Esperanza" ["Hope"] women's communal bank started working with the Fundación Paraguaya this year after a loan officer visited them. Thirteen women from the area formed this new group together. These women are very united and hard-working. They have a great desire to work and succeed both individually and as a group. They are working very well as a team within the women's communal bank program.
Ursulina, a group member, sells chipas (a traditional Paraguayan food). She says that she has been doing this for some time now, and thanks to this work she has been able to help her family and cover their daily costs. She wants to be able to have her own chipa business one day and thus keep growing.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of chipas to sell, so that she will get even closer to fulfilling her dream.

loans.use: to buy chipas [a traditional Paraguayan food] for the next sale.

loans.name: Guediouma

texts.fr:
Monsieur GUEDIOUMA  est né vers 1970 à KAMBO dans la préfecture de KADIOLO. Père de 5 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à KADIOLO (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Il mène les activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 5 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment de maïs. Afin d’avoir les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire sa clientèle, il collabore avec l’Institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui , il est à son premier prêt.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 3 tonnes et 1/2 de maïs. Il s’approvisionne à KAMBO et ses villages avoisinants. Les céréales sont stockés dans son magasin. Il  les revend en gros au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et souvent il les transporte à SIKASSO au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Guediouma was born around 1970 in Kambo in the Kadiolo prefecture. Father to five children he lives in a traditional family in Kadiolo (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

He has been managing a business marketing cereals for more than five years. His experience in this domain has brought him a good reputation and he receives orders for cereals, notably corn. 

In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy his clientèle, he is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first loan. This loan will allow him to buy 3 1/2 tons of corn. He gets his supplies in Kambo and its neighboring villages. The cereals are stored in his store. He resells them wholesale for cash to a clientèle made up of men and often transports the cereals to Sikasso as needed. 

With this loan, he envisions making an average monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to pay the interest on his loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman who has four children. Lolita is 52 years old. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Lolita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Lolita wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Félix Amanda

texts.es:
Félix Amanda se dedica a la actividad de docencia en una comarca del municipio de El Sauce desde hace muchos años, es una persona de buenas costumbres la cual enseña a los niños de todas las edades con el fin de formar personas con sólidos conocimientos. 

Es madre de cuatro hijos todos en edad escolar, los cuales los está preparando en conjunto con su esposo para que sean profesionales y personas de bien para la sociedad.

Una de sus necesidades que tiene actualmente es repellar su vivienda para posteriormente pintarla todo poco a poco en la medida de lo posible y mediante el crédito que le otorga Ceprodel, por lo cual está solicitando su séptimo crédito para invertirlo exclusivamente en la compra de materiales como  cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para mejorar la apariencia de dicha vivienda y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Félix Amanda has been a teacher in a village in the municipality of El Sauce for many years.  She’s a person of good habits who teaches children of all ages aiming at forming persons with solid knowledge.  She is the mother of four school age children that she and her husband are raising to become professionals and people who are good for society.

One of the needs she currently has is to plaster the walls in her house to gradually paint it later as it is possible through the Ceprodel loan.  Because of this she’s asking for her 7th loan to use exclusively to buy cement and sand and to pay labor costs to improve the appearance of her dwelling and to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Claros

texts.es: Claros vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en este rubro y se siente orgulloso de la experiencia ganada pues eso le ha permitido mantener su calidad y obtener las mejores cosechas de la zona, trabaja desde la salida del sol hasta su puesta, el terreno de cultivo está apto para el crecimiento y desarrollo de cultivos y está muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque todo lo que comercia es de calidad, a buen precio y sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Claros es un hombre decidido y muy dedicado a su trabajo siempre está luchando duro por encontrar oportunidades que le ayuden a alcanzar el éxito; en la última cosecha lastimosamente debido a las lluvias tuvo pérdidas, ahora en esta temporada de siembra quiere recuperarse y aumentar la producción pero necesita de un apoyo de capital que le permita invertir en insumos por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Claros tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura saldará la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a married man with children who still attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

He has operated a kiosk retail shop business for the past year selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by debtors who purchased goods on credit from his kiosk.

With the loan that he is requesting he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Nearypisey's Group

texts.en: A single mother, Nearypisey has been struggling to provide daily food to her four children by selling soft drinks. The business does not make much money, as the business is new and does not have a variety of products. To increase sales, Nearypisey requested loan fund capital to get in more items, hoping to attract more customers.

loans.use: to get in more items for her soft drinks store.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Shida

texts.en: Shida is 23 years old, unmarried and living with her parents in Iringa District, Tanzania. Shida is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills to students for 2.5 hours per week. She requests a Kiva loan to start a women’s clothing business near her community. Shida will use her profits to expand her business by purchasing women's clothes in bulk and selling them in her shop.

loans.use: To start a women's clothing business

loans.name: Edwin Edgardo

texts.en:
I’m the owner of a small store called M., located in a room in my home, in one of the most popular areas in my community. I’ve opened it a year ago. I hope to make my business grow, and that’s why I need to provide new and more products since this is what my clients are requesting. With my income I have been able to help my family. My goal is to continue to support my children’s education.

Loan Use: Purchase bread, coffee, sugar, milk, eggs, soft drinks, and others.

Soy propietario de una pequeña pulperia llamada M., ubicada en mi casa de habitacion en una las zonas mas conocidas de mi comunidad. Tengo 1 año de tenerlo operando, mi deseo es hacer crecer mi negocio mucho mas, por lo que necesito abastecer mi pulperia con nuevos productos, variados ya que mis clientes piden les de algo nuevo. Con las ingresos que percibo de mis ventas he podido ayudar a mi familia, mi meta es poder seguir apoyando a mis hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Compra de pan, cafe, azucar, leche, huevos, refrescos y otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy capentry raw materials for his business

loans.name: Mohammad Smail

texts.en: Mohammad Smail is 35 years old. He lives in a household of four in District 6 of Kabul,  Afghanistan. He is married. He is a car mechanic but he is working in another shop. He has six years of experience and now he want to borrow a loan to take a shop and buy all the materials for a shop to work on it. He is the supporter of his family. He wants to help his family and join his children in school to study. He wants to work hard and be a good business dealer and good mechanic of cars. Now he is very happy with this loan of AFSG.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for the shop.

loans.name: Muhaio

texts.en:
Muhaio is a master of sewing in her workshop, which is located in the center of town. She was a talented girl from childhood, but her parents could not provide her with the opportunity to get a higher education. She was an assistant for an experienced designer and learned all her skills. She was able to open her own workshop in 2000. She has also taught 20 girls and helped them to find jobs.

She presently has 6 seamstresses and 4 assistants in her workshop. There are 10 sewing machines for them. Muhaio has many clients and always tries to meet their needs. Muhaio helps them to choose a modern design for their dresses. Her beautiful smile and creative nature attracts more and more new clients.

In the future, Muhaio would like to employ one more seamstress and buy a sewing machine for her.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Ngoran Eugenie

texts.en: K. Ngoran Eugenie is a dynamic and ambitious 40 year old woman. She lives with her partner who works as a driver for a public transportation company. Eugenie sells a variety of fresh legumes and vegetables in Port-Bouët, one of the very populated suburbs in the south of Abidjan District. She has been in business for a number of years and has an 11 year old boy who will start grammar school in September 2007. Eugenie is one of the key contributors towards generating income for her extended family and helps to pay for the school fees and tuition of other children in the family. Eugenie joined the AE&I Microcredit Program in February 2005.

loans.use: Konan Ngoran Eugenie will use the loan to purchase goods from the fields

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.ru:
Shamsullo S., 25, is married and has 2 children. Shamsullo has a dealership that sells SIM and prepaid phone service cards. For that, he rents a place at the bus station near the State University of Kurgan-Tube—a busy location with lots of students and commuters passing by. Shamsullo has been in business for 5 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of SIM and prepaid phone service cards. Shamsullo plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шоев Шамсулло, возраст – 25 лет, образование среднее техническое, женат, имеет 2 детей. Шамсулло имеет дилерский центр по продаже сим-карт и карт для пополнения баланса мобильных телефонов. Для этого он арендует помещение находящееся на автобусной остановке, которое расположено недалеко от Государственного Университета в городе Курга-Тюбе. Этим видом услуг занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести большее количество сим-карт и карточек по пополнению баланса мобильных телефонов. Так как его центр находится недалеко от Университета, студенты и другие люди стоящие на остановке могут приобретать сим-карты и карточки для пополнения баланса мобильных телефонов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of SIM and prepaid phone service cards

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
I am Parveen B. from Lahore, second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five, four boys and one girl. I am not educated but I understand the importance of being educated. Therefore, I enrolled all my children to school. But unfortunately, my elder children dropped school in the secondary grades. At present, only my youngest son attends school. 
My husband has a vegetable business in the city food market, whereas my eldest son operates a vegetable stall in a market very near to our house. They together earn a profit of $500 a month. My husband has had this business for eight years.  Now, my husband wishes to expand his business for which he requires a loan of $675. We will save the money from these profits to buy a big house for us. My husband’s dream is that his business will prosper and he will be able to open up one more vegetable shop.

loans.use: Expand vegetable business

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr:
Born in 1989 in Lomé, Mr. Folly A. is still a student and is raising and marketing pigs to finance his studies. He began this work almost 5 years ago, but because he lacks capital to invest in his business, he is not able to develop it and earn as much from it as he potentially could. He is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which will allow him to buy some new breeds of pigs at up-country markets. This will permit him to further his studies and support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1989 à Lomé, Monsieur A. Folly est élève et fait l’élevage et la vente du porc pour se supporter dans ses études. Il a commencé cette activité depuis bientôt 5 ans mais faute de moyens il n’arrive pas à bien développer son élevage et n’en profite pas assez. Il sollicite un financement de $1000 qui lui servira à acquérir d’autres races de porcs sur les marchés intérieurs. Ceci va lui permettre d’avancer dans ses études et subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use:
Purchase of new breeds of pigs

Achat de nouvelles races de porcs

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Mrs. Kan Y., age 62, is a widow and works growing vegetables and reselling them for about $5.90 each day of income. She has three children:  one who works as a driver for a company; one who is a motor-taxi driver earning $2 each day; and one who is married and lives separately. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase cashew nuts from the growers and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts from the growers to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Camilo Ernesto

texts.es:
Camilo is a young jeweller that creates and sells gold and silver jewellery. He learned his trade 13 years ago from his uncle and now he owns and operates his own jewellery shop. He meets with his clients and personally transforms their requests into beautiful hand made gold and silver jewellery.

Business is going well, thanks to a large client base and client references for future business. He has gained a reputation as a fine jeweller creating a beautiful high quality product. Sales are up and his wife is helping out so he can concentrate on dealing with the backlog of orders. Camilo wants to buy a new sales stand which his wife would manage to increase their business opportunities.

Thanks to their business venture, Camilo and his wife have achieved economic stability. Their current dream is to become parents as up until now they have dedicated all their energies to raising the business. Now they want to become a family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase 18kt gold to make jewellery

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao P., age 55, is a mother of five children. She stays at home and looks after the children, including cooking food for her family members. Two of her children are married and live away from home. Another earns a living by selling rice. The other children are students.

Her husband Mr. Kem Keng, 54, works as a wedding chef. He also installs the musical system whenever one of the nearby villages has a party or celebration. On average, he earns around $12 in revenue per day.

He needs a loan from Kiva to expand his business. He would like to purchase more tables and chairs and other equipment for his wedding business. This will help him if his customers need to celebrate a big party or a huge weeding. This will allow the family to earn more income. (Mrs. Mao P. is pictured and this is the second loan for her family.)

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs and other equipment

loans.name: Menyikwa Enterprises Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Joyce K. is an average young Kenyan. She is married with four children of her own. She also cares for the child of her late sister.

Joyce started her tailoring business three years ago after completing her tailoring course in Kisii Town. Before venturing into the business, Joyce worked on commission for a friend in Getembe market, in the town of Kisii. From this job, she accumulated savings to start her own business. She started with one sewing machine but she has worked hard to expand her business and currently has two sewing machines.

With the little profit she gets from her business, she is still able to provide food, clothing, and shelter and pay school fees for her children. Her greatest joy would be to see her children go to secondary school for higher education, if possible.

With the help of her loan, Joyce will be able to purchase more clothing materials for her business and thus to increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Luya

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Luya M.. She is single and has five children betwenn the ages of 7 and 20. In 2000, Luya established her grocery business.

Luya has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now needs a new loan to buy rice, flour, fruits and vegetables. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase rice, flour, fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Mr. Bakary C. is 31 years old, married to two women, has 3 children, and lives in the Dugu district, Cora de Pelengana, Ségou, in a polygamous household.

He abandoned his studies very early on due to socio-economic reasons. He quickly entered the economic world by helping his parents in their business. Bakary himself opted for the sale of gas-oil (fuel oil) next to his parents.

After more than 15 years of experience in this field, he has a heightened business sense and specifically a mastery of the sale of hydrocarbons.

He supplies himself generally on the spot in Ségou, and sometimes in Togo (a neighbouring country in West Africa).

He makes his sales next to the main road in the town of Ségou, and his clientele is composed of taxi and minibus drivers and of retailers in the neighbouring villages.

To obtain financial resources in order to meet the demands of his customers, he took part in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso by asking for an individual loan.

He intends to use this loan to buy 4 barrels of gas-oil, 5 metres of piping, and 10 empty barrels.

Thus, with this new loan, he intends to realize a monthly profit of 300,000 CFA. With this profit, he will contribute to the running expenses of his family.

In the future, he hopes to open a service station (to sell gasoline, gas-oils, lubricants, etc.)

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Bakary C. est âgé de 31 ans marié à deux femmes, père de 3 enfants ; et résidant au quartier Dugu cora de pelengana Ségou dans une famille polygame.

Il abandonna très vite l’école pour des raisons sociales .Il s’insère rapidement dans le tissu economique en aidant ses parents à faire du commerce. Bakary lui, opte pour la vente du gas-oil à côté d’un de ses parents.

Après plus de 15 années d’expérience dans ce créneau, il a un sens élevé des affaires et surtout la maîtrise de la vente des hydrocarbures.

Il s’approvisionne très généralement sur place à Ségou et quelques fois au TOGO (un pays côtier de l’Afrique de l’ouest).

Il effectue ses ventes au bord de l’avenue principale de la ville de Ségou et sa clientèle est composée de chauffeurs : de taxis, de minibus ; et de boutiquiers (revendeurs) des villages environnants

Pour obtenir des ressources financières afin de faire face aux demandes de la clientèle, il adhère le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso en demandant un prêt individuel.

Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 barils de gas-oils, 5 mètres de raccord et 10futs vide.

Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 300 000 CFA. Avec ce bénéfice, il contribuera aux dépenses courantes de la famille. Dans l’avenir il compte ouvrir une station service ( : vente d’essence, de gas-oils, de lubrifiants, etc.)

loans.use: To buy barrels of gas-oil

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
The women of the Danaya Group are all married and average 41 years of age and four children. They generally live in polygamous households in the Sokala district of Zambougou Fouta (Ségou Prefecture, Republic of Mali) with their husbands, co-spouses, and children.

Linked by ties of professional relationships, friendship, and community, they do commerce in condiments and foodstuffs. They generally buy their goods locally (in Zambougou) and in the surrounding villages (such as Teisserela et Ganssola) in order to store them per the allotted family plots. In contrast, condiments are purchased at the grand market of Ségou from wholesalers at the weekly markets.

They resell these items retail, cash or credit accepted, on market days either door-to-door or from home. The customers are generally made up of women and men. In order to meet the needs of their burgeoning customer base, the members of the Danaya Group have decided to ask for a group loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first loan.

They intend to use this loan to buy one sack of rice, 250 liters of milk, 6 sacks of peanuts, 10 boxes of smoked fish, and one sack of beans. These goods are sold retail. They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA, which will be used for covering the loan interest, for bolstering working capital, and for assisting with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans avec 4 enfants et vivent généralement dans des foyers polygamiques dans le quartier Sokala de Zambougou Fouta (Préfecture de Ségou République du Mali) avec leurs époux coépouses et enfants.

Liées par des relations professionnelles, d’amitié et de voisinage, elles exercent le commerce de condiments et de denrées alimentaires. Elles achètent généralement les denrées alimentaires sur place (à Zambougou) et dans les villages environnants (tels Teisserela et Ganssola) pour les emmagasiner au niveau de la concession conjugale.
