Par contre les condiments sont achetés au grand marché de Ségou auprès des grossistes fréquentant les foires hebdomadaires.

Elles revendent ces articles en détail au comptant et à crédit les jours de foires de façon ambulante ou à domicile. La clientèle est généralement constituée de femmes et d’hommes. Afin de satisfaire les besoins de leurs clientèles de plus en plus croissantes, les membres du groupe Danaya ont décidé de demander un prêt de groupe à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt.

Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt un sac de riz ; 250 litres de lait ; 6 sacs d’arachide ; 10 cartons de poissons fumés et 1 sac de haricot. Ces produits son vendus en détail. Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, renforcer les fonds de commerce et aider dans les charges de la famille.

loans.use: To buy condiments and foodstuffs

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan N. tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos menores.

Juan nos cuenta que desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a vender leche y queso la cual generan ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su familia incluyendo a su madre anciana que vive con él.

Empezó su pequeño tambo gracias a una herencia que recibió de su padre quien le había dejado cinco vacas lecheras, tres terneros, un terreno de tres hct., con esto y con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos fueron progresando, hoy día con la venta de leche y queso que lo realizan diariamente pueden llevar una vida dignamente.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una forrajera, herramienta que le permitirá elaborar el alimento para sus animales.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan N. is 57 years old and lives with his wife and two children.

Juan tells us that he has worked for more than 10 years selling milk and cheese, which earn him the income to support his family, including his elderly mother, who lives with him.

He began his small dairy farm thanks to an inheritance he received from his father, who left him five milk cows, three calves, and a three-hectare plot of land. With this and the help of his wife and children Juan was able to make progress. Today, by selling cheese and milk each day he can earn a dignified living.

Juan is requesting this loan to buy a feeding trough for his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a feeding trough

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=33569&_tpos=3&_tpg=2

Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Zenaida es conviviente, tiene 24 años, 1 hija y esta en espera de su segundo hijo, Zenaida junto a su esposo tienen una maderera en un local alquilado que esta ubicado en el Jr. Malecón Romero, Zenaida vende palos de eucalipto, maderas variadas, sus productos los adquiere en el mismo negocio de proveedores. Además brinda servicios de aserrados para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de un operario, Zenaida se encarga de la atención al publico y la cobranza.

Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera. Los sueños de Zenaida son tener las maquinarias necesarias en su negocio y luego ampliar y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the Retoño Communal Bank. Zenaida is 24, living with her partner and one daughter, and is expecting her second child. Zenaida and her husband have a lumber business in a rented location located in the Malecón Romero district. Zenaida sells eucalyptus lumber and various other woods. Their products are acquired from suppliers in the same business. She also provides sawing services with the help of an operator. Zenaida is in charge of serving the public and debt collection. Zenaida needs a loan of $350 that will be invested in the purchase of wood products. Her dreams are to have the machinery for her business and then to expand and have her own business location.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Zenaida needs a loan of $350 that will be invested in the purchase of wood products.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom K. rents a small atelier where she sews dresses for clients. She also has four students whom she teaches how to sew traditional dresses. She has been sewing for almost 16 years now. She wants to borrow money for buying materials and instruments for sewing so that she can offer better service to her clients.

loans.use: Purchasing materials for sewing dresses for sale.

loans.name: Ngoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoem S. is a farmer in Srae Vong Village in Takeo Province. On her plantation, she now faces an obstacle, because she does not have enough animals to plow the fields to cultivate rice. 

In order solve this problem, Mrs. Ngoem S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a buffalo to add to the one she now owns to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Tes Muth, helps her on the plantation. 

Mrs. Ngoem S. is 47 years old and the mother of three children who are all employed in a garment factory. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to add to the one she owns to plow the field.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S. A., 37, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her three children. She works in a grocery store, making around US$3 each day.  Her husband makes around US$5 each day as a blacksmith. Inflation has caused prices to soar in Cambodia and recent hikes in oil and rice prices have made for economic struggles for many Cambodians. Looking for ways to increase her income and combat rising expense costs, Sor S. A. has asked for a loan of US$700 to add to her grocery’s inventory and to raise pigs.

loans.use: To add to grocery inventory and raise pigs.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. is 54 years old. She is single and has four grown-up children who are independent now. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, cooking spices, table salt, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits etc. at the community market in her neighborhood.

With this loan, Patience wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to expand her business growth. Patience says your support would boost her business growth, looking at the number of customers she meets each day. Her picture was taken when she was coming from the market.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, and boxes of biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Mrs. Chreb C. is a villager in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phen Ya, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They don't earn enough income to provide a better house for their family. Mrs. Chreb C. requests a loan to buy timber to repair her house. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, the other two are attending school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to repair her house.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy M., 29,  of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines is happily married  with  three children.  Her  husband earns income  by transporting  people from their residences to the City traversing an average distance of about 67 kilometers. She augments her husband’s income  by venturing into  food vending. Most of her customers are her neighbors and vendors of the  village. Mercy wants to earn more to support the educational needs of her children and the needs of her family as well. She also wants to improve her food vending stall so she can accept dine-in customers. She joined  HSPFI’s microfinance program to get additional  capital for her business. She is requesting a loan of Php11,000. Mercy is thanking you for helping her realize her plan.

loans.use: To improve her food vending stall

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 25 year old man who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Hassan owns a barber shop. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Hassan first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. He decided on his business because of his experience and in order to increase his family’s income.

Hassan is requesting a loan for $800 from Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to purchase beauty products and a new seat for his salon. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and a new seat for his salon.

loans.name: Sabitiou

texts.fr:
T. Sabitiou est née le 14/06/1974 à TAKON, un village du département du PLATEAU dont elle est originaire. Sabitiou est mariée à AGBANGLA Djamiou et est mère de deux (2) enfants: l'aîné s'appelle Latifatou; il a quinze (15) ans et est en quatrième année du lycée. Le second enfant s'appelle Jalale, il a neuf (9) ans; Jalale est en cinquième année du cours primaire. Les besoins de la famille de Sabitiou sont assurés par son mari. Sabitiou et sa famille vit à Agbodjèdo, un quartier périphérique de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Sabitiou est arrivée à Cotonou à l'âge de quinze (15) ans après avoir abandonné l'école. Dès son arrivée Sabitiou s'est lancée dans la vente de pomme de terre de façon ambulante. C'est-à-dire que pour ses ventes Sabitiou passe de maison en maison avec le plateau de pomme de terre à la tête. Mais depuis trois ans, aidée par son mari et ses parents, Sabitiou a diversifié  son commerce: Aujourd'hui Sabitiou vend en plus des légumes, des fruits, des boissons, des savons liquides etc. Sabitiou vend dans le centre ville de Cotonou. La majorité de sa clientèle est faite d'étrangers résidents au Bénin (les Libanais, les Français, les Américains, etc). La demande de la clientèle de Sabitiou est devenue très importante. Pour la satisfaire, Sabitiou a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a aujourd'hui.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Sabitiou T. was born on June 14, 1974 in Takon, a village in the Plateau province, where her roots lie. She is married to Djamiou Agbangla and is the mother of two children: the elder is named Latifatou. He is 15 and in the fourth year at the lycée. Her second child is called Jalale; he is 9 and is in the 5th grade in primary school.

The needs of Sabitiou's family are covered by her husband. Sabitiou and her family live in Agbodjèdo, an outlying neighborhood near Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Sabitiou came to Cotonou at the age of 15, after having left off schooling. As soon as she arrived, Sabitiou began to sell potatoes, door-to-door, that is to say, she would go from house to house with a tray of potatoes on her head.

After three years, aided by her husband and her parents, Sabitiou diversified her business. Today, she sells vegetables, fruit, drinks, liquid soaps, etc. Sabitiou sells in the center of the city of Cotonou. Most of her clientele is made up of foreigners living in Bénin (Lebanese, French, Americans, etc.) The demand of her clientele has become quite big and to satisfy it, Sabitiou needs more working capital than she presently has.

The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organization is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of vegetables, fruit, drinks in cans and bottles, mineral water, liquid soap, etc.

loans.name: Martina Martha

texts.es: La Sra Martha tiene 51 años de edad ella cuenta con la actividad de venta de carne, desde hace 38 años, el puesto lo heredo de su mama; su trabajo comienza desde la 6:00 a.m. entregando carne a algunos restaurantes de nuestra ciudad, después se va para el puesto a vender a todas sus caseras (clientes) del mercado Yungas, este se encuentra ubicado en una populosa y céntrica zona de nuestra ciudad de La Paz donde las personas que viven alrededor hacen sus compras de artículos de primera necesidad para la alimentación de sus familias. Doña Martha, con el ingreso de la carnicería,  hace estudiar a sus dos hijas que están en la Universidad ya que el esposo no tiene un ingreso fijo, el préstamo lo invertirá en el aumento de capital de trabajo,  somos la única institución con la que trabaja desde hace un año demostrando  puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Martha is 51 years old. She has been selling meat for 38 years. She inherited this work from her mom. Her work begins at 6:00 a.m., delivering meat to various restaurants in the city. Then she heads over to her stand to sell to her customers in the Yungas market, located in a popular and central area of the city of La Paz where the locals do their grocery shopping to feed their families. Doña Martha, with her profits from the meat, sends her two daughters to the University, since her husband no longer has a fixed income. This loan will be invested in the expansion of working capital. This is the only institution with which she has worked for the last year, demonstrating punctuality with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
"I am a mother who dreamed big especially for my children. I want them to study harder in school and established their own future by having enough knowledge and education", says Mrs. Alona B., 43-year old mother of 3 children. "My husband, Porferio B. is the one managing our business. We work so hard to pay the tuition and other school fees of our children".

Mrs. B. is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. The loan will really help her have a better yield than the last time they harvested their farm. The loan will truly help her increase her income.

CEVI gives more than just loans to their clients, they provide training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Tumejidhatiti Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been a soap and khanga (a brightly colored piece of cloth that many East African women wear) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for ten years. She belongs to Tumejidhatiti group loan (Group code 2090). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $40. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Fatma is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap and khanga for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Fatma is 29 years old, married, and has three children: ages 6, 3 and 1.

Fatma will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Riziki, who has her own small business selling perfumes and body oil in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more soap and khanga for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery de 47 años es una madre de familia muy amorosa y dedicada, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hernán de 50 años y sus 3 hijos: Julio de 21, Roxana de 17 y Hugo de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Su tienda de manualidades es un negocio muy rentable, ya que son varios los clientes que concurren a su establecimiento para comprar adornos u otros artículos, ella trabaja desde muy temprano y se queda prácticamente durante todo el día dentro de su negocio, puesto que sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Lo que más le gusta a Nery de su trabajo es que puede realizar las tareas de su hogar al mismo tiempo que atiende su negocio. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir a la calle. Para más adelante, Nery desea mejorar la infraestructura de su tienda para poder brindarles a sus clientes la atención que ellos se merecen. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará materiales nuevos para fabricar más manualidades para la venta y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Nery is 47 years old and a mother of a very dedicated and lovely family. She lives in her own house with her 50-year-old husband Hernán and their 3 children: Julio is 21, Roxana is 17, and Hugo is 11. Her children are the motivation for all of her efforts. Her handicraft shop is a very profitable business, since she has several customers who come to her establishment to buy decorations and other items. She starts working very early in the morning and stays in her shop practically all day, since she knows that she has to work very hard to achieve her goals. What Nery likes best about her job is that she can do household tasks at the same time that she is working at her shop. She has been working this way for 12 years and what she likes the least about it is having to stay inside her shop all day without being able to go out into the street. For the future, Nery wants to improve the infrastructure of her shop so that she can provide her customers the service that they deserve. This is her third loan with MFP and she feels the responsibility to pay her dues on time, since she desires access to more loans in the future. In her village bank she is one of the most active partners. With the 2000 nuevos soles that she is asking for she will buy new materials to build more handicrafts to sell and therefore improve her economic gains.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Afiyo

texts.fr: Cette femme est très dynamique et vit avec son époux et ses trois enfants dans le quartier d’agoè cacavéli. Pour aider son époux dans les charges du foyer elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de céréales, elle a une ancienneté de plus de 5 ans dans ce commerce ce qui lui a permis d’en maîtriser la gestion. Actuellement une partie de son stock est épuisée, elle sollicite pour se réapprovisionner un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 11 sacs de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays.
texts.en: This woman is very dynamic and lives with her husband and three children in the neighborhood of Agoè Cacavéli.  In order to help her husband meet their household expenses, she started selling grains.  She's been in the business for over five years, which has enabled her to master the work.  A portion of her stock has run out, and in order to replenish it, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 11 sacks of maize, which she will obtain locally.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a member of the Mungu Muweza borrower group.She is a 40-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of six children aged 23, 22, 26, 12, 7, 3 years. She also cares for one other dependent.

Ten years ago, Saumu started her own clothing business selling kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print). She works ten hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tsh.

This is Saumu’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more fabric. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Saumu hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina B. sells gari,beans and provisions at Cape coast. Regina has received junior high school.  She is single and has two children. Regina has been selling gari and beans since 2004. She is responsible for up keeping of her family. Her loan will be used to buy to purchase more fresh beans and provision for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy to purchase more fresh beans and provision for resale.

loans.name: Ildika

texts.en:
Ildika is divorced. She is raising Alexander, her teenage son, by herself. She is a small entrepreneur who runs a business selling socks, women’s lingerie, tops, shirts and other clothing in the local marketplace in her home town of Uzhgorod. Ildika has been in this business for 15 years. She has loyal customers who come to buy from her because they trust the quality of her inventory and enjoy her friendly and respectful service. Ildika has about 5,000 Grivnyas of net profit each month.

Ildika is requesting a loan of 15,500 Grivny to purchase additional merchandise for the fall season, so she can increase her sales. She is a very punctual, discreet and focused entrepreneur. Ildika has repaid all her previous loans without any problems, which is good proof of the stability of her business. One of Ildika’s future business plans is to open one more vending location in the same market.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the fall season

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P. joined CEVI in August 2008. She’s now 61 years old with four children. She's living in Surallah, South Cotabato. She receives a daily income from her sari-sari (variety) store. She also has three harvests each year on her 1-hectare rice field. She sometimes had a good harvest and sometimes not due to irrigation cut-off and a pest attack.

She’s requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for her to sustain her business. With CEVI, she will be able to finance her farm with lower interest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita, es natural D. la ciudad del Cusco y ella pertenece al banco comunal, Chaska ñahui, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 60 años D. edad, ella es casada, tiene 2 hijos, y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración D. su tienda D. abarrotes,  nuestra socia tiene su pequeño negocio en la esquina D. su casa y ella solicita el préstamo para comprar mayor mercadería y así poder implementar su tienda.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Margarita was born in Cusco and is a member of the communal bank Chaska ñahui, located in Cusco. She is 60 years old and married with two children. She divides her time between her household labors and the management of her small business: a small general store which she operates in a corner of her home. She is requesting this loan to purchase larger quantities of merchandise to sell in her store. She appreciates and values the loan offered to her in this manner, and she is committed to making her loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her general store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. One has completed teacher training school while the others are still schooling.

Ama is a baker who uses flour for her production. She has been in business for fifteen years now despite the challenges she faces. She bakes bread, cake, meat pie, plantain chips, etc. and sells them at retail to her customers. She sells them by herself in the market center, and people also take bulk delivery from her.

Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials, since prices are going up. She requests a loan to remain in business and increase her profit as we approach Christmas. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S., age 64, has been in the farming business more than twenty-nine years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2.50 per day. She was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She has three children. All of them are married and are still living together in the family home.

One of her daughters, who is pictured, works as a garment worker and gives her small income to the family. Mom S. also earns additional profit from selling silk skirts, and she is taking out her first loan in order to accrue a larger number of silk skirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy a large number of silk skirts to sell

loans.name: Guila

texts.es:
La señora  GUILA R. E., tiene  36 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es conviviente y  tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella .La socia se dedica  a la venta de menús (alimento) en su domicilio.  Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró: arroz, papas, fideos, azúcar, aceite, pollo, etc. para la preparación de sus menús.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará platos, cubiertos, ollas, vasos, azúcar, fideos, papas, etc. para implementar mejor su negocio.
Guila sueña con tener su restaurante para lo cual esta ahorrando y trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Guila R. E. is 36 and lives in the Buenos Aires district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras II Communal Bank. She attended school until the fifth year of high school. She is in a common law marriage, and she has three children who are still economically dependent upon her. She sells prepared meals from her home. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to buy rice, potatoes, noodles, sugar, oil, and chicken, etc. to prepare the meals. She will use this loan for 800 PEN to buy plates, cutlery, pots, glasses, sugar, noodles, and potatoes, etc. to better equip her business. Guila dreams of having a restaurant, which she is saving for and working arduously to have.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plates, cutlery, pots, glasses, sugar, noodles, and potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desD. hace 14 años atrás del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 54 años D. edad, no cuenta con estudios, es casada y tiene 8 hijos(4 D. ellos viven con ella y los otro 4 son independientes).
Cristina se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado ovino y porcino y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital comprando ovejas y conejos.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar màs ganado como vacas y ovejas.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su chacra en Tacna para poder vivir mejor. 
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Lucia has been a member of the Communal Bank “Tupac Amaru I” for the past 14 years. She is from the Yunguyo District and Province, in the Puno Department. Lucia is 54 years old, does not have any formal schooling, and is married with 8 children (4 of them live with her, and the other 4 are living on their own). Cristina dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of sheep and pigs, and tells us that with the first loan of 300 PEN that she requested through the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to increase her capital by purchasing sheep and rabbits. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN, which she will use to purchase more cows and sheep. Her dream for her future is to own a plot of land in Tacna to be able to live better. What she most likes about her Communal Bank is saving and the meetings with the other group members.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina, de 38 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nicolás, de 29 años, y sus 3 hijos: Yesica de 18, Carmen de 16 y Michael de 8 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Todos los días, llegada las 9 de la mañana, Justina arma su puesto en las puertas del cementerio de su zona, donde diariamente vende flores. Ella tiene muchos clientes, sobre todo los días domingos, que es el día que más gente va al cementerio, ya que las flores que vende son muy bonitas y frescas.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para dedicarse a sus hijos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer toda la mañana en las puertas del cementerio soportando el intenso sol. 
Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando muy duro, ya que sabe que de ella depende el futuro bienestar de sus hijos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Justina con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a ahorrar un poco todos los días para lograrlo. Ella es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y es muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más flores para venderlas en estas fiestas de año nuevo.
texts.en:
Justina is 38 years old. She is a loving and hardworking mother who lives in her own home with her husband Nicolás, who is 29, and her three children: Yesica (age 18), Carmen (age 16), and Michael (age 8). Her children are the reason behind all of her efforts.

Every day at 9am, Justina begins stocking her vending post near the gates of the local cemetery where she sells flowers. She has many customers, especially on Sundays, which is the day most people visit the cemetery. The flowers she sells are always fresh and very beautiful. What she likes most about her job is that it gives her time to spend with her children. Justina has been in this business for four years and says the hardest part is spending all morning at the cemetery gates under the intense sun. She wants to keep working hard well into the future because she knows the welfare of her children depends on her.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Justina knows she has to make her payments on time, so she is willing to save a little bit every day in order to make that happen. She is the most cheerful member of her Communal Bank and is admired greatly by the rest of the group. With her loan of 1000 soles, she will buy more flowers to sell for the New Year’s festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flowers to sell

loans.name: Santos Trinidad

texts.es:
la sra. S. Trinidad F. se dedica a la venta de refrescos y frijoles congelados, tiene poco tiempo de realizar este tipo de actividad, S. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en Laure Abajo, San Lorenzo. 
los frijoles son bien vendidos en esta zona, este tipo de alimento se come en el desayuno y en la cena en muchas casas de esta zona.
vende los refrescos diariamente pero a veces se queda sin producto y los carros repartidores pasan solo una vez a la semana y esto le complica ya que se queda sin vender y sin tener ganancias.
necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos y frijoles y asi tener un buen inventario para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. Trinidad F. sells refreshments and frozen beans. She has little time in this business; S. is 49 years old and lives in Laure Abajo, San Lorenzo.

The beans are sold very well in the area; this type of food is eaten for breakfast and dinner in many houses in the area.

S. sells refreshments daily but sometimes she does not have the products and the delivery trucks are only around once a week and that is a problem for her since she has nothing to sell and is not able to have any profits.

She needs the loan to buy more refreshments and beans so that she can have a good inventory to cover all the necessities of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy refreshments and frozen beans.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a foal for feeding and resale

loans.name: Yola   Marcelina

texts.es:
LA SRA. YOLA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA, MUY CUMPLIDA SIN DIAS  DE ATRASO MOSTRANDO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, ELLA ESTA CASADA CON DON ANASTACIO, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER PROPIETARIO DE RADIO TAXI, TRANSPORTE URBANO, TIENE UNA HIJA MENOR, SU PUESTO DE VENTA SE ENCUENTRA EN LA CEJA, A UNOS PASOS DEL PUENTE CEJA-RELOJ.  LA SRA. VENDE LA HOJA DE COCA POR MENOR QUE LO ADQUIERE DEL MERCADO DE LA HOJA DE COCA EN VILLA FATIMA (LA COCA ES UN PRODUCTO TRADICIONAL DE BOLIVIA LO USABAN DESDE LA EPOCA INCAICA MUCHA GENTE CONSUME LA HOJA DE COCA PORQUE ALIVIA EL CANSANCIO, TAMBIEN PARA MATES Y COMO MEDICINA NATURAL. SU MAYOR ANHELO DE LA SRA. YOLA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO ES ARREGLAR SU CASA, AUMENTANDO CON UN PISO MÁS, PARA TENER MAYOR COMODIDAD Y VIVIR MEJOR. ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA TRES PAQUETES DE COCA. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDERR Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.

PARA SABER MAS SOBRE LA HOJA DE COCA VISITA ESTA PAGINA  http://images.google.com.bo/images?client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:es-ES:official&channel=s&hl=es&source=hp&q=HOJA+DE+COCA&um=1&ie=UTF-8&ei=7at-S9OLEYq1tgefuryyDw&sa=X&oi=image_result_group&ct=title&resnum=4&ved=0CCEQsAQwAw
texts.en:
Yola is a long-standing client; she is very responsible and repays loans precisely on time. She is married to Anastacio. Her husband is an urban radio dispatch taxi driver. She has a minor daughter. Her sales stand is located in La Ceja a few steps away from the Ceja-Reloj bridge. She sells coca leaves at retail. She gets her merchandise at the coca leaf market in Villa Fatima. (Coca is a traditional Bolivian product that has been used since Inca times. Many people consume coca leaf because it alleviates fatigue; it's also brewed as an herbal tea and as naturalistic medicine) She and her husband dream with improving the conditions of their house, by adding a second floor, in order to be more comfortable and live better. She is very hard-working and will use the funds to buy three packages of coca leaf. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan. To learn more about coca leaf, visit this web page: http://images.google.com.bo/images?client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:es-ES:official&channel=s&hl=es&source=hp&q=HOJA+DE+COCA&um=1&ie=UTF-8&ei=7at-S9OLEYq1tgefuryyDw&sa=X&oi=image_result_group&ct=title&resnum=4&ved=0CCEQsAQwAw

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coca leaf.

loans.name: Angelica Alberto

texts.pt:
Angélica Alberto T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade, casada não tem filhos. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa dos serviços sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ela, o marido é também professor. 
Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane transferido pelos serviços, trabalha como docente no Distrito de Boane a mais de 2 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Trabalha cerca de 8 horas por dia. Naõ tem empregado e aufere um salário de 4.822.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, cimento, carrinha de mão e outros) para iniciar com a construção da sua residência. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros créditos. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para dar continuidade com a obra de construção da sua residência.
texts.en:
Angelica Alberto T. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 30 years old and married with no children. She studied through 12th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives in a service workers' house with her husband, who is also a teacher, and she helps support a nephew who lives with her. Angelica left Maputo for Boane due to a job transfer. She has worked as a teacher in the Boane district for more than 2 years, and is employed by the Ministry of Education. She works around 8 hours a day. She has no employees working for her and takes home a monthly salary of 4822.00 Meticales, which she uses to cover household expenses. She is sometimes able to save some money in her bank account. Angelica has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through colleagues of hers who also work with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 15,500.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (zinc plates, cement, a wheelbarrow and other items) in order to start construction on her house. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to continue with her home construction project.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, zinc plates and other items)

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mr. Man M. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Amminas Man, were married in 1980 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live in separate homes while the other three children attend school. The family lives on National Road Number 6, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Man has been a fisherman for more than 15 years. He catches fish from the Mekong River near his village. Mrs Amminas Man sells the fish her husband catches to the villagers. Man has had a Kiva loan once before. He hopes to continue increasing the volume of fish he catches in order to generate more income. Therefore, he is applying for his second loan of $300 USD to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: José Moisés

texts.es: José Moisés Q. C. de 49 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, junto a un hijo y su padre de 69 años de edad, quien trabaja como vendedor de billetes de lotería. Al igual que su padre José se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante por los parques de Cojutepeque, San Vicente y otros pueblos más. Desde hace 15 años que José se gana la vida de esta manera, lo cual le ha traído muchos beneficios, ya que a pesar que es un trabajo bastante riesgoso y pesado, le ha permitido brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia, la cual depende por completo de él.  José solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de billetes de lotería, ya que gracias a todos los años que posee de trabajar de esta manera cuenta con muchos clientes, quienes tienen por costumbre comprar este tipo de lotería, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para José.
texts.en:
José Moisés Q. C., 49, lives in Cojutepeque, located in the department of Cuscatlán. He lives with his wife who dedicates herself to the household tasks, and his son and 69 year-old father, who sells lottery tickets. Just like his father, Jose sells lottery tickets, which he markets as a street vendor in the parks of Cuscatlán, San Vincente, and other towns. Jose has made his living this way for 15 years; it has brought him many benefits, in spite of the fact that it is a job that is risky and difficult. This job has allowed him to provide everything his family needs, and they depend entirely upon him. Jose requests a loan that he will to use to buy a greater quantity of lottery tickets, since thanks to all of his years of experience he has many customers who frequently buy lottery tickets, so this is very beneficial for José.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets to sell

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Rosa Alexandra

texts.es:
Rosa B. de 36 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil. Es madre soltera, ella tiene una niña que estudia en una escuela fiscal. 

Rosa empezó hace 6 años visitando la casa de sus vecinos y conocidos ofreciéndoles carnes a un bajo precio, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación implemento nuevos víveres para ofrecer, al ya tener un negocio establecido pudo construir la parte delantera de su casa y convertirla en un pequeño local.

Rosa trabaja en su tienda desde las 07:00 am hasta las 19:00 pm todos los días, vende carnes, bebidas, cereales, arroz etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, bebidas para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere tener la tienda mas surtida y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa B. is 36 years old. She lives in the urban zone Guasmo, in Guayaquil (it was named after the species of trees Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo is a popular neighborhood of a humble class, although it used to be a farm). She is a single mother, and she lives with one daughter who studies in a school for taxes. 6 years ago, Rosa began visiting her neighbors' and friends' homes to offer meat at a low price. Little by little with effort and dedication, she began offering additional foods, and now has an established business that she was able to construct alongside of her house to convert it into a small shop. Rosa works in her store from 7am until 7pm every day, selling meats, drinks, grains, rice, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy rice, sugar, and drinks for her store. In the future she wants to better stock the store, and to be able to better construct her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and drinks for Rosa's store

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Ai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty people who live in Prech village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sokhom A. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sokhom A. is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to feed her family; she is also a food seller. Her husband, Mr. Sophark Sok, sells recycled items. Her problem is that her husband’s business does not have a motorbike for transportation. To improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sokhom A. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school, while the youngest one is a month old. On the day of the loan disbursement, Mrs. Sokhom A. was busy working in the field. Instead, her husband, Mr. Sophark Sok, received the loan for her.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Katia Dolores

texts.es:
Katia es casada y tiene 1 hijo, estudia en la universidad, tiene una tienda de ropa llamada Chikokos en un local alquilado que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad, cuenta con la ayuda de personas que se encargan de las ventas, además Katia tiene un taller de confecciones a medida y también tiene personal. Katia trabaja en una empresa como supervisora. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de telas para cumplir los pedidos de polos que tiene.
Los sueños de Katia son tener una empresa de confecciones y terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Katia is married and has one son. She is currently studying in college and has a clothing store called Chikokos in a rented space located in the downtown area of the city. She depends on the help of other people who are in charge of sales. Additionally, Katia has a tailoring workshop with her own staff. She works for a company as a supervisor. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of fabrics to fulfill her requests for polo shirts. Her dreams are to own a dressmaking company and to finish her college studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr:
Léonie N. est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo en Province Cibitoke  à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de manioc sec au Marché de Rugombo.Elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer cette activité commerciale. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est  divorcée il ya de cela 8 ans. Elle est maintenant  au 3e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 8enfants ; 2 garçons et 6 filles âgés de 25ans, 23 ans, 19 ans, 17 ans, 15 ans, 13 ans, 10 ans et de 8ans. Quatre de ses enfants étudient. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour augmenter  la quantité de manioc sec qu’elle achète pour revendre aux clients. Elle affirme qu’elle fait face au ralentissement de son activité pendant la saison pluvieuse parce que son activité consiste à sécher le manioc pour l’écouler au marché. Elle a l’espoir qu’avec le crédit de Turame, elle  sera a mesure de supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et mener sa vie heureusement.

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Maombi ».
texts.en:
Léonie N. is a 40 year old business woman who lives in Rugombo commune, in the province of Cibitoke which is in the west of Burundi. She sells dried manioc in Rugombo's market. She was a farmer before she started this business. She has never been to school. She has been divorced for the past eight years. This is her third loan with Turame. She is the mother of eight children: two boys and six girls, aged 25, 23, 19, 17, 15, 13, 10 and 8. Four of her children are in school. She is asking for a Kiva loan to increase the amount of dried manioc she can buy to sell to her clients. She has a hard time drying enough manioc during the rainy season. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to pay her children's tuition fees and lead a happier life. She is a member of the Maombi community group.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried manioc to sell at market

loans.name: Malap I Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Malap I” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are women with small businesses who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,400,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Adama K. (who is pictured on the left, receiving the loan). Adama was born in a village call Makamabo, very close to Makeni. She is approximately 39 years old, married to a businessman, and the couple has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school.

Adama owns a small shop where she sells mints, sugar, biscuits, plastic bags, salt, etc. With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand the size and quality of her business. She will use the loan to buy more of the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more mints, sugar, biscuits, plastic bags, salt, etc., for her shop

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia M. is from the village of Pangalalan. She is 29 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Emelia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Emelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila nació en el distrito D. Zurite y tiene 60 años. Actualmente, Petronila vive en la ciudad D. Cusco junto con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. La ciudad D. Zurite se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.   

Petronila se dedica a la venta D. zapatos en el centro comercial “El Paraiso”, ella tiene un puesto D. venta en el mismo centro comercial, donD. la pueden encontrar los 7 días D. la semana, desD. las 9 D. mañana hasta las 8 D. la noche. Catalina nos cuenta que hace 6 años vendía D. forma ambulatoria pero ahora tiene un stand en el centro comercial.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Petronila que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar zapatos. 

El banco comunal “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio D. funcionamiento, Petronila pertenece desD. hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios D. este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor D. la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Petronila was born in the Zurite district, and she is 60 years old. Petronila lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and their five children. Zurite is thirty minutes from the city of Cusco. Petronila sells shoes in the “El Paraiso” (The Paradise) commercial center. She has a stand in the commercial center. She can be found there seven days a week from nine in the morning until eight at night. Petronila tells us that six years ago she sold in an itinerant manner. Now she has a stand in the commercial center. With her next loan Petronila hopes to receive 1000 soles. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy shoes. The “Señor D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo” Communal Bank has been operating for three and a half years. Petronila has belonged to the communal bank for three years. It is going very well for her. The members are devotees of Taytacho Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Brilliant Snow), and for this reason they gave the bank that name.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 6 children, two of whom are in school.   She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Catherine has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years and works 7 days a week. Catherine sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.    
 
The main business challenges for Catherine include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow and to start dealing directly with farmers. She lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Ruhandagazi Bakyara Twimukye, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
N. Annet, 42, is married with a family of four children and has been operating a retail shop at Ruhandagazi trading centre, Bushenyi for over four years. Here she sells a variety of products like sugar, salt, soft drinks, cooking oil and much more general merchandise. She does this business alongside her other farming practices that include growing a variety of food crops like bananas commonly grown in the area. Her main drawback is that she has a limited variety of products in her shop and cannot satisfy her customer's demands. Therefore she is looking forward to increasing her stock when she gets this loan. She will be fully stocked. This will help her earn more revenue to sustain her daily life needs and further educate her children. 
She belongs to the Ruhandagazi Bakyara Twimukye group whose members insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock like sugar, salt, soft drinks, cooking oil and much more general merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, pepper, salt, seasoning etc

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng K. is a 46-year-old woman married to a local farmer. The couple has seven children; two of them are employed in different jobs and have formal salaries. They live in Phnom Penh City.

Sreng owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. Sreng and her husband work together in the fields.

Currently, Sreng said her kids always have to travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Sreng has requested a loan of $400 to be used to buy a used motorcycle for her kids so they won’t have to spend taxi fare.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for her children to travel to work

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
Ayush L. is 46 years old and lives with his wife in Arhangai province of Mongolia. The family all lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Ayush operates a mobile dairy trading business, selling dairy products his wife prepares to local markets. He started this business in 1996, with working capital of 50,000 MNT, which has since reached 1,900,000 MNT. In the years of running his business, Ayush has gained a reputation among his customers of being a reliable supplier of quality dairy products. He has used his earnings to provide for his son's needs. With help of his earnings, his son completed his university and started to live on his own. 

For the future, Ayush says, "I want to purchase a good quality of dairy products from herders and sell those products to local individuals." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy supplies in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy supplies to increase his sales

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano is 59 years old. He lives along with his wife and one dependent child in the city of Chiclayo in northern Peru. It is one of the larger cities in Peru with a large commercial district and many famous markets. The family maintains a happy and stable home.

For several years now, Adriano has driven a taxi cab in the region. He transports passengers to and from work, shopping trips or social gatherings as needed. It is a well-received and competitive service in the city due to the relatively few personal vehicles that families own. Most of the population relies on private transit operators such as Adriano.

Currently Adriano finds himself in need of a loan in order to make repairs to his vehicle and complete standard maintenance. He hopes the investment will reduce his ongoing expenses and protect his vehicle so that it can continue to earn him money. He is a happy and outgoing individual who works hard to better the life of his family. He hopes to see his child become a professional one day.

loans.use: to make repairs to his vehicle and complete standard maintenance

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 30-year-old member of Kuendelea Self Help group.  Being a member of the group, he is able to save his money and access loans from Faulu Kenya easily.  Through the support of Faulu Kenya, Daniel has managed to improve his shop where he sells household items and electrical goods.  He hopes to become financially stable in the future.  He has requested 10,000 kes to buy utensils.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Flor Idalia

texts.es: Flor Idalia F. G. de 35 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como empleado de una empresa, así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad. Flor se dedica a lavar ropa a mano, planchar y hacer la limpieza para otras personas, este es un trabajo muy duro ya que debe ir de casa en casa haciendo su trabajo. Flor posee el enorme deseo de contar con una vivienda propia en la cual pueda tener una vida estable junto a su familia, por esto solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar un lote, en el que construya su vivienda y así mismo pueda sembrar maíz para comercializar, lo cual sería de gran beneficio para su familia, ya que le podría brindar un hogar seguro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor Idalia F. G. is 35 years old.  She lives in San Juan Opico, in La Libertad department.  She lives with her husband who works as an employee in a company.  She also lives with her two dependent children.

Flor works washing clothes by hand, ironing and cleaning for other people.  This is very hard work since she must go from house to house doing her work.  Flor has an enormous desire to have her own home in which she can lead a stable life together with her family.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Integral which will enable her to buy a plot of land on which she will build her home and also be able to grow corn to sell.  This would be of great benefit to her family since it would provide her children with a secure home.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land on which to build a house

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanny; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros y llantas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas y repuestos para carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Fanny is 27 years old, single and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling vehicle spare parts and tires.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this business, Fanny manages to get her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her business.

Fanny is requesting this loan to buy tires and vehicle spare parts.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy tires and vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Mpabuka

texts.en: Mpabuka is 28 years old, and married, his wife is currently studying. They have two children who are between two and five years old. All the children attend school. Mpabuka sells used shoes; he has been in this business of shoes for ten years. He praises his business that has done a lot like paying school fees for his children and rental payments. He decided to request this loan to buy more shoes to sell. He would like to make savings from the anticipated profits of his business. He wishes to prosper in his business career in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Manos Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
América, tiene 54 años D. edad, viuda, tiene 5 hijos, vive en la zona D. Puquio, distrito D. Comas. Hace 8 meses forma parte del grupo “Manos Forjadoras”, formado por 10 integrantes. 
Se dedica a la venta D. comida, DesD. muy joven ha sido muy trabajadora.
Inicio su negocio por sí sola, con pequeñas ventas que hacía en su casa, y así con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado tener su propio restaurant, y pagar los estudios D. sus hijos. 
Su anhelo es ser una empresaria  exitosa, que su negocio sea reconocido y sus hijos sean profesionales D. éxito. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir en su negocio en la compra D. insumos y  menaje.
texts.en:
América, 54, is a widow with five children.  She lives in the Puquio zone, Comas district.  She has been a member of the “Manos Forjadoras” (Forging Hands) group, which has 10 members, for 8 months.

She sells food.  She has been very hard working since a very young age.  She started the business on her own with small sales from home.  Thus, with much effort and sacrifice she has managed to have her own restaurant and pay for her children’s education.

Her wish is to be a successful businesswoman, that the business is well known and that her children become successful professionals.

She will use the requested loan to invest in the business buying ingredients and kitchenware.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and kitchenware.

loans.name: Arminda Araminta

texts.es:
Arminda de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora que vende ropa y con esfuerzo para tener ingresos adicionales en la actualidad tiene locales de ropa.
 
Tiene muchas proyecciones para el futuro por eso quiere seguir trabajando para su estilo de vida y la de su familia con ayuda de su esposo. Vende ropa, pantalones, camisas para hombres y mujeres. Las ventas de la mercadería las realiza en la mañana y en el resto del día atiende a su familia y a los locales que tiene por alquiler. 

Para seguir generando dinero para su familia ella quiere comprar con el prestamo ropa. En el futuro tiene pensado tener mas locales de alquiler para tener mas capital para su mercadería.
texts.en:
Arminda is 40 years old and a hard-working woman who sells clothing.  With effort and to have additional income, she currently has clothing stores.

She has many goals for the future so she wants to continue working to maintain her family's lifestyle with help from her husband.  She sells clothing, pants, and shirts for men and women.  She sells merchandise in the morning and spends the rest of the day caring for her family and the stores she has rented.

To continue earning money for her family, she would like to use this loan to purchase clothing.  In the future, she would like to have more stores to have more capital for her business.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is a 49-year-old man who lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He supports his family by running a carpentry business with help from his son. His daughter is a student while his wife works as a teacher at the local public school. His family lives in a small house in the outer ger (nomadic tent) districts of the city. 

When Batjargal first began his carpentry business in 1995, he used to rent a workplace to make furniture with 300,000 MNT of working capital. His business has grown since and today he has 6,000,000 MNT of working capital. He makes furniture at his own workplace, which is next to his small house, and he sells them at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. For the last 16 years, Batjargal has been supporting his family as well as improving their living conditions with his business profits. For the last two years, he built a workplace plus a small house for his son and managed to buy a car for himself. With this loan of 2,000,000 MNT he will purchase more wooden panels to produce more furnishings.

loans.use: To purchase more wooden panels to produce more furnishings

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six members who have selected Mrs. Ly to be the group leader. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Ly is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice.  She sells part of the rice yield and uses the rest of the rice to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Sou, is a construction worker. They work hard, but they earn little income. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Ly is applying for a loan to add to her savings so that she can buy a cow to breeding and to start a new business. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, but the others are students.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María del Rosario T. C. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 2 años para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. El negocio solo lo ponen los fines de semana ya que son días buenos donde hay mayores ventas. La señora en este momento se ve en la necesidad de comprar ropa de temporada por que en esta ciudad las temperaturas en verano son muy altas por lo que la gente busca ropa ligera para no tener calor. Es por ello que María del Rosario quiere invertir en su negocio para que sea prosperado.
texts.en: María del Rosario T. C. has been selling used clothing for two years to help her husband with household expenses. She only runs her business on the weekends because those are the days with the best sales. She now wants to purchase more seasonal merchandise since in her city the summer temperatures are very hot, and so people seek out lighter clothing. This is why she wants to invest in her business to make it more prosperous.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a single-room brick house with her family for past 12 years. She is 36 years old, married to S. M. and has four children. 

Razia couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son works in a motor workshop while the second one is a tailor master. Her remaining two children stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is professionally a painter and paints on walls and houses. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes of different colors and paint brushes that will help him do his work better and earn better profits.  

Razia is hopeful that the investment will be productive for her husband and make him more profitable in the future. He has been operating his business for the past six years.

loans.use: to buy paint boxes and brushes for painting business

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon S. is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in Battambang province. Currently, Phon S. lives with three school-aged children and earns a living by growing various crops on their own farmland. 

Her husband works as a vehicle repairman in his community, making a profit of around $3 each day. He also frequently works alongside her on the farm. 

Phon S. is asking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to purchase some sacks of fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.use: to purchase some sacks of fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Las Domesticas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Domestica lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras originarias de Managua. Una de ellas Julia A. de 43 años quien se dedica a la realización artesanal de cepillos de lavar ropa lo cual aprendió de su padre.
Ella desde hace 15 años se dedica a este negocio con el cual saco adelante a sus 4 hijos de 25, 23, 21 y 16 años. Con el crédito comprara materiales como madera, nailon, grapas… etc.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Margarita L. A. se dedica a la realización de cepillos desde hace 10 años y Dolores Ramírez comercializa productos Avon desde hace 5 años. Vacaciones sábado
texts.en:
The 'Las Domestica' group is made up of three hard-working, driven and entrepreneurial women who are from Managua.  One of them, 43 year-old Julia A., hand makes brushes for washing clothes.  She learned this skill from her father.

Julia has been in this business for 15 years and, through it, she has managed to get her four children aged 25, 23, 21 and 16 ahead in life.  She will use the loan to buy materials such as wood, nylon, staples, etc.

The other members of this group are Margarita L. A., who has been making brushes for 10 years, and Dolores Ramírez who has been selling Avon products for five years.  Vacation, Saturday.

loans.use: to buy nylon, wood, staples, etc.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has operated a shoe design and sales business for the past three years. He also makes bags and wallets. He sells his products from his small storefront to neighbors and passers-by. Isaac dreams of building his own business premises in the future. The business's primary challenge is seasonailty.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan he has requested, he wants to establish a retail general store and to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour to sell from his new establishment. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. 

Isaac is unmarried and lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is his rent.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for a new retail store business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 43 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Se desarrolla la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 3 años Rosa  se dedica  a la comercialización de leña para el uso diario de los diferentes pobladores de la zona, ya que no cuentan con cocina a gas, al ver que su negocio se ha incrementado, a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para adquirir más leña y poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes,con los ingresos que recaude podrá cubrir su crédito como seguir ayudando a solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Rosa es una mujer con muchas ganas de sacar a delante a su familia gracias a todo el esfuerzo y dedicación que tiene en su trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, and her husband and children live in a house they own in the Peruvian "departamento" of Lambayeque.   The house only has one electrical outlet.  Most people in the area scrape by on the incomes from their farming and livestock businesses.

Rosa started a business 3 years ago selling firewood.  Cooking gas is not widely used in this part of Peru, so there's a lot of demand for firewood, a fact that's contribued to Rosa's success.  She's now applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that she will use to buy firewood and meet the demand for it from her customers.  The income from the business will allow her to support her family.

Rosa is an ambitious woman and she's working hard to make sure her family gets ahead in the world.

loans.use: Compra de mayor cantidad de leña para la venta

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor  Luis,  ingreso a la institución en el año 2004 con el grupo solidario "tokio"  del cual el Sr. Luis  ha seguido continuando  con el crédito individual trabajando  por  nueve secuencias, actualmente ingresa al programa Kiva. El es transportista de taxi que trabaja  independientemente con niños  de un  colegio, por contrato llevándolos y recogiéndolos de la escuela,  quienes exigen el buen estado de la movilidad por tal motivo necesita  el crédito para comprar llantas y  reparación de su vehículo, el  señor  es bastante dedicado  a su hogar  y a sus hijos que están en la edad escolar quien los solventa económicamente, es una persona responsable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Luis joined this organization in 2004 with the group Tokio. Luis has continued with individual loans, working through nine loan cycles. He is now joining the Kiva program. He is a taxi driver who works independently with school children. He is hired on contract to take them to school and pick them up. They demand his car be in good shape, and this is why he needs a loan to purchase tires and to repair his vehicle. He is dedicated to his home and his children, who are school age and whom he supports financially. He is a responsible and hardworking person. He is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.

loans.use: to purchase tires and brake pads for his vehicle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a seamstress in Abura and has received a junior high education. She is married and her husband is a teacher.

Gloria has been sewing for 3 years. She assists her husband in paying utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy materials, lining and other things so she can attract customers into her shop who will bring their dresses for sewing.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy materials, lining and other things so she can attract customers into her shop who will bring their dresses for sewing

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar la chicha como maíz, jora y azúcar.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "MAMA SIMONA" which is in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Juana, 40, lives with her common-law husband and three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling chicha, which is a corn-based drink.  She works from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  With her income she has been able to provide for her children.  She would like to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy chicha ingredients such as corn, jora and sugar.

She is content with the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chicha (corn drink), such as corn, jora and sugar.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: It is the big responsibility of parents to be head of the family. .Mrs. Orn never takes time to visit anywhere. She always cares about the living standards of her family. Nowadays she is a grocery seller in one market near her village. She earns about $4 per day. Her husband doesn’t laze at home. He takes time to work selling junk goods around their village and other villages. He earns perhaps $3 per day also. Both of them would like a loan of $700 in order to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi, a 43-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop selling canned goods, beverages and snacks for seven years.  A member of HSPFI since 2009, she has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more snacks, detergents and beverages to sell. In the future, Noemi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, detergents & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, tiene un hijo, su negocio es una bodega y tambien tiene un restaurante, el préstamo que solicita lo utilizará en su negocio.
Marleny es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 2 años, agradece mucho por todo lo que le ha enseñado, tambien aprendió mucho ahorrar, ahora esta mal de salud y ha retirado dinero de sus ahorros para su tratamiento, se pone a pensar que si no hubiera ahorrado no tendría como curarse y no podría trabajar.
en las reuniones de su Banco Comunal aprendió que nunca debe agarrar el dinero que es destinado para su negocio, las capacitaciones le ayudan a mejorar su negocio, y todo lo que puede aprende lo aplica en su vida personal como en su negocio.
texts.en:
Marleny is a member of the “Llapanchik” communal bank.  She has a son.  Her business is a general store and she also has a restaurant.  She’ll use the loan she’s requesting in her business.

Marleny has been a member of FINCA Perú for the last two years.  She is very grateful for all it has taught her; she also learned how to save.  She’s currently unwell so has withdrawn her savings for her medical care and she’s thought that if she hadn’t saved she wouldn’t be able to get better and wouldn’t be able to work.

At the communal bank meetings she learned that she must never take the money earmarked for her business.  The training has helped her to improve her business and everything she’s able to learn she applies both to her personal life and to her business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ami Kafui

texts.fr:
Ami Kafui est une femme âgée de 30ans. Elle est célibataire.
Ami Kafui travaille comme revendeuse de portables et ses accessoires depuis 2009. Elle a une boutique et 01 personne l’aide dans l’exercice de ses activités.
Ami Kafui a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter de marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ami Kafui voudrait prospérer dans l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit l’épanouissement de sa future famille.
texts.en:
Ami Kafui is a 30-year-old woman. She is single.
Ami Kafui has been working as a retailer of cell phones and accessories since 2009. She has a store with one person helping her with the business.
Ami Kafui requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase merchandise. She wants to reinvest in the business.
In the coming years, Ami Kafui would like to see her business prosper. She says that with the profit, she foresees that her future family will thrive.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and cell phones accessories.

loans.name: Suvann

texts.en: Suvann, 24 years old, gives massages and earns $7 per day. She has one child who is three years old. She lives with one sister who works for a company and earns $3.50 per day.
