Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity and $30 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to use to travel to work. Before, she went to work by bicycle with her sister, but it was hard for them and that’s why they decided to borrow some money to buy a motorbike. She plans to sell fish in the market instead of working because she can find a good market for selling fish, but she doesn’t have enough money yet to start that business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 54, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a technician, and is the mother of their two children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine Pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and products for her business.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 56-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Johnson has been farming for twenty years. His hardship is weather variations. His goals are to improve his methods of farming and to educate his children. Johnson needs this loan to buy coffee and hybrid cows

loans.use: to buy coffee and hybrid cows

loans.name: Kaed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married, and the father of one child. He lives with two family members.

Kaed has been an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are many customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $1800 in order to purchase two refrigerators and to make shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits so that he may provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: To purchase two refrigerators and to make shelves.

loans.name: Kusiima Women Group

texts.en:
Noeline is a hardworking lady and the leader of Kusiima Women Group found in Karuguuza, Uganda. She is married with two children and she has one other dependent at the moment. She lives in a rented house in a family of five people. 

Noeline has been in the fish sales business for three years. She started as a vender but now she has a big stock and her business is booming. However, she faces the challenge of bad debtors and hopes, in future, her business will grow big. Noeline needs a loan to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 53 years old and lives in San Antonio, Siquijor. She is married with two children. Norma has a general store to earn a living. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more inventory for her general store. Norma has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more one year. In the future, Norma would like to expand her business and able to support the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 53 year old married woman residing in Sta. Cruz, Jiminez, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Josephine owns and operates a, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been 15 years in this business. Each month, she earns  Php10,000 doing this type of business. 

Josephine has requested a loan of 20,000.00 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Josephine has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements on her house and to purchase a transport vehicle for use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Petrona Maritza

texts.es:
Doña Petrona sigue, laborando en servicios domesticos, siendo su medio de apoyar a su familia, que junto a su esposo logran cada dia,  una vivienda digna, el trabaja de electricista, de sus cinco hijos, cuatro cursan la secundaria y el mayor, comenzara la universidad.
Petrona logro con su credito anterior pegar ceramica en la cocina, quedando muy bonita, ahora comprara ceramica para pegar en la sala, y asi ir abanzando  por parte, hasta terminar, dando una mejor vision, mejor comodidad de limpieza, haciendose posible, gracias a los financiamiento, por ser a plazos accesibles, estando la situacion economica costosa cada dia.
texts.en: Petrona keeps working in domestic services as a way to support her family. She and her husband, an electrician, work every day for a dignified home for their five children, four of whom are in school and the eldest attends a university. Petrona used her previous loan to put down ceramic tile in her kitchen, making it very pretty, and now she plans to buy tile to put down in her living room. She will keep going until the whole house is finished, making it better looking, more comfortable and cleaner. All this is possible thanks to the loans, in installments, with the daily expensive economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase ceramic tile to put down in her living room, making her house cleaner and more hygienic.

loans.name: Kory Pankaritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY PANKARITA” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de fruta, elaboración de cajas de madera, venta de mantas, producción de calzados, costura de ropa deportiva, transporte, comercio de aretes, comercio de decoraciones. 

La señora Justina indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años iniciando el mismo con los prestamos que sacó de la institución.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de mercadería (compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The “KORY PANKARITA” communal bank will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors in which Justina is the president. The association members have various businesses. Among them are: selling fruit, making wooden boxes, selling blankets, making shoes, sewing sports clothing, transportation, selling earrings, selling decorations.  

Justina indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining at the invitation of a friend. At present she has a business selling food. She has done this for years, starting with the loans she took out from the institution.  

The loan she will take out now is to increase her merchandise (to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.). She will get all of this at the market and after preparation, she will sell it at her sales stall. This work allows her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible, as she is single and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan, 46 years of age, is very active and operates a decorative embroidery business from her home. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and fills the orders on time to earn an income. Rasoolan has 4 sons; the eldest is a laborer and the others are studying.

Rasoolan's husband has a business selling animals. He purchases sheep and goats at a young age, raises them and sells them to butchers once they become healthy and older. Rasoolan has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy sheep and goats in larger numbers for reselling at a profit. He has been operating his business for many years and Rasoolan is confident of his business success after investing this loan.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep

loans.name: María De La Cruz

texts.es: María de La Cruz de 51 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora quien hace algunos años enviudó por lo que tuvo que dar lo mejor de sí en su negocio para salir adelante por ella misma, actualmente vive junto a su madre quien le ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar. María trabaja vendiendo bebidas como: agua, sodas, jugos de frutas y otros más, ella los comercializa de forma ambulante visitando canchas, parques, plazas y muelles, a pesar que su jornada de trabajo es bastante dura vale la pena ya que le permite contar con todo lo necesario. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas, en diferentes marcas, presentaciones, sabores y precios de manera que pueda abarcar la mayor cantidad de gustos de las personas y así  mejorar sus ganancias notablemente.

loans.use: Compra de agua, refrescos y sodas para comercizar

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: This is 40 year old Issa. He is married and has 3 children ages 8, 12, and 14 years old. In 2000, Issa established a business selling used bags, shoes, and other items. He began his business because he wants to improve his standard of living. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, Issa earns about 1,200,000 LE every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 LE. In the future, Issa plans to improve the lives of his family. Competition and rainy season are his greatest business challenges. He is looking forward for funding as he requires more capital. He appreciates the lenders for their good gesture.

loans.use: to improve my business

loans.name: Havinitishi

texts.en: Havintishi is 30 years old. She is married and a mother of four children. She lives in Kilosa district with her husband. Havinitishi is a young businesswoman with a milling machine. The machine helps her and her family to get profit which is used to pay for household expanses. Havinitishi requests a Kiva loan to buy new and improve some parts of her machine. Profit obtained from the loan which will help her children go to school and to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy new and improve some parts of her milling machine

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose lives in a home with mud walls, dirt floor and an iron roof in Kopudo village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya with her family which includes 7 children. The community of Kopudo village collects their drinking water from Kamigori borehole because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Kopudo’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Kopudo, 30 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Rose has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 3 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: namely Bernard, Rose and Margret.

Kopudo village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Rose believes that the dispenser system will  help them to treat their water leading to eradication of  water borne diseases. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Rose’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow her community to treat water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Florence, a 55-year-old farmer from the remote village of Ngudune, situated in the Nkubu area of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is no clean water nor electrical connections. Florence lives with her lovely family on a small piece of land where she keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows a wide variety of crops.

For seven years, Florence's primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and produce. Her biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Florence made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

Florence recently applied for a loan for expanding her farm in order to expand her operations and increase her overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to Florence's children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is becoming prohibitive. With your loan, Florence’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her farm.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelina G. has been selling corn for 5 years. She prepares them very deliciously by first putting on butter or mayonnaise, then cheese, then lemon and hot sauce. Mmm, really flavorful.

Mrs. Evangelina sells them in her car and visits certain streets of the city, she has some sound equipment in her car that lets her announce the flavorful corn sale. Mrs. Evangelina G. would like to also open a fixed corn stall close to her house. With these two places of sale, one mobile in her car, and the other one fixed, it should increase her sales. She will acquire the fixed stall through a loan of $800 and she is determined to pay it back in a term of 1 year. With this loan she could increase her sales and generate a good income for her family. Besides, she is able to sell her delicious corn in another part of the city, well know in Nuevo Laredo, mmm.

ESPANOL

La Sra, Evangelina vende elotes desde hace 5 años, los prepara deliciosos, les agraga mantequilla o mayonesa y luego espolvorea queso ademas puede agregarles limon o chile, mmm realmente sabrosos. La Sra.Evangelina los vende en su auto y visita ciertas calles de la ciudad, ella va anunciandose atraves de un equipo de sonido que instala en su auto. La Sra. Evangelina pretende instalar un puesto fijo de venta de elotes cerca de su casa para incrementar sus ventas, con esto tendria ya dos puntos de venta uno movil en su auto y el otro fijo, este lo pretende adquirir atraves de un prestamo de $800.00 y para el cual tiene contemplado pagarlo en un plazo de 1 año, con dicho prestamo ella podria aumentar sus ventas y generar bienestar familiar, ademas de poder vender en otra parte de la ciudad sus ricos y deliciosos elotes, ya conocidos en Nuevo Laredo mmm.

loans.use: install a fixed sales point

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Winnie would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business of selling groceries.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Mr. Patrick E. has a chemist shop where he sells drugs for the treatment of patients. He hopes to get $450 to expand his business by buying more inventory.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Dehi

texts.en:
Mrs Dehi M. lives with her family in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. She is 46 years old and is married. M. is mother of 4 children. Now that her husband is retired from “Air Afrique” Airlines Company, she is the one who works all day long to support her children. Every New Year she makes sure they have clothes, food, shoes and their education paid, also. She struggles everyday to bring back those simple times of yesterday. Her husband income is not enough to cover all their little family charges, because of some nephews he has in charge indeed.
It’s the 2nd time, she is given opportunity to request AE&I a loan. She will use  his loan to purchase goods and pay school expenses.

loans.use: Dehi Martine will use the loan to pay education expenses and purchase goods

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
I am Nargis B.. I was born and brought up in Lahore (second largest city in Pakistan). I am married and I have five children, all of whom study. My husband buys second-hand (used) motorbike silencers from the local wholesale markets and supplies them to nearby auto shops. He earns $0.07 profit for every silencer.

If he is able to buy silencers in bulk this will reduce his purchasing cost, since buying in bulk is relatively cheaper, and we will get higher returns. Please lend us US$ 300 to buy a large quantity of silencers.

loans.use: Buy motorbike silencers in bulk

loans.name: Douk

texts.en: Mrs. Douk L., 37, is a widow who lives with her four children in Bathambong province, Cambodia. To supplement her family’s income, Douk L. works with her mother (pictured) selling a variety of grocery products, earning on average $16/day. One of her children is a student and the other three are unemployed. Mrs. Douk L. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more products to fill her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To expand inventory in her grocery store

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is single: she has one adult daughter with which she works. Delia started her small business with capital she obtained from selling a property in 2004: later with the help of her daughter the business progressed.

Delia has a rental house with tables, chairs, tablecloths and other equipment for receptions and fiestas. She also makes meals and snacks on request. She tells us that the business is quite profitable and generates a good income.

She wants to continue her business’ expansion, and give her daughter the opportunity of completing her university studies. Delia is asking for credit in order to roof one part of the room: this will create better and more comfortable space.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Delia es soltera, tiene 1 hija mayor con quien ella trabaja. Delia inicio su pequeño negocio con un capital que obtuvo de la venta de una propiedad en el año 2004, luego con la ayuda de su hija fue progresando el negocio.

Delia posee una casa de alquiler de mesas, sillas, manteles, entre otros insumos para recepciones y fiestas. También realizan comidas y bocaditos bajo pedidos. Ella nos cuenta que el negocio es bastante rentable y genera ganancias.

Ella desea progresar cada vez más, y darle la oportunidad a su hija de culminar sus estudios universitarios. Delia solicita el crédito para techar una parte del salón, de este modo tendrá mayor espacio físico y comodidades.

loans.use: Roof one part of the business

loans.name: Kabawo Ii(A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Justine has a restaurant business. With the extra business profits she earns , she intends to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in the bsuiness.

Jane has a retail shop and wants to use the loan to increase her stock.

Christine has a beauty salon while Irene offers tailoring services.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Faviana

texts.es:
Señora Faviana H. T. Huerta belongs to the interim group "Las Rosas de Yungay" (The Roses of Yungay). Her business is located in the city of Yungay in the province of Yungay in the department of Ancash.

With her previous credit of 300 nuevos soles, she has increased her merchandise and her income.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of more fruits like oranges, apples, and bananas.

She is 31-years-old and lives with her two children. With the income that she has, she supports her children. She is very enthusiastic about belonging to an interim group of Manuela Ramos, and she will continue working to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Faviana H. T. Huerta pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, su negocio esta ubicado en la localidad de Yungay, provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, ha incrementado su mercadería y sus ingresos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de mas frutas como: naranjas, manzanas, plátanos

Ella tiene 31 años, es conviviente con 2 hijos, con los ingresos que tiene apoya a sus hijos, ella esta muy entusiasmada de pertenecer a un grupo mientras tanto de Manuela Ramos y continuara trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio. .

loans.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of fruits so she can sell them

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
My name is Zareena S. Ali. I have been married for 15 years and have six children: four girls and two boys. My girls are learning sewing from a stitching centre and my boys attend a local school. My husband works at a restaurant for a meager income, whereas I am a seamstress. I create beautiful ready-made dresses, which my husband sells in various markets.

I would like to borrow with a group of four other women: Sughran S., who runs a grocery store; Sumereena, who will purchase a sewing machine with her share of the loan; Bushra P., who is also borrowing for her grocery store, and Saima, who sews clothes. These women dream of building a house, buying land, improving their business, and ensuring a good education for their children.

loans.use: To buy cloth for the business

loans.name: Ushindi Youth Group

texts.en:
Esther W. is an average Kenyan woman. She is 38 years old and married with two children. She also lives with the two orphaned children of her late sister.

Esther started her second-hand clothing business four years ago after retiring from her teaching profession, which she had been in for over ten years. She now sells ladies' and children’s wear. She purchases bails of clothing each week from Kisii market, which is well-known for its wholesale clothes business. With the little profit that she gets from her business, Esther is still able to clothe, feed, and educate her children and relatives with the help of her husband, who works as a technician in the town of Kisii.

With the help of this loan, Esther would like to diversify her business by bringing in more men’s wear to increase her monthly sales. Her long-term vision is to expand her business into a boutique.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bails of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Frida M.. She is married and has three children, ages 24, 27, and 31, plus two additional dependents.

In 2005, Frida established her small retail business. Frida needs a loan to buy candy, water, and phone credit vouchers for her small kiosk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy water, candy, and phone credit vouchers in bulk.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a 72 year old widow with four children. Though old and quite weak, Adwoa refuses to give in to her ailments and continues to be a resourceful mother. She has supported three children to finish vocational school.

Adwoa is a retailer of charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Adwoa obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi and retails them to her customers.

Adwoa wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to retail to her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her last child in school.

Adwoa belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is not asleep) Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

Adwoa is seen standing in the photograph wearing a black top. This photograph was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal.

loans.name: Reinalda

texts.es:
Reinalda C. is a modest, hardworking woman who lives in one of the most humble neighborhoods in the city of Asunción. She has worked hard since she was little to earn a living. She has been a widow for about a year now, and she tells us that during this time she has had some very difficult moments – both emotionally and financially.

She struggles as always to get ahead, and lives in an unassuming house together with her grandchildren who stayed with her to keep her company. Reinalda supports her household by selling food. She cooks starting at dawn, and leaves in the mornings and afternoons to travel the city selling her wares from her cart. At midday, she serves lunches from her house to the workers in the area who place their orders with her.

She uses the loan as a means to supply her business with the necessary ingredients to cook her meals. Today, she seeks a new loan to purchase meat, noodles, flour, oil, condiments, eggs, fruits and vegetables, all of which are key ingredients she needs to make her delicious food.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Reinalda C., persona humilde, trabajadora, vive en uno de los barrios más humildes de la Cuidad de Asunción. Desde pequeña trabajo duro para ganarse la vida. Ella es viuda, hace aproximadamente 1 año, y cuenta que desde entonces a pasado por momentos muy difíciles tanto emocionales como económicos.

Ella lucha igual que siempre para salir adelante, ella vive en una humilde casa junto con sus nietos que se quedaron con ella para hacerle compañía en la casa y no sentirse tan sola. Reinalda mantiene su hogar con la venta de comidas. Cocina desde tempranas horas de la madrugada y sale por las mañanas y las tardes a recorrer la ciudad vendiendo comidas típicas en su canasto. Al medio día sirve almuerzos en su casa a los trabajadores de la zona, que hacen sus pedidos de comida.

Ella utiliza el crédito como un medio de ayuda para abastecerse de los ingredientes necesarios para preparar sus comidas. Hoy ella solicita un crédito nuevo para comprar carne, fideo, harina, aceite, condimentos, huevos, vegetales y frutas que son necesarios para elaborar sus ricas comidas.

loans.use: For the purchase of meat, noodles, flour, oil, condiments, eggs, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Chuquisaca Group

texts.es:
The majority of the women are traders, some for clothes, others for vegetables, etc. The president is Ms. Ivona, who is unmarried and has three children aged 2, 3 and 19 years. She is dedicated to selling clothes and has had three years of experience in this business. The loan from Agrocapital is to increase business capital. Carla has a neighbourhood store, Nicole sells beauty products, Victoria sells food, Neneth has an ENTEL branch (telecommunications company), Magali is a teacher, Catalina is a seamstress, Jessica sells spare parts, Leydi sells potatoes, Tania sells fitness equipment, Carlos is a courier, Vanesa sells footwear, Ana makes sweaters, Juana sells hamburgers.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La mayoría de las señoras son comerciantes, unas de ropa otras de verdura, etc. La presidenta es la señora Ivone que es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 2, 3 y 19 años respectivamente; se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene experiencia en este negocio tres años. El préstamo que saca de Agrocapital es para aumentar su capital de negocio. Carla tiene una tienda de barrio, Nicole vende productos de belleza, Victoria vende comida, Nineth tiene un punto de ENTEL auxiliar, Magali es profesora, Catalina es costurera, Jessica vende repuestos, Leydi vende papas, Tania vende equipos de gimnasio, Carlos trabaja en un courrier, Vanesa vende calzados, Ana confecciona chompas Juana vende hamburguesas.

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. operates a grocery store in her neighborhood. She started her operation three years ago at Dunkwa-Obuasi, where she lives with her children and husband. She is a 38 year old mother with two children, who are currently in school. She trades in products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, and evaporated milk.

With this loan, she wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice and canned foods, and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock and variety, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She would appreciate that assistance very much.

She is a member of the group called neighbors Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase and diversify the inventory of her grocery store.

loans.name: Anu

texts.en:
Mrs. Anu S., 28-years-old, is a tailor in the town of Tikhidewal in Lalitpur. She opened her tailoring shop two years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi and others.

Before starting her own business, Mrs. S. took a six month training course in tailoring when she was younger. Now, Mrs. S. is requesting a Rs 10000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her work. Mrs. S. lives in a single family with her husband and son. Her husband's name is Mr. Sanjay S. and he works in his own workshop. She has one son, who is studying in primary school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Sokhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun P. is the leader of a five member loan group from Choes Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Sokhoeun P. owns and cultivates rice on a small piece of land. On her plantation, she now faces the problem of infertile soil, therefore she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to help her crops. Her husband, Mr. Choy Saro, is a cow breeder. Mrs. Sokhoeun P. has two children who are all attending the local school. 

This group loan has end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario R. is 53 years old, married to Julio R., and lives in Maramag St. Centro Ilagan, Isabela. They are blessed with three children: Julie – 26 years old, a college graduate who works as a call center agent; Julio – 22 years old, a college graduate who works as a nurse; and Janica – 14 years old and in junior high school. 

Rosario says her Triple J canteen is situated in an urban area where there are many customers, especially during school days because many high school and college students come to her store. She is requesting a loan to purchase more and varied food items to sell in the canteen. This will increase her customers purchases and the number customers who come to her business.

“I dream to become a successful businesswoman someday so that I will be able to give my children a good future. That is why I really strive hard, “Rosario says. She hopes to open a grocery store next to her canteen.

loans.use: To expand the stock in her canteen

location.town: Maramag St. Centro Ilagan, Isabela, Isabela

loans.name: Martha Amalia

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 50 años de edad, habita en Villa Reconciliación del puente una cuadra al este en Managua  casada y con tres hijos dos estudian y uno de ellos es enfermo con discapacidad, para ella ha sido difícil poder trabajar y ganar un salario mensual,  ya que tiene que ver por su hijo el cual es bien imperativo. Lo que hizo fue poner una  pulpería que inicio con capital propio, desde hace cuatro años, ahora hace préstamos en Afodenic el cual le ha brindado la oportunidad para reforzar su negocio y poder ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Su esposo es comerciante y aporta  a los gastos del hogar,  con esta solicitud de crédito es la octava la cual le va a beneficiar para poder invertir en la pulpería en la compra de granos básicos, productos enlatados y insumos diarios, y así fortalecer su inventario. Sus objetivos a corto plazo es poder ayudar a sus hijos a que sigan preparándose con los estudios para que sean buenas personas en la sociedad
texts.en:
Martha is 50 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Reconciliación in Managua. She is married and has three children, of whom two are studying and one is disabled. She has found it difficult to work and make a monthly salary as she has to care for her son, which is very demanding. Her solution was to open a grocery store four years ago with her own savings. Now she borrows from Afodenic which has given her the opportunity to improve her business and offer her clients a greater variety of goods. Her husband is a merchant and he contributes to the household expenses. This is her eighth loan, which she will use to invest in her grocery store buying staples, canned goods and foodstuffs, thus increasing her inventory. Her short-term goal is to help her children that they may continue their studies and be good citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staples, canned goods, and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ngat

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngat K., 54, is a widow with five children -  two daughters and three sons. One of her children is married and lives separately from home. Another  daughter is a tailor, two sons have full-time employment and another son is a silk weaver. The family lives on an Island off MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Ngat has been a silk weaver and selling silk fabric since 1979. She learned her skills from her neighbor. She buys them from the villagers for resale to provinces far away from her house, such as Siem Reap and Pursat provinces. Ngat is requesting for a second loan of $500 to purchase silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis 3 ans à Avetonou. A cause de la vétusté du moteur de son appareil, il désire avec ce crédit acquérir une nouvelle moto afin de redonner un élan à son activité.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is 42 years old, married, and the father of two. He has been driving a moto taxi for three years in Avetonou. Because of the worn condition of the motor, he would like to use this loan to acquire a new moto in order to boost his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for taxi service

loans.name: Burlacu

texts.en:
Burlacu Z.’s business is family one. Together with her husband she is involved in raising pigs, sheep and cattle, as well as the manufacturing and marketing of meat and dairy products.

The loan requested will be directed toward buying 10 sheep and eight pigs. Zinaida already has 10 sheep and wants to increase their number up to 20 head. They have 3 hectares of agricultural land that is cultivated with lucerne (a crop in the legume family often used for fodder), barley and maize. During winter, feed is purchased, but in summer the animals graze the field.

In the future, Z.'s plan is to increase the number of heads and production output and to improve profit.

loans.use: Buying 10 sheep and eight pigs

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.en:
Kodirjon S. is a hardworking and determined man. As a child he was an excellent student, but upon finishing his studies he was unable to find any work due to the severe economic problems in his country. Instead, Kodirjon decided to invest his small savings to start his own business whereby he sells rice at the market. Over time he has expanded his business to the point that the business is now the sole source of income for his family, which consists of his wife and three children. He explains that there is high demand for his rice because of its excellent quality, size, and flavor. As a result, Kodirjon is applying for a loan in the amount of $800 in order to buy more goods for resale purposes. In turn, he expects to generate more income, which will enable him to improve his family's standard of living.

Information about Tajikistan: Tajikistan is well known for the following: (1) its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; (2) the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and (3) its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi, to name a few. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. On the other end of the spectrum, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and thus only 7% of the land is arable; accordingly, this confluence of factors has resulted in high levels of unemployment and has forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries (primarily Russia). Even though the people of Tajikistan are working hard to improve the country's agriculture and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional rice

loans.name: Isidro Eradio

texts.es:
El señor Isidro P. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario se dedica a laborar con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

La razón por la que el señor Esidro ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de la compara de sus productos para comercializarlos en su localidad y así continuar mejorando su condición en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Isidro P.'s business is to sell electrical appliances on a daily basis, with much effort, at the market "Central" of the town of Chinandega. It is his goal to improve his living conditions.

The reason why Mr. Isidra has approached Ceprodel is because he needs to buy products to be sold in his town and thus continue to improve the condition of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Ruharo Central 2 Nyamwiza Scovia Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Scovia is 24 years old and married with two kids. One kid is in school and one is still very young. She is a farmer and, in addition, she has been selling drinks at a bar for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase fertilizer for her banana plantation and bar items such as soda, water, beer, and wine. Her dream is to construct a residential house.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for her banana plantation and drinks to sell at her bar

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico T. of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 37 years old and single.He is very talented at printing shirts, streamers and other things. He has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2008 with a very good repayment performance. Now he is applying for a loan amounting to Php 25,000 to purchase additional equipment, tools and materials needed in the printing business.

Rico's dream is to have a family someday and a successful business.

loans.use: to additional equipment and tools for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita O. is 24 years old. She is married with one kid who is currently breastfeeding. She lives with her family in Sefwi Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. She is a very skillful and talented hair dresser. After three years of experience, she erected a wooden structure where she now provides service to her customers. Rita believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like hair weave, pomade, shampoo, activators, hair dryer machines, and the like to better serve her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of hair products like hair weave, pomade, shampoo, and activators.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel O. is 45 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He sells shoes of various colours. He is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Edirisa's Group

texts.en: Edirisa W. is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is 68 years old and married with ten children, ages 33 to 9 years old, five of whom are in school. Edirisa owns and manages two businesses; he has a butcher shop and he is a farmer in Kyabahuura. From his businesses, he is able to make monthly profits of 230,000/= due to his loyal customers. Edirisa is striving to expand his business and to have a happy family. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy a cow for his butcher shop as well as to buy some produce for resale since this was not a favorable season for his farm due to the too much sunshine.

loans.use: To buy cow and produce for his business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, two sons and six daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Elizabeth is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. She sells it with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. Elizabeth has been in business for over 25 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es casado con la Sra. Dora, tienen tres hijos de 8, 10 y 13 años respectivamente. Poseen un bien inmueble propio. Abel se dedica a prestar sus servicios  como maestro albañil/constructor. Por otra parte su esposa vende comida de manera ambulante, ambos cuentan con muchos años de experiencia en cada uno de sus rubros. La competencia es alta, pero la antigüedad, experiencia, calidad,  rapidez e higiene impuesta en cada uno de sus rubros, les ha permitido ser requeridos constantemente por los servicios que prestan. El destino del crédito es para mejorar la vivienda que poseen, efectuado algunas mejoras. El presente es el tercer préstamo  al que accede Abel, con excelente comportamiento y puntualidad en sus pagos demostrado a lo largo de sus créditos anteriores, no registrando atrasos  en  las cuotas del plan de pagos pactado. No tiene pasivos en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Abel is married to Mrs. Dora; they have three children of 8, 10 and 13 years old respectively. They have their own property. Abel is a master mason/builder. His wife sells food as a street vendor. Both have many years of experience in each of their lines of work. Although there is a lot of competition in their lines of work their seniority, experience, quality, speed and cleanliness has allowed them to be constantly favored for the services they perform. The loan will be used to improve the home they own. This will be the third loan that Abel will receive; he has shown to be excellent and punctual in his payments, as he has not been late in his payment plans. He has no liabilities in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge the household.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
In God We Trust is a group of five borrowers led by Titus N., a high school graduate, who is married with two children aged 6 and 11 years with educational levels of kindergarten 3rd grade. Titus also cares for a nephew and a stepson. Titus lives and works in Gaye Town, Old Road, Monrovia, Liberia. This is a community that is mixed with both poor and middle class Liberians.

Titus’ business is clothing, buying used clothes wholesale and selling to his customers in Gaye Town. He has been running his business for more than a year. He started this business with a few pieces of used clothing but now he has more than one hundred pieces.

Selling a good product is the means of attraction Titus uses to get more customers. The rainy season makes business slow because Titus doesn't have a shelter for his business; he usually goes around to sell.

Titus’ dream is to grow his business until he can build a larger permanent shop. He is taking the loan to buy additional used clothes wholesale to serve his customers and improve his business. With the profits from his business he dreams of sending his children to school and building a house of his own.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothes wholesale

loans.name: Georgina Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas
Blanca es casada, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Blanca se dedica a la venta de medicina natural por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Blanca vende ollas Renaware.
Blanca necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural.
Los sueños de Blanca es ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Hormigas Communal Bank. Blanca is married. She is 46 years old and has 4 children. She is dedicated to the sale of natural medicines via catalogs that she offers to her freinds and acquaintances. In addition, she sells Renaware pots. Blanca needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of natural medicines. Blanca dreams of growing her business and offering a good quality of life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy natural medicines for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain the vehicle used in her transportation business and pay for her children's schooling

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary owns and operates a general store in front of her family's house in Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She has been managing her business for two years and her business has provided for the basic needs of their family and paid for her children to attend school. She hopes to expand her retailing business by adding merchandise that she can sell in her store.  

Mary is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to improve and develop her general store. She will use the loan to buy more items that she can offer to her customers. The loan will surely be a big help in improving her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Juana M. es propietaria de su propio negocio de venta de cristalería como son platos, vasos, picheles, cafeteras, entre otros.  El negocio lo posee desde hace doce años habiéndose dedicado directamente a este ya que por medio de sus ventas genera los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
Ella actualmente está solicitando su crédito para la compra de los electrodomésticos y así continuar ofreciéndolos en su localidad en el departamento de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Martinez owns a business selling glassware such as plates, drinking glasses, pitchers, coffee pots, and other items. She has been devoted to her business for twelve years. The sales she generates enables her to maintain her household.

Juana is now requesting a loan in order to buy household appliances to offer from her store in the department of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase household appliances to sell

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo, quien profesor de arte y tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.
Desde hace 2 años ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos y lo hace con mucha paciencia, para que puedan obtener el peso exacto y lo ofrezca a un precio cómodo.
Cada 45 días, ya están listos para ser vendidos a los compradores regulares que tiene en su zona. Sin embargo, además de esto, Carla también vende comida rápida por las noches (salchipapas y pollos broaster) negocio en el que la va muy bien y lo viene ejerciendo desde hace muy poco tiempo (2 meses). 
Lo más difícil para ella es no contar con un galpón adecuado para sus animales, pues los cría el aire libre dentro de su casa. Su deseo a futuro es tener su restaurante o una pastelería.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo e que no tienen problemas de pago y todos son muy puntuales. Lo que Carla necesita es mandar a construir un galpón para sus pollos, por lo que el dinero que ahora solicita lo usará en la compra de materiales de construcción, además de pollos bebés y lo necesario en alimento para su crianza.
texts.en:
Carla is 29 years old. She lives with her husband, who is an art professor and they have 2 children who go to school. Two years ago, she patiently began to breed chicken. With her method, they can gain a nice weight, which allows her to sell them at a fair price. They are ready every 45 days, and she sells them to regular buyers in her area. She also sells fast food at night, (hot dogs and fries and chicken nuggets) and even though she started only 2 months ago, the business is very successful. The hardest part of her business is not to have adequate facilities for her animals, as the breeding process occurs in the open air at her house. Her dream for the future is to open her own restaurant of bakery. This is her 8th loan with MFP and what she likes about her group is that everybody is very responsible with their payments. Carla needs to hire a contractor to build a shed for her chicken. She will use the money she's requesting at this time to buy construction materials, as well as chicks and breeding food.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a chicken shed

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
Alcira tiene 42 años, vive junto a su esposo Teobaldo, de 46 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Henry de 15, Analí de 13 y Maick de 5 años. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en un paraje alejado de la ciudad, su vivienda es de adobe (tierra adoquinada) y tejado, donde el fuerte frío de la sierra no ingresa con facilidad.

Desde hace 10 años Alcira se dedica a la venta de carne con la ayuda de su esposo; ambos caminan largas horas hacia otros pueblos para comprar ganado que después sacrifican para vender la carne en el mercado de la ciudad. Esta actividad es muy rentable, ya que les permite dar una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos; además con el dinero que obtienen, paralelamente, siembran papa y olluco (productos comestibles oriundos de la sierra) que también comercializan al mercado de su ciudad por temporadas. 
Es por ello que Alcira desea ampliar su negocio de venta de carne para obtener mayores ganancias, más ahora que el número de sus clientes se ha incrementado por la demanda y calidad  de este producto.

Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está feliz porque con su trabajo podrá sacar adelante a su familia, además cuenta que en su banco comunal, donde es muy entusiasta porque aprende mucho. Con el dinero que obtendrá comprará más cabezas de ganado para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, así como varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes para asegurar su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Alcira is 42. She lives with her husband Teobaldo, 46, and with their 3 children: Henry 15, Analí 13 and Maick 5. They have their own home and it is located in a spot far from the city. Their house is made of adobe (paved floor) and a tiled roof, so the severe cold of the mountains does not easily get in. For 10 years Alcira has been selling meat with the help of her husband. Both walk long hours to other villlages to buy livestock that they then slaughter to sell meat in the city market. This business is very profitable, since it allows them to give their children a suitable quality of life. In addition with the money they get they plant potato and olluco (edible products native to the mountains) that they also sell at their city market on and off. It is for this reason that Alcira wants to increase her meat selling business to make bigger profits, more now that the number of her customers has increased through the demand and quality of this product. This is the seventh time that she has had a loan with MFP and she is happy because with her work she will be able to help her family get ahead. Also she says that she is a fan of her communal bank because she learns a lot. With the money that she gets she will buy more livestock to cover her customers' demands, as well as various sacks of manure and fertilizers to support their next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Audelia Clarisa

texts.es:
La Señora Audelia Clarisa Salmerón Dávila, Labora como Metodóloga en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 Ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  ella es una cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento y Hierro, para la construcción de una pared en la parte trasera del patio, ya que anteriormente estaba cerrado con  alambre de púa.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Audelia Clarisa Salmerón Dávila works as a methodology specialist at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. She has two school-age children in her care and is married. She has worked with CEPRODEL [a Kiva field partner] for three years. During this time she has taken four loans for improvements to her home, all financed by CEPRODEL. She is an excellent borrower. This loan is for an investment in construction materials such as sand, cement and iron, for the construction of a wall on the far end of her patio. This area was previously closed off with barbed wire. The wall will provide the family with more security and will give her children better living conditions

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Basilia Del Socorro

texts.es:
ESTA SRA. ES UNA GANADERA Y COMERCIANTE DE LA ZONA DE POTOSI EN LA FOTO SE OBSERVA EN PLENA FAENA DE TRABAJO PUES CUENTA CON UN MOLINO Y SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE GANADO MAYOR 
ES UNA MUJER CASADA MADRE DE 3 HIJOS LOS CUALES SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR PARA LOS CUALES ELLA TARABAJA CON MUCHO ESFUERZO Y DEDICACION 
 EL CRDITO LO SOLICITA PARA LA COMPRA DE UNOS NOVILLOS Y MANTENIMIENTO DE EL MOLINO PARA SEGUIR TRABAJANDO.
texts.en:
This lady is a cattle rancher and a merchant in the area of Potosi. In the picture she can be observed full at work since she has a mill and she raises livestock. She is a married woman with three school-aged children; she is dedicated and works hard for them. She is requesting the loan to buy some young bulls and maintain her mill so she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle and to repair and maintain mill

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher has been working as a home project electrician since 1998. Working on a freelance basis, he manages part of house projects in his town and its surroundings. He's 30 years old and living with his parents and one brother, and they cooperate together to satisfy their needs and expenses.

With the help of the loan requested of US$ 1,000, he managed to add the amount needed to his savings to expand his business by buying new tools and taking on more projects and  becoming known by other entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buying new tools

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is single. He owns a small business selling various home products: electric appliances, kitchen goods and other items. Andrei has been in this business for 11 years. His income is about 6,000 hryvnia (UAH) per month.

Andrei's little store is located in the central market. The good location and good prices bring in many customers. Andrei is a very responsible and disciplined person. He has used business loans before and always paid them back on time. This time, Andrei is requesting a loan of 9,700 UAH to purchase additional inventory. He hopes to increase sales and to develop his business further.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
In Kam Nab village in Kandal province these four people make up a group loan. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sokha S. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She owns a general store in the local village and, since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, in order to improve her family living conditions, she decided to request a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

Mrs. Sokha S.’s husband, Mr. Keov Toem, owns a rice mill in the local village. Through this activity, the couple supports six children, one of whom is a motorbike repairer, another is a car repairer, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Sophall's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of five people who live in Ta Loek village in Kandal province. Each member is going to use their loan for a different purpose that improves their business in the future. Mrs. Sophall D. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members.
Mrs. Sophall D. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. In addition to this, she sell cakes. Her problem is that her rice field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sophall D. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a widow with three children, two of whom attend a local public school, while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en: Phourng T., age 49, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk and sells groceries and meat for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day.  Phourng is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products for sale. She will use any additional profits to support the children’s education.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy raw silk to produce more silk products.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.en: Urbana S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old, married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Urbana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Urbana has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Urbana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Urbana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Urbana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Urbana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alexi Abigail

texts.es:
Alexis de 26 años, vive en Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución) su casa es de caña, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propia tienda, comprando arroz y azúcar, para poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares. En ocasiones sus padres le ayudan, trabajando desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer, para poder surtir su tienda necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, enlatados, azúcar. 

En el futuro quiere surtir mas su tienda para tener mas ganancias y asi poder ayudar mas a sus padres en los gastos.
texts.en:
Alexis, 26, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a suburban area with dirt roads and eroding hills). Her house is made of cane and she has a grocery store in front part of her house. Little by little, making an effort, she was able to have her own shop, buying rice and sugar, in order to help her parents with household expenses. Sometimes her parents help her, working from early until sunset. To stock her shop, she needs a loan to buy rice, canned goods, and sugar. In the future she wants to restock her store to get more profits and thereby help help her parents more with expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, canned goods and sugar

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en: Juliette is 42 years old and married with a three year old child. She has been operating a retail shop for three years. She sells mainly cereals, sugar, salt, maize flour, and cooking fat in her shop. She has been an active member of a group in Faulu Kenya, and attends the weekly meetings regularly.  Being a member of the group, she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase a weighing machine and cereals. She hopes to expand her shop in five years.

loans.use: To purchase a weighing machine and cereals.

loans.name: Jessica Paola

texts.es:
La Señora. Jessica Paola T. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido vive por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su rica cultura, su centro histórico, su variada gastronomía, la belleza de su vegetación y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Señora Jessica Paola es muy joven tiene 23 años, es casada y tiene 1 hija de 4 años de edad, vive en la casa de su mamá debido que no tienen casa propia y comparten los gastos del hogar.

Trabaja como asesora de ventas de los productos personales Unilever, labora en esta actividad hace un año y ocho meses, trabaja de 9 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. de lunes a sábados; también tiene un pequeño bazar hace un año.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por una amiga que es socia del banco comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su bazar.

Su meta es  ingresar a la universidad y obtener su titulo de Ingeniera Comercial.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica Paola T. is a member of the Communal Bank “Medio Ejido”. She lives in the Las Orquídeas sector of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for its rich culture, its historical center, its various cuisines, its beautiful vegetation, and the warmth and friendliness of its people.

Sra. Jessica Paola is a young woman who is 23 years of age, married, and has a four year old daughter. Since she does not own a home, she lives at her mother’s house and shares in the household expenses.

Jessica works as a sales consultant, offering personal products manufactured by Unilever. She has had this job for a year and eight months, and works Monday through Saturday from 9am to 7pm. Jessica also has a small bazaar that she opened a year ago.

She is receiving her first loan from Fundación ESPOIR and was invited by a friend to join the Communal Bank. Her loan will be invested in merchandise for her bazaar. Jessica says her goal is to gain admission at the university and obtain a degree in Commercial Engineering.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her bazaar such as clothing, costume jewelry, gifts, cosmetics, and stationery

loans.name: Hoi's Group

texts.en:
Hoi T. T. is 58 years old and has 2 children who are married. She retired 5 years ago. Since then, she has raised pigs for meat to increase her family's income. Currently, she is raising 8 pigs. Ms Hoi has received 3 SEDA loans and has used them very effectively. She is a very good client. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more pig food.
 
Binh T. K. D. is 51 years old with 1 child. She runs a fashion shop. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop
Hoa T. L. P. is 30 years old. She has a tailor shop. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more clothing and material for her work.
Hanh T. H. T. is 31 years old and has 2 children. She has been running a grocery shop for 2 years. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to invest in her business
Hue T. N. is 47 years old and has 2 children. She has been running a small restaurant serving breakfast and fast food for 7 years. She hopes to receive a loan of 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop by buying items such as sets of table and a desk.

loans.use: to buy more food for pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora R. is from the village of Seaside, Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old and is married with one adult child. Nora owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Nora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jorge Emanuel

texts.es:
El señor Jorge de 18 años de edad, soltero, no tiene hijos, cuenta con una casa de repuestos   en su domicilio, conocido en la zona.
 Heredo el negocio de su padre actualmente el se encarga de la administración del mismo. 
Los artículos que más vende son, aceite para motores, filtros en general y repuestos para vehículos de la línea japonesa.
Solicito dicho préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de baterías   en cantidad. 
El mismo al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Jorge is 18 years old, single, has no children, rents his room from a boarding house, and is known in the area.

He inherited the business from his father, and now he is responsible for managing it.

The things he sells the most are motor oil, filters of all types, and replacement parts for Japanese cars.

He is requesting this loan from Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya to buy batteries in bulk.

He is grateful for the help from Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: Purchase batteries

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ. She is 54 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Alejandra is involved in the buy-and-sell business, specifically pillow cases. Alejandra is seven years in this business and earns approximately  2,000 PHP a month. 

In Year 2,000 Alejandra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This is her 14th loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 14,900 for additional inventory and working capital for her business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory for her pillow-making business

loans.name: Ssazi Twekulakulanye Women's Association-Mpigi Group

texts.en: N. Zeridda, 59, has been an agricultural product and produce seller for over 20 years in Mpigi. She mostly sells cassava, bananas and maize. She has also been selling eggs, in addition to her modest pig husbandry enterprise. A business that she says began with the influence of her mom now generates 200,000 shillings per week. Prior to this she was selling alcohol. With this loan, she says she wants to purchase more bags of cassava and maize for resale. Zeridda belongs to Ssazi Twekulakulanye Women's Association-Mpigi.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cassava and maize

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Flores de Vilquechico” ubicado en el distrito de Vilquechico, provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 08 hijos (05 dependientes), la señora estudió hasta 4to de educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses, nos cuenta que con el primer  préstamo solicitado de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes y golosinas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar mercaderías para su tienda. 
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es hacer su casa y tener ganados.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the “Las Flores de Vilquechico” (Flowers of Vilquechico) community bank which is located in Vilquechico district, Huancané province, in the department of Puno.  She is 48 years old, married and has 8 children (5 of whom are still dependent).  She studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Eusebia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 months.  She tells us that her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling groceries and candies.

She is requesting a new loan for 800 nuevos soles which she will use to buy merchandise for her store.

Her dream for the future is to build her own home and to own livestock.

What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of acquiring a loan and the savings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa A. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old, married and has 2 infants. Teresa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack food. She decided to change her business from a mini restaurant to retailing because it is more profitable. Teresa is just starting this business.

In 2010, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: María Sara

texts.es: María Sara R. D. T., resiD. en el departamento D. Soyapango, en donD. vive junto a su esposo. María como toda mujer responsable con su hogar, posee un negocio en el cual comercializa: pollo, sopas instantáneas,  verduras y jugos. Su venta se encuentra a las afueras D. su hogar en donD. trabaja día con día para brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda aumentar su inventario, y D. esta forma contar con más clientes los cuales consuman más D. sus productos.
texts.en:
María Sara R. D. T. lives with her husband in the Soyapango department.  María, like all responsible women, has a business. She sells chicken, instant soups, vegetables, and juice.  Her business is located outsiD. of her house.  She works there day to day in order to give her husband the needed support to pay all of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to be able to increase her inventory.  That way she will have more customers who consume more of her products.

loans.use: To buy chicken and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Raul Vicente

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
