El socio es el Sr. Raul Vicente; el tiene 51 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de minería este es un trabajo duro y arduo que necesita maquinarias y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para pagar el contrato de maquinaria.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "San Jose de Urubamba" community bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco. The member is Mr. Raul Vincente; he is 51, lives with his partner and has 2 children. He alternates his daily activities with his work as a miner. This is hard and arduous work that needs machinery, and this is how he gets his children ahead. He wants to continue improving in his work. He is requesting this loan to pay the machinery contract. He is happy to have this loan and promises to carry out the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to pay a machinery contract.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid K., a hardworking gentleman in the cattle-raising business, is married and works hard to provide for his two children. Presently, Rashid is making sacrifices and working hard to grow his business, and now is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise. His goal is to maximize returns from the sale of milk products. This will be Rashid's fourth loan with IMON and Kiva, and his credit history shows that he is qualified to receive the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya, 52, is married and lives with her husband and daughter in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Their daughter attends a local school; her husband is disabled due to a car accident. They live in a house on the outskirts of the city and they have a decent standard of living. 

Tuya started a public transportation business in 2006. She made an agreement with a bus company to get the bus by leasing it and making payments from her profit. Now she owns the bus as she has finished the payments recently. By owning the bus, she only pays taxes and the driver's salary while all the income directly goes to her. She is planning to have her own garage in the near future. 

Tuya is a polite and honest person who says, "I wish to build a better life and help my daughter to finish university by working hard." Tuya is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs for her bus.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a general store, selling mattresses, bedsheets and printing papers to her neighbors. Agnes faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season, the price of the products increases and demand decreases. In the future, she hopes to establish a wholesale shop to sell mattresses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase mattresses, bedsheets, reams of printing paper and body lotions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase mattresses, bedsheets, reams of printing paper and body lotions to resell.

loans.name: Ulemj

texts.en: Ulemj, 52, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. They have a decent standard of living. His wife is unemployed and operates a coal and firewood retail business. He began transporting goods using his own truck between Ulaanbaatar and western provinces in 1983. He currently owns a truck that can carry five tons of goods. He gets between 180-250 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) per kilo of goods when he transports them. Now he is planning to bring dairy products from the countryside and sell them in the city. He is a hardworking and sociable person who says, "I would like to carry on my transpiration business and make more profit." He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance fees for his truck.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 51 year-old Rugiatu.  She is married and has children aged 18, 16, 17, and 12. Apart from her children and husband, her elderly mother is also living with her. In 1980, Rugiatu established her clothing business.She began her business because she dropped out of school in the early stages of secondary education.  "I found business to be my only hope of survival,"  Rugiatu said.  She is glad she made that decision.  

Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing for her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to establish a shop mainly for wholesale purposes.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Musu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the teachers of the MCA Primary School in Portee, Freetown. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of 5,000,000 SLL to solve their financial problems or invest in a business. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting member repayments and paying SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf. 

Musu J. is the leader of this teacher’s group. She is 36 years old and married with three children. Musu was born in northern Sierra Leone and has been a teacher for more than five years. To supplement her meager monthly salary, Musu is runs a small business. She has applied for this loan to buy wholesale gara lappers (locally dyed cloths) to resell.

loans.use: to buy locally dyed cloth to resell

loans.name: Kourch

texts.en: Kourch S., 26, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. S. sells groceries, earning an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase cows to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Mery  Roxana

texts.es:
Mery tiene 34 años de edad, ella, vive en casa propia con sus 2 hijos. Su casa esta ubicada en el caserío llamado las Malingas, en el distrito de Tambogrande  en el departamento de Piura al norte del Perú.  Mery vive en la parte céntrica de este caserío y cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Mery es la venta de golosinas y gaseosas en su propio domicilio, en el cual atiende permanentemente, esta actividad la realiza  hace 1 año, en que ha ido adquiriendo experiencia.  

Mery esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar más mercadería, de esta manera ampliar su negocio y por consiguiente aumentar sus ventas.

Mery,  es una clienta nueva para Edpyme Alternativa, siendo este su primer crédito en una entidad financiera. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias, pues en su comunidad la reconocen como una mujer trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Mery is 34 years old and lives in her own home together with her two children.  Her home is located in a small village called Las Malingas, in Tambogrande district, in Piura department, in the north of Peru.  Mery lives in the central part of her village and her home has electricity.

Mery's business is selling candies and soda from her home.  She serves in her business all the time.  She has been in this line of work for one year and has gained experience.

Mery is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy more merchandise.  In this way, she will be able to expand her business and thereby increase her sales.

Mery is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa and this is her first loan.  She has good references as she is known in her community as a hard-working and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 51 years old. Asuncion is separated from her spouse and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Asuncion owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Asuncion has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asuncion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Asuncion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Edwin Darvin

texts.es:
Edwin padre de familia de 37 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertence al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona desarrolla la actividad agrícola, ganadería y turismo (lugares turísticos y festividades bonitas).

Desde hace 6 años labora en el fundo FRUTOS OLMOS SAC como trabajador de la planta, por lo que realiza en el fundo se le brinda un pago mensual para que pueda cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia.  Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para realizar algunos arreglos en su casa y para cubrir algunos gastos personales, lo que le permitirá tener a su familia un poco más de comodidades.

Edwin es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades académicas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Edwin, 37, is a father living with his wife and children in his own house that has water and electricity and is located in Olmos District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  This is a zone of farming, livestock raising and tourism (tourist attractions and pretty festivities).

He has been employed for the last six years as a laborer at the FRUTOS OLMOS SAC large agricultural firm.  For his work there he’s paid a monthly salary in order to be able to cover daily family needs.  He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to do some home improvements and to cover some personal expenses which will allow his family a bit more comfort.

Edwin is a very hard working, responsible person.  All he wants is that his children have better academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to do some home improvements and cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: Josefa  Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa, habita en el departamento de León, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, ella es comerciante se dedica a vender  fritanga (comidas fritas). Este ha sido su primer negocio  , ella lo tiene desde hace 36 años, tenia  que mantener a sus hijos , ella recuerda que empezó con una libra de arroz y un plátano ella vendía todos los días comenzaba sus deberes desde las 6 de la mañana y terminaba a las 10 de la noche  con el tiempo sus hijos crecieron y le fueron apoyando poco a poco hoy en día sigue vendiendo ,trabaja casi todos los días ,solo los miércoles descansa , el negocio lo tiene en casa de su mama.   
Solicito el préstamo para comprar materia prima para hacer sus comidas. Esta inversión le será de gran ayuda ya que podrá contar con materia prima suficiente para realizar sus platos, cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas. 
Dentro de sus expectativas esta mejorar las condiciones de la cocina, hacerles algunos arreglos, mejorar la apariencia de negocio.
texts.en:
Josefa lives in León Department.  She’s 55 years old, married and has four children.  She’s a merchant selling fried fast food.  This has been her first business and she’s had it for 36 years.  She had to support her children.  She recalls that she started out with just a pound of rice and one banana.  She’d sell every day starting her chores at 6am and ending at 10pm.  In time, her children grew and gradually helped her out a bit.  Today, she continues selling.  She works almost every day, she only takes Wednesdays off.  The business is located in her mother’s house.

She asked for her loan to buy raw materials to make her dishes.  This investment will be of great help to her because she’ll have sufficient ingredients on hand to make her dishes to meet customer demand and improve sales.

Within her expectations is improving the condition of her kitchen, to make some repairs and improve the business’ appearance.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita  es de una Localidad conocido como Emiliano Zapata, Municipio de Tecpatan Chiapas, ella es casada con el señor Javier y tienen un hijo de nombre Javier de siete años de edad.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración de comidas y solcito el préstamo para apoyarse con la compra de ingredientes como son: carne, verduras, tortilla, entre otros, en donde lleva dos años y esta contenta porque le va bien  ya que ha tenido un buen resultado.
Su inspiración por esta actividad fue su propia familia ya que deseaba tener un mejor ingreso, y decidio poner una cocina económica  ya que es un negocio que  deja buenas ganancias y le iría bien en su economía.
Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo ella pueda agrandar su local para mejoras su atención con sus clientes quienes llegan a consumir del diario, así  también  ahorrar para poyara su hijo que está estudiando.
texts.en:
Juanita is from a town known as Emiliano Zapata which is located in Tecpatan, Chiapas.  She is married to Javier and they have a son called Javier who is 7 years old.

Juanita makes food and she requested this loan to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, tortillas, etc.  She has been running her business for two years and is happy because it is doing well.  She has had good results.

Juanita's inspiration for her business was her own family as she wanted to make better income for them.  She decided to set up a 'cocina económica' (a small, informal restaurant selling affordable home-made food) as this is a business that makes good profits and it would help her financially.

What Juanita most wants is to be able to expand her premises over time so that she can improve her service to her customers who come to her establishment to eat every day.  She would also like to save up so that she can support her son who is in school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a married woman with three boys; two attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and clothing.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business and also sells fresh water to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing a water-selling stall in the future.

With the 100,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to renovate her retail shop and purchase cement, sand and blocks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her retail shop and purchase cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol, 44, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Mirasol operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. Mirasol earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the unit. Her store is adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mirasol hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 36 лет. Она разведена. Живет вместе с родителями. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Матлуба занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает летнюю обувь. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для покупки осеней обуви.
texts.en: Matluba lives in the town of Khujand. She is 36 years old. She is divorced and lives with her parents. She has three children. She has completed secondary education. Matluba works as a vendor at the local market. She rents a stand where she sells summer shoes. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is taking out a loan to buy shoes for the fall season.

loans.use: to buy fall shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fund operating and marketing expenses.

loans.name: Silvio Arnoldo

texts.es: Silvio Arnoldo tiene 36 años él se dedica a una farmacia en donde ofrece una gran variedad de medicamentos. Tiene más de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida. Lo inicio porque su hermana es farmacéutica y con la ayuda de ella decide establecer su negocio, pues tiene que buscar la forma de mantener a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pastillas, vitaminas, gotas, inyecciones, algodones y otros productos.
texts.en: Silvio Arnoldo is 36 and has a pharmacy where he offers a wide variety of medicines.  He has been earning a living this way for over 12 years.  He started the business because his sister is a pharmacist and with her help decided to set it up.  This was a way for him to support his family.  The loan he is requesting is to buy pills, vitamins, drops, injections, cotton and other products.

loans.use: To buy pills, vitamins, drops, injections, cotton and other products.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is a 61-year-old married man with 1 child. He is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Avelino works hard to improve his business and income. He wants to be able to buy all that his family needs.

Avelino has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Avelino hopes for this loan to help improve his harvest.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a fourty-four year old married woman, with five children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She takes care of her family with the help of her husband,  a farmer. Their dream is to educate their children up to university level. She has been operating a salon for nineteen years and this has facilitated her in looking after the family. 

Joyce has challenges of limited capital and her dream is to have a big and modern salon. Joyce needs the loan to buy cosmetics for use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for use in the salon.

loans.name: C9293  Inkotanyi Cyane Group

texts.en: Frederique is 48 years old and married with four children between the ages of 2 and 15 years old. Frederique is the leader of a group called Inkotanyi cyane and this group is commonly known for selling animals. Frederique has three years' experience and his business hours are from 6 am until 8 pm every day. Frederique is in the middle in this group. Frederique and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing more animals (goats, cows and sheep) to sell. If successful, Frederique and his team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. They will continue improving their families' lifestyles.

loans.use: to purchase more animals: goats, cows, sheep, etc

loans.name: Merie Ann

texts.en:
Merie Ann is from Bañadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is single and is 28 years old. Merie Ann sells barbeque in her own stall for her daily needs. She's been in this business for almost two years and earns PHP 8,000.00 per month.

Merie Ann has been a member of GDMPC for almost three years. Merie Ann is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to purchase additional barbeques for her stall. In the future, Merie Ann wants to expand her barbeque business and build more barbeque stalls.

loans.use: to purchase additional barbeques for her stall

loans.name: Davies

texts.en:
Davies is 20 years old and has been in poultry farming for 3 years. His poultry birds, milk, and eggs go to the local market. He is single and lives in his home area of Litein, in the South Rift region of Kenya, where he does his farming.

Davies has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more poultry birds for his farming business. He says the loan will help him boost his business and build a strong foundation for his family in the future. He says he will save his income and make his farming more commercial. He hopes to be the main supplier for broilers and layers for the local market. He laments the large fluctuations in milk prices.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil is 38 years old and married. He is engaged in a small farming business in the village of La Salette. He plants crops like corn. Gil is a very hardworking person. He lives with his wife and children. His plan for the future is to improve their living conditions. 

Gil has been a corn farmer for several years. The greatest problem he faces is not having enough economic resources to provide better care for his crops. This is because he lacks fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies for better production. That's why he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer to grow in his farm

loans.name: Lucy Mkio

texts.en:
Lucy, age 39, sells soda to members of her local community. Her business is faced with the problem of low purchasing power from her clients. Lucy describes herself as honest and trustworthy. She and her husband have five children, aged between two and 15 years old. 
 
She will be using the loan Kes 20,000 to buy crates of soda to offer for sale.

In the future, Lucy wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy crates of sodas to offer for sale

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 29 años y vive en la aldea Independencia en el municipio de La Lima. Ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 6 años, lo cual está estudiando en la escuela. 

Sonia vive junto a sus padres y realiza dos actividades de negocio desde hace 4 años. Juntamente con su familia, ella elabora y vende tortillas. Hace tortillas todo el día y allí mismo aprovecha a ofrecer productos Vogue. Ella vende cremas, lociones, perfumes, cremas faciales y champú entre otros productos. Sonia cuenta con la ayuda de una persona quien distribuye los pedidos y cobros de los productos. Ella comenzó el negocio con sus ahorros y los invirtió en productos. 

Actualmente solicitó un crédito de L10,000 para surtir su negocio y comprar productos como cremas, acondicionador y champú. Va a aprovechar la temporada navideña para incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Sonia is 29 years old and lives in the village of Independencia, in the La Lima municipality.  She is a single mother of a 6-year-old son, who attends school.

Sonia lives with her parents and has been undertaking her business activities for the last four years.  Together with her family, she prepares and sells tortillas.  She makes tortillas all day long, and at the same time she also has the advantage of selling beauty products.  She sells creams, lotions, perfumes, face creams, and shampoo, among other things.  Sonia has the help of someone who distributes her products to people who have placed orders or made purchases on charge.  She began  the business using her savings, which she invested in products.

She is currently requesting a loan of L10,000 to stock up her business and purchase products such as creams, conditioner and shampoo.  She wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy products such as creams, conditioner, and shampoo.

loans.name: Luciernagas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCIERNAGAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de fruta tejido de corpiños, venta de pantalones, venta de sacos, venta de yines.

La señora Juana,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo venderá en la ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Luciernagas” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Juana. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as selling fruit, making bodices, selling trousers, selling bags, and selling jeans.

Sra. Juana says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization upon receiving an invitation from a promoter. Juana currently has a business of selling vegetables and has been working for many years. She learned this trade from her family.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying vegetables, which she acquires in bulk in La Ceja. She then sells her goods at the fairs. By working in this manner, she is able to generate income to support her family. Juana is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana said that she enjoys the health services.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr:
Aline fait le commerce des habits. Elle a 33 ans. Aline est marée et a 3 enfants dont le plus petit a 10 mois et le plus grand a 14 ans. Deux enfants d'Aline vont à l'école. Elle a 6 ans d'enseignements secondaires.

C'est le 2ème cycle de crédit qq'Aline fait avec ACB Ltd. Elle veut augmenter le capital de son commerce des habits.

Dans le futur, Aline veut devenir grossiste par ce qu'actuellement elle vend en detail. Pour y arriver, elle va augmenter son capital d'une façon continue et cherchera beaucoup de clients.

Avec le profit de son commerce, Aline va construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Aline trades in clothing. She is 33 years old. Aline is married and has three children of whom the youngest is 10-months old and the eldest is 14. Two of Aline's children go to school. She has six years of secondary school.

This is the second loan cycle that Aline is requesting from ACB Ltd. She wants to increase the capital of her business selling clothing.

In the future, Aline wants to become a wholesaler because presently she sells retail. In order to make it happen, she is going to increase her capital in a continuous way and will look for many customers. With her business' profits, Aline is going to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants and t-shirts to resell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 30 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single and has three children between 1 and 11 years old. Two of her children are in school and all of them live at home.  

For the past three years, Mercy has been selling soap and sugar. She started this business with money given to her by her friend. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap and sugar for her business. In the future, Mercy wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Marina Guadalupe

texts.es: Marina Guadalupe posee una venta de cosméticos, cremas para el cabello y cuerpo, perfumes, lociones, shampoo,  y joyería de oro. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, y así mismo sale a vender las prendas de vestir en diferentes municipios. : Marina es madre soltera y vive junto a tres hijos menores de edad.  Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, aumentando la cantidad de maquillajes y de esta forma ofrecer diferentes precios, así mismo comprar cremas para el cuerpo, lo cual es lo que posee mayor cantidad de demanda, así mismo desea destinar parte del dinero para terminar de mejorar con algunos detalles a un cuarto en su casa. Tener mayor cantidad de productos la llena de mucha ilusión ya que espera mejorar sus ganancias, y de esta forma seguir brindándoles la oportunidad a todos sus hijos de seguir estudiando.

loans.use: Compra de cosmeticos para comercializar

loans.name: Marie Christelle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 8 femmes ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et exerçant pratiquement la même activité, qui est le commerce.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Marie est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles, elle a aussi en charge 2 autres enfants.  
Le prêt reçu va lui permettre de mener son activité commerciale, ainsi elle compte acheter 10 sacs de pain de singe, 10 sacs de bissap et du sucre et divers ingrédients nécessaire  pour le jus.
Avec les bénéfices générés elle assure et participe à la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle soutient aussi son fils malade dans ses frais médicaux.
texts.en:
This group is made up of eight women who are all friends and engage in commerce. Standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised is Marie, who is 47 years old. She is married and a mother of five children, two of whom are girls. She also takes care of two other children. 

This loan will allow her to conduct her business. She hopes to buy 10 sacs of baobab fruit, 10 sacs of bissap, sugar, and other various ingredients needed to make juice. 

With the earnings, Marie contributes to her children's schooling. She also pays for her sick son's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy baobab fruit, bissap, and sugar

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi, age 26, is a married mother of two children. Mwanaidi is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers for two and half hours per week to teach students life skills. 

She is requesting a Kiva loan to start a business selling breakfast bites and to build a room for her business. Mwanaidi will use her profit to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to start a business selling breakfast bites

loans.name: Nadjegueton D Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe NADJEGUETON D sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Flazambougou, un des villages de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso enfin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
 lls sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
 La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Monsieur Moumouni en troisième position de la gauche vers le droite sur la photo,  il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 220.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et payer les frais de labour

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
I prepare natural meals and refreshments. I’ve had my business for five years, and it’s been going well. My clients choose me for my yummy burritas I prepare (tortilla with meat, fried beans, and butter). In the mornings is when I sell the most, because I deliver my meals to offices. During weekends, I sell beauty products such as cosmetics and lotions. This provides me with an extra income that helps me cover my children’s expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase tortillas, chicken, sausage, butter, cheese, beans, fruits, and others.

Mi actividad es la elaboracion de alimentos y refrescos naturales, tengo cinco años de tener mi negocio y me ha ido bien. Mis clientes me prefieren por las ricas burritas (tortilla con carne, frijolitos fritos y mantequilla) que preparo, por la mañana es cuando mas vendo, ya que entrego mi comida en oficinas, los fines de semana vendo productos de belleza como cosmeticos, lociones, cremas esto me genera un ingreso extra que bastante me ayuda con los gastos de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de tortillas, pollo, chorizo, mantequilla, queso, frijoles, frutas y otros

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells a local beverage in the community. She has participated in the TEACH lending programs and is a member of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a Kiva loan of $500 to expand her business and sell to school children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Business Description

Don Lorenzo has a grocery store where he also sells other basic necessities, in a business area and on a main street. He began his business with some money that his wife sent him from abroad, where she has been for three years now.

Loan Use

Don Lorenzo will use this loan to purchase more merchandise on wholesale and continue to invest in his store so that he can improve it and attract more customers.

Personal Information

Don Lorenzo is 45 and has three children who all go to school. He lives in a cement-built home. He has the firm conviction that with the improvements he will make in his store, he will bring in more customers. With the increase in customers, he will be able to better assure the future of his family and he will be able to bring his wife home to live with them again.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Descripción del Negocio

Don Lorenzo tiene una tienda donde vende víveres y artículos de primera necesidad en un sector muy comercia y en calle principal. Este negocio lo empezó con un dinero que le envío su esposa que está en el exterior hace tres años. /p>

Uso del Préstamo

Don Lorenzo usará el préstamo para comprar más mercadería al por mayor y así poder seguir realizando inversiones en el negocio y pronto incrementarlo de tal manera que pueda tener más clientes

Información Personal

Él tiene 45 años y tres hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento. Lorenzo tiene la firme convicción que con las mejorar que haga en su negocio su clientela aumentara y así podrá asegurar el futuro de su familia y en un momento dado su esposa pueda regresar para estar juntos nuevamente

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and other products.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 34 years old and supports a family of four children. All the children are of school-going age. The eldest -also the only girl- is in Grade 7. All the rest are boys and two of them are enrolled in Grade 5 while the youngest is in Grade 3.

Alex rents a small room in the city suburbs of Kampala where he stays with one of the boys. The rest of the children stay in the village with their mother because the cost of living in Kampala is too high for the family. Alex is employed in the transport business and rides a motorcycle ferrying passengers to different destinations. This has been his source of livelihood for the past few years.

Alex now wants to acquire a motorcycle of his own, which will help him increase his daily income, meet the children's school fees requirements and provide for their other basic living expenses. He is requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase a new motorcycle. He will be able to repay the loan in a period of 7months

loans.use: Puchase of Motorcycle

loans.name: Chahina

texts.en: Chahina is a single woman living in the Bekaa and owns a grocery shop. The store is her only source of income. Chahina is an entrepreneur who takes business initiatives to ensure her business's survival. Chahina is planning to develop her grocery store and therefore needs to purchase merchandise to expand her line of products. This is the first time Chahina has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. She heard about the Institution through word of mouth.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her grocery shop

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Mrs. Vat C., 60, works as a tailor, earning around $1.50 each day. Her husband, 63, makes items used in religious rituals, such as incense, golden coconuts, and decorated banana trees. He sells them in the market, making about $3.50 per day. They have six children. One lives at home and is employed in a garment factory, making about $70 per month.  The others are married and live in their own homes. She is asking for a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a motor-bike for one of her children, who wants to operate a motor-taxi business. In this way, he will earn additional money to supplement his family’s income. Her husband is pictured in the photo because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike so that her son can start a taxi business.

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
Freddy Alberto Chavarria M. is a married man with one son. He sells new and used clothing in Chinandega city. He began this business 7 years ago, and has worked with Ceprodel for 3 years. He says he began this business when he was without work for a while, and with these sales he could take care of his son.

Since working with Ceprodel for three years, he says he feels good about the previous loans as they have been very timely and accessed easily, and have enabled him to purchase merchandise that he didn’t have.

This business is located near the main bus station in Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Freddy Alberto Chavarria M. es un señor casado y con un hijo a su responsabilidad, este cliente tiene ubicado el negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada en la ciudad de Chinandega. Lo comienza hace siete años, tiene de trabajar con CEPRODEL tres años, dice que este negocio lo emprendió cuando queda sin trabajo por una temporada, y que de esa venta pudo preparar a sus hijos.

Este señor, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que en su momento le han servido para compra de mercadería que no la tenia en existencia.

Actualmente este negocio está ubicado cerca de la estación principal de buses en Chinandega.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea N., age 58, is a housewife. Her husband works as a farmer growing rice and vegetables, making on average around $1.50 each day. She has seven children. Two of them are employed by a garment factory, three are married and live separately, and the rest are unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a large quantity of cashew nuts from growers and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of cashew nuts from growers and resell them for a profit.

loans.name: Santos Elena

texts.es:
Santos Elena, 45, studied through high school. She now has three children, two of whom still live with her. She lives in the Human Victor Raul settlement in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She raises farm animals such as ducks and chickens and fattens them for sale in the nearby Santa Rosa market. Sometimes she gets larger orders for holidays such as Mother's Day, Christmas, national holidays, etc. In addition to that, she works as a street vendor, buying carnations and roses from a wholesaler in the La Hermelinda market and selling them in other local markets, and grows pineapples and avocados on a small piece of land she inherited in the "distrito" of Poroto that she harvests approximately every three months and also sells.

Thanks to some neighbors, she joined the Mujeres del Milenium ("Women of the Millenium") community bank where she received her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100). With the money, she bought feed for her animals. With this loan of S/.1000, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy eight sacks of processed feed, 30 dozen roses and 30 dozen carnations. Santos Elena dream of buying a stand in the market and setting up a flower shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Santos Elena A. M. tiene 45 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene tres hijos en total pero sólo dos dependen de ella. Vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl, distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Su negocio consiste en la crianza de animales menores tales como patos, pollos y gallinas, a los cuales engorda para venderlos en el mercado “Santa Rosa” ubicado en el distrito en el que vive. A veces le hacen pedidos al por mayor en fechas especiales como día de la madre, navidad, fiestas patrias, etc., además en el mercado “La Hermelinda” compra variedad de flores, claveles y rosas al por mayor para volver a vender en condición de ambulante por distintos mercados de la ciudad. En un pequeño terreno que heredó en el distrito de Poroto ha sembrado algunas plantas como piñas y paltas que cosecha cada tres meses aproximadamente, productos que también trae a vender en los mercados.

Gracias a unas vecinas ingresó al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Milenium”, lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300, con este dinero compró el alimento para sus animales: concentrado y maíz. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará ocho sacos de concentrado, 30 docenas de rosas y 30 docenas de claveles. La señora Elena sueña con comprar un puesto en el mercado e implementar una florería.

loans.use: Buy animal feed for livestock business and flowers for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. is married with 5 children, and she is 38 years old. She sells foodstuffs like beans, vegetable oil, etc. She has been in business since 2001. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She is from Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago Ofir V. Correa lives in Ciudad del Este with his wife Antolina and his two children.

Many years ago, Santiago started working in a bookstore called Cassol, where he gained experience in the field. Tired of being an employee, he decided to open his own bookstore in the shopping center of Ciudad del Este. Santiago sells articles used in writing such as paper, pens, quills, inkstands, pencils, and blank books. It is worth mentioning that the store is located in a strategic place, because Ciudad del Este is a commercial city. Usually Paraguayans go to Ciudad del Este only to buy things; from electronic devices to clothes.

Besides the bookstore, Santiago owns a grocery store. Santiago’s wife is the one responsible for the “Despensa” (grocery store). Antolina stays the entire day in the Despensa selling products such as milk, drinks, cigarettes, pasta, etc. The Despensas in Paraguay could be considered as mini supermarkets.

The money provided by this loan is intended to be used for the purchase of paper and other things for Santiago’s bookstore. There is a huge demand for paper and without this loan the increasing demand would not be satisfied.

loans.use: Purchase of paper, pens and books

loans.name: Wara

texts.en:
Wara D. is 32 years old and married with three children. She started her grocery store three years ago and with her previous loan from SMT she increased her stock and has attracted many customers.

Wara would like to expand her business to generate more income to improve her family's life. She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.3,000,000 ($US1,050).

loans.use: To purchase various groceries for her store.

loans.name: Dialia

texts.fr:
Miss Dialia B. is 32 years old and has been living with her brothers, sisters, and daughter at her late father's home since her divorce in Sanoubougou I, a district in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali)

After having run several business activities since her youth, she decided 15 years ago to specialize in the sale of clothing for children. To obtain supplementary financial resourrces in order to meet the needs of a constantly increasing clientele, she decided to take part in the program by asking for a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan.

She has been making voluntary deposits at Soro Yiriwaso for about 2 and a half years. With this loan, she intends to buy 60 outfits (pants and shirt made of the same cloth), 28 bedcovers, 5 dozen containers of powder for children's skin, and 5 dozen containers of children's perfume in Cotonou and in Lomé (Republics of Benin and Togo, respectively, in West Africa). To reach Lomé and Cotonou, she rents a bus for 40,000 FCFA, and arranges her lodging and daily food. She re-sells her merchandise for cash in her shop located hear the Sikasso bus station. With this loan, she intends to a realize a monthly profit of 600,000 FCFA, which will allow her to contribute to the family's expenses, repay the interest on her loan, and invest in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle Dialia B. a 32 ans , et vit avec ses frères , ses soeurs, et sa fille chez son feu père depuis son divorce à Sanoubougou I, un quartier de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali).

Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus dès son jeune age, elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente d’habits pour enfants depuis maintenant 15 ans. Pour obtenir des ressources financières supplémentaires afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elle décida d’intègrer le Programme en demandant un prêt à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel .

Elle effectue des depots d’épargne volontaire à Soro Yiriwaso depuis environ deux 2 ans et demi . Avec ce prêt, elle compte achéter 60 complets (pantalon et chemise de meme tissu ), 28 couvres lits, 5 douzaines de poudre de peau pour enfant et 5 douzaines de parfum pour enfant à Cotonou et à Lomé (Républiques du Benin et de Togo en Afrique de l’Ouest). Pour se rendre à Lomé et à Cotonou, elle emprunte des bus pour 40.000 FCFA, assure son hebergement et sa nourriture quotidiennement. Elle revend ses marchandises au comptant dans sa boutique située à la gare routière de Sikasso. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 600 000 FCFA qui lui permettrons de contribuer aux charges familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and others

loans.name: Elena De La Cruz Group

texts.es:
The group Elena de la Cruz comes from a beautiful town on the shores of Lake Atitlan called Santa Cruz la Laguna. The residents of Santa Cruz have the good fortune of waking up each day and experiencing the beauty of the lake at first sight. This town is divided between the indigenous residents, who live their lives in a very traditional way, and a group of expatriates who are currently investing a great deal in the tourism industry.

The women of Santa Cruz used to live in absolute poverty and without much hope of getting ahead, until a few years ago when “Gringa Lil” began to organize women together to request loans from microfinance institutions. Thanks to the efforts of this industry the town began to grow. This is how the Friendship Bridge began operations in Santa Cruz.

All of the women work with textiles. Half of the group work as weavers of huipiles (typical blouses) and rebosos (scarves), while the other half work as embroiderers. They embroider the huipiles or beautiful colorful blouses. They reinvest their profits in the purchase of threads to weave or embroider their fabrics.

The Elenas de la Cruz sell their products in the market of their town. They also sell in neighboring towns. The interesting thing is that from Santa Cruz to other potential markets like Jaibalito and Tzununa, one can only reach them by boat. The ladies load their baskets with merchandise and then proceed to carry the baskets on their heads to the boats which carry them to neighboring towns.

This group of women would like to continue investing in their businesses, because they want their businesses to grow in order to continue helping their families. They dream that their children will be able to continue going to school all the way to graduation. You can help them reach their dreams. Support them!

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

El grupo Elena de la Cruz proviene de un bello pueblo a las orillas del lago Atitlán llamado Santa Cruz la laguna. Los pobladores de Santa Cruz tienen la fortuna de poder levantarse todos los días y experimentar la belleza del lago a primera vista. Este pueblo está dividido entre los pobladores indígenas, los cuales viven sus vidas de una manera muy tradicionales y un grupo de expatriados que actualmente están invirtiendo mucho en la industria del turismo.

Las mujeres de Santa Cruz vivían en la pobreza absoluta y sin mucha esperanza de salir adelante, hasta que hace unos cuantos años la “gringa Lil” empezó a juntar a mujeres para que solicitaran préstamos a las instituciones de microfinanzas. Gracias a este esfuerzo esta industria empezó a crecer en este bello pueblo. Así fue como The Friendship Bridge empezó operaciones en Santa Cruz.

Todas las mujeres trabajan en el área textil. La mitad del grupo trabaja como tejedoras de huipiles (blusas típicas) y rebosos (pañuelos), mientras que la otra mitad trabaja como bordadoras. Ellas bordan los huipiles o bellas blusas de colores. Ellas invierten su crédito en la compra de hilos para tejer o bordar sus tejidos.

Las Elenas de la Cruz venden sus productos en el mercado de su pueblo. Ellas, también venden sus productos en los pueblos aledaños. Lo interesante es que de Santa Cruz a los otros mercados potenciales como Jaibalito y Tzununa solo se puede llegar por lancha. Las señoras arman sus canastos con mercadería y proceden a cargar los canastos en sus cabezas hasta las lanchas las cuales la llevan hasta los mercados de los pueblos aledaños.

Este grupo de señoras quieren seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios porque ellas quieren que sus negocios puedan seguir creciendo para seguir ayudando a sus familias. Ellas sueñas con que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando hasta terminar una carrera. Ustedes pueden lograr que ellas cumplan con sus sueños, ¡apóyenlas!

loans.use:
The purchase of threads to weave or embroider their textiles.

Ellas invierten su crédito en la compra de hilos para tejer o bordar sus tejidos.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S. is 43 years old and has been working as a fisherman since 1993 at Tunle Sap Lake. He earns around 13,200 Riel (US $3.30) per day. His wife, Mrs. Nhem Touch, is 43 years old and earns around 8,300 Riel (US $2.00) a day working as a farmer. They have four children, one of whom works in his father's business, earning about 12,000 Riel (US $3.00) per day. The family lives in Anglung Samnor Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Mr. Heng wants to expand his business by purchasing more fishing tools but he lacks the capital. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
MIGUEL N. V. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.
EL SEÑOR MIGUEL LABORA PARA UNA EMPRESA EN EL AREA DE MANTENIMIENTO  SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA GLORIA TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA DOMESTICA EN  UNA CASA DONDE YA TIENE MUCHOS AÑOS, JUNTOS COMO UN MATRIMONIO UNIDO CON AMOR Y POR LA FUERZA DE SALIR ADELANTE ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA AMPLIAR LA COCINA DE  SU CASA, YA QUE ES MUY PEQUEÑA Y MEDIANTE ESTA REMODELACION ELLOS PODRAN ESTAR MAS COMODOS Y ASI EN UN FUTURO CERCANO PODER TENER UN HOGAR MAS AMPLIO.
texts.en:
MIGUEL N. V. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Señor Miguel works for a maintenance business. His wife, Señora Gloria, works as a domestic employee in a home where she has been for many years. Together, in a marriage united by love and by the force of improving their lives, they are asking for this loan in order to enlarge the kitchen of their house. The existing one is extremely small and after this remodelling work, they would be more comfortable and so in the near future they would be able to have a larger home.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge the kitchen in their home

loans.name: Fatou Niakassy

texts.fr: Fatou Niakassy S., 55 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Ressortissantes Mpack depuis 2 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter du sel, du nététou, de l’huile de palme, du miel, du piment et des diakhato et revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Fatou Niakassy S., 55, married and raising 4 children, has been a member of the village bank of Ressortissantes Mpack for 2 years. She wants a loan to buy salt, nététou (an edible paste made from tree leaves), palm oil, honey, hot peppers, etc. for re-sale. Her income permits her to improve her living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling vegetables and foodstuffs

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila was born in 1960 and lives in the Absheron region of Azerbaijan. She is married and has two children. Thirteen years ago she started a business selling groceries and household goods. She is applying for a $1,200 loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice, 29 years old, married to a civil engineer and the mother of two children, both attending school, is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rejoice hopes that the extra profits accruing from the loan will allow her to further expand the business in the near future.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beer for sale.

loans.name: Lalotoa

texts.en:
Lalotoa M., 43, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Lalotoa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of this loan will be used to buy fishing gear for her husband; his business goes together with her plantation. Her husband is a very good fisherman who always goes fishing and can earn money from it.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and seedlings, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 60-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ali has been working a lathe for thirty years. He has requested a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always repaid his loans on time.

His previous loans helped him to improve his business. Ali decided to start his business because he was in need of cash. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny T. is a 31 year old resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, where she earns a living distilling Khmer wine for sale, as well as raising pigs. To help with the family's food needs, her husband sells firewood by cutting it down from the forest. They have two children who are teenagers and in school. Ny T. hopes to improve her business, because it is very profitable for the family. She is asking for a loan to buy rice for distilling wine and piglets to raise. The remainder of the loan will used for her husband's business operation.

loans.use: To buy rice for distilling wine and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas I. is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and drinks.  Dorcas lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan of N 80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Bottul

texts.en:
Bottul Z. currently sells beans, cooking oil, mangoes, etc. and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Bottul is 41 years old and is widowed. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Camino A La Luz Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Rosa del Carmen O. H., Blanca Azucena G., María Auxiliadora Chavez y Elena Patricia Mallorquín G..

 El grupo solidario Camino a la Luz, es originario del municipio de Tisma perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la elaboración y venta de cajetas y sacan el producto al mercado.

Las cuatro miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios. 

Doña Rosa del Carmen O. H.,  elabora y vende cajetas y comida en la zona franca cercana, ella ofrece a las personas que trabajan en la empresa, tiene clientes fijos. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa trabaja como chofer de taxi, ella cuida su hijo pequeño y realiza la actividad.
Doña Blanca Azucena G., tiene una mini pulpería en su casa donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad como : arroz, frijoles, queso, pan, gaseosas, etc., ella es madres soltera con tres hijos pequeños que ella mantiene, van a clase a la escuela mas cercana del barrio.
Doña María Auxiliadora C.  tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde ofrece refrescos, helados, hielo, gaseosas, etc. Viva sola con su hijo de 18 años quien ya trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa.
Doña Elena Patricia Mallorquín G., elabora cajetas, arroz con leche, atoles y otros postres, ella los ofrece ambulante en el municipio de Tisma y entrega en el mercado a algunos clientes que le compran al por mayor Tiene un hijo pequeño de un año, ella cuida a su hijo y elabora los dulces y sale a venderlos, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa él trabaja en la agricultura en los sembradíos de tomate.Doña Elena sueña con mejorar su casita que es bien humilde e insegura para el invierno, esto ahora que su hijo es pequeño. Anima a las integrantes del grupo para que los pagos sean puntuales y así tener siempre derecho al crédito.
texts.en:
Photo, from left to right: Rosa del Carmen O. H., Blanca Azucena G., María Auxiliadora Chavez, and Elena Patricia Mallorquín G.. The group "Camino a la Luz" is originally from the Tisma area in the city of Masaya. The group creates and sells sweet caramels called "cajetas" and brings the product to to the market. The four group members have a high level of trust among them. They are neighbors and they have come together to purchase products to get a better price. Rosa del Carmen O. H. makes and sells "cajetas" and food in the "zona franca" (the free port) nearby. She offers her products to the people who work there, and she has regular clients. Her husband helps her with the household expenses and works as a taxi driver. She cares for her small child and works. Blanca Azucena G. has a small general store in her home, where she offers to her customers common products such as: rice, beans, cheese, bread, soft drinks, etc. She is a single mother with three small children whom she cares for. The go to the closest school in the neighborhood. María Auxiliadora C. has a small business in her home where she sells snacks, ice creams, ice, soft drinks, etc. She lives alone with her 18 year-old son who works and helps out with her expenses. Elena Patricia Mallorquín G. makes "cajetas," rice pudding, and atole (a kind of thick drink made with corn flour) and other deserts. She offers these products door-to-door in the Tisma area and delivers them to several wholesale clients in the market. She has one small son, who is one year old. She cares for him, makes her sweets and sells them, while her husband helps with the expenses by working in agriculture planting tomatoes. Elena dreams of improving her small home which is very humble, and securing her home for the winter, all while her son is young. She motivates the members of the group to be punctual with their payments so they can have always have access to these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make cajetas (caramels) and sweets like: rice, sugar, milks, tamarind, cacao, and to be able to offer a variety of sweets to customers

loans.name: Sendiwanyo Oliver ‘S Group

texts.en:
Oliver is the leader of a loan group with 5 members. She is 43-years old and married with three children between 14 and 20 of age. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-room house where she lives with five people. There is electricity, but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Oliver works seven days a week selling charcoal from her home in Mengo MacKay She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells retail and wholesale. Wholesalers deliver the charcoal to her home and don't charge a transport cost. Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity and school fees. She has been in this business for two years, and her main challenges are the increasing prices of charcoal and rent charges. Oliver has been with MCDT for over three years and has worked with the same group mates during that time. She is servicing her fifth loan. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and hopes to own her own business premises.

.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Kara Bet

texts.en:
Kara Bet is 50 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a car repairer for 24 years. Kara Bet decided on this line of work because of his experience, and when he first started his business he didn’t face difficulties. His customers are friends and neighbors, and his business is successful because he does his work well.

Kara Bet has requested a loan of $1500 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase spare parts. This is Kara Bet's second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him to improve his garage.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Yesa

texts.en: V. is forty-three years old and married with two children. V. is a cosmetician, who sells cosmetics and also does make-up for individuals for special events. She has been in this business for four years. Due to an increase in demand, she needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 56 years old. She is married and has two children. One is in schooling and one is working. Her husband has been very supportive in taking care of the children. Theresa works very hard and approaches her business with commitment. For two years, she has been trading in gari sales. Gari is produced from cassava and it is one of the carbohydrate supplements. She obtains her supplies from the farming communities and retails to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy gari in bulk quantities to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to pay her child’s educational fees.

loans.use: To buy bulk quantities of gari.

loans.name: Regina Bayiyana‘S Group

texts.en:
Regina is the leader of a five-member group. She is 47 years old and widowed with six children aged between 20 and 32 years. Only one child goes to school. Regina resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she lives with two people. She also takes care of ten additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Regina resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She lives in Bwaise Katogo zone selling charcoal, water and chickens at her rented shop in Bwaise, one of the Kampala suburbs, and has been in this business for the last twenty-five years. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to all categories of people, excluding children. She works seven days a week, selling mainly on retail. She incurs extra transportation costs to and from shopping or work and does her shopping once a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for both home and business premises. 

Regina has been with MCDT for over eleven years and is servicing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Regina is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
The two people shown in the picture here are Mrs. Khoeun S. and her husband. Khoeun S. is a 27-year-old farmer who lives in Pursat Province. She is married to Mr. Moa Tit, age 26, who works with her in the farming business. He also takes time to find firewood in the forest for income.

This couple currently owns a medium-sized stall that they use for raising pigs and cows. During the coming farming season when the heavy rains immediately begin falling down, that is the best time for Khoeun S. to begin growing her crops. Due to their lack of capital, Khoeun S. would like a loan of US$ 1200 from Kiva’s partner HKL. She will be using her loan to buy two cows in order to alleviate her hard labor on the farm and to buy fertilizer and seed for planting. In the future, she proposes to breed her cows for their young.

loans.use: To buy two cows in order to alleviate her hard labor on the farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, three sons and four daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Mary is a trader, trading in smoked fish. Mary procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices and supplies to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for twenty-five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Maria de los Ángeles A. Hernández  , tiene la edad de 26 años , habita en el barrio El rodeo , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción  , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar   , ellos tienen un hijo de dos añitos a  cargo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Maria desde hace 3 años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, cuando las ventas están bajas es cuando pierde en su inversión es por eso con el financiamiento aumentara su inversión en la compra de frutas y verduras para atraer la captación de nuevos clientes, su anhelo de doña Maria  sueña con poder comprar un camión para poder transportar sus productos a distintos departamentos y poder obtener mejores ganancia ya que llevaría productos a vender y traería mercadería la cual se compra mas barata. Da las gracias a la institución por este financiamiento.

loans.use: Comprara verduras y frutas en variedad

loans.name: Unity Family Group

texts.en:
This is Mabinty C., Posseh K., Sayo K., Cyril I. K. and Fatu C., and they have called their group Unity Family. This is the first loan this group is accessing from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses in size and quality. Consequently, their sales and profit margins will improve – they will then be able to better support their school-aged children in terms of food, clothes, school fees and other school-related charges.

Mabinty C. (second from right) is the leader of this group. Mabinty was born in Magbontho, near Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is 48 years old, and married with seven children who attend primary or secondary school. Mabinty sells palm oil, the most popular cooking oil in Sierra Leone, and has been in this business for more than 25 years. With this loan, she will buy more palm oil, rice and groundnuts/peanuts.

(Attached on the left is a group member who was not present for the group photograph.)

loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice and groundnuts/peanuts

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” Ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, tiene 03 hijos, vive en el Barrio San Martín, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar de ganado ovino  para engorde, ya que también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para ayudar en su hogar.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las charlas
texts.en:
Mrs. Faustina is a member of the communal bank “Vírgen del Rosario” located in Villa Queñuani, Yunguyo District, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno; she is 55 years old, is a widow, and has three kids. She lives in the San Martín neighborhood and she has completed primary school (6th grade). Faustina has been working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for PEN 300, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling cattle. Today, she is requesting a new loan of PEN 500, which will allow her to buy sheep, fatten them up, then resell them. She already raises cows. Faustina's biggest wish is to keep working to help out her family. She loves to save and to have conversations.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sheep

loans.name: Mujeres Habiles 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Habiles (Skillful Women).  Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Josefina lives in a rural community in the province of Puerto Plata with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 6).  They have unreliable access to running water (not potable) and electricity. 

Josefina sells various clothing items to those in her community and the surrounding communities.  She has over 9 years of experience with this business. She has successfully repaid three loans with Esperanza.  She plans to use this fourth loan to purchase more items to sell including shoes, accessories and clothing. Her goal is to be able to have a wide variety of inventory to meet all of her clients' needs. She has been able to use the loans to invest in her business and help it to grow.  Josefina hopes to continue to improve her family's living conditions by growing her business.  She thanks you for helping her achieve her goals!

loans.use: Shoes, accessories and clothes

loans.name: Sarah Lyn

texts.en:
Sarah Lyn B. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Sarah Lyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Sarah Lyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Sarah Lyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sarah Lyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah Lyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sarah Lyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
